original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:üîΩNyƒÅyabindu·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ

original: na ya bindu t'i ka / bod skad du //
analyzed: na ya bindu t'i ka / bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on the Drop of Logic

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: First part

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´!üîΩTo him who speaks the pure path of reasoning

original: gang zhig rigs lam rnam par dag pa dang // rigs mi thus bsgrub bya dag pa mchog gsung ba //
analyzed: gang zhig rigs lam rnam par dag pa dang // rigs mi thus bsgrub bya dag pa mchog gsung ba //
translated: And the supreme purity of what is to be accomplished through reasoning,

original: thub pa smra mchog de la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: thub pa smra mchog de la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: To that sage, the supreme speaker, I pay homage.

original: rigs thigs tshig re nas ni rnam par dbye //
analyzed: rigs thigs tshig re nas ni rnam par dbye //
translated: I shall analyze the Drop of Reasoning word by word.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na /
translated: Since the attainment of all human goals is preceded by correct knowledge,

original: de bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'grel pa dang / dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'grel pa dang / dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
translated: it is taught. This is the meaning. By this first [verse] the commentary on this chapter, the purpose, the subject matter, and the ultimate purpose are taught.

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa med pa dang / dgos pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa'i bstan bcos sam rab tu byed pa ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams khas mi len te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa med pa dang / dgos pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa'i bstan bcos sam rab tu byed pa ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams khas mi len te /
translated: Thus, those who are inclined to think that a treatise or a chapter is without a connection, without a purpose, and without a subject matter, do not accept it.

original: 'di ltar 'dir bshad par bya ba ni ci zhig yin snyam pa'i rmongs pa de bsal ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba bsnyad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir bshad par bya ba ni ci zhig yin snyam pa'i rmongs pa de bsal ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba bsnyad do //
translated: In order to remove the confusion of those who think, ‚ÄúWhat is to be explained here?‚Äù the subject matter is stated.

original: 'bras bu med du dgos pa bsal ba'i phyir dgos pa brjod do //üîΩthabs @2a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu med du dgos pa bsal ba'i phyir dgos pa brjod do // thabs @2a * //
translated: In order to remove the doubt that it is fruitless, the purpose is stated.

original: ma yin du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir 'brel pa bsnyad do //
analyzed: ma yin du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir 'brel pa bsnyad do //
translated: In order to remove the doubt that it is not a means, the connection is stated.

original: de'i phyir nyan pa po spro ba skyed pa'i don du 'brel pa la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan pa po spro ba skyed pa'i don du 'brel pa la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the connection and so on are stated in order to generate enthusiasm in the listener.

original: de la de bstan to zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa sngon du bstan to //
analyzed: de la de bstan to zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa sngon du bstan to //
translated: Here, by the statement, ‚ÄúThat is taught here,‚Äù the subject matter and the purpose are stated first.

original: 'brel pa ni shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni shugs kyis bstan to //
translated: The connection is stated by implication.

original: de la shugs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la shugs ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the implication.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to teach right knowledge,

original: rab tu byed pa rtsom pas /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa rtsom pas /
translated: The treatise is composed in order to teach that.

original: don gyis na rab tu byed pa ni thabs nyid du ston to //
analyzed: don gyis na rab tu byed pa ni thabs nyid du ston to //
translated: Thus, the treatise is taught to be the means by implication.

original: de ltar ma yin na thabs ma yin pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na thabs ma yin pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, how could one engage in the means?

original: de bas na 'brel pa ni don gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'brel pa ni don gyis bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the connection is taught by implication.

original: 'dir yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan to zhes bya ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan to zhes bya ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, the teaching of right knowledge is the subject matter.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of right knowledge is the purpose.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa de ni khong du chung bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa de ni khong du chung bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: That teaching of right knowledge has the nature of being understood.

original: rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas na rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa de'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas na rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa de'i thabs yin no //
translated: Since this chapter does it, this chapter is the means to that purpose.

original: de lta bas na rab tu byed pa dang / dgos par thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rab tu byed pa dang / dgos par thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the treatise and the purpose are connected by the characteristic of means and that to be accomplished by means.

original: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa 'di thos pa las yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma nor bar shes par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa 'di thos pa las yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma nor bar shes par 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, since the nature of correct knowledge is understood without error from hearing this treatise,

original: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin la /
translated: therefore the treatise is the means.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yongs su @2b shes pa ni thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin par gnas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yongs su @2b shes pa ni thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin par gnas so //
translated: And the thorough understanding of correct knowledge is the goal to be accomplished by the means.

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang bya ba dang byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang bya ba dang byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
translated: That very treatise is related to the goal to be accomplished, the definition of the means, and the definition of the nature of the agent and action.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub pa ni rab tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub pa ni rab tu byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the treatise is the means.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The goal to be accomplished is the result.

original: byed pa ni rab tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni rab tu byed pa'o //
translated: The agent is the treatise.

original: bya ba ni 'bras bu yin pas de'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di tsam mo zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'bras bu yin pas de'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di tsam mo zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: The action is the result. Therefore, this treatise is just for the thorough understanding of correct knowledge.

original: de ltar gnas su zin kyang ci ste la la zhig yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su shes pas ci zhig bya ste de ni gang du yang mkho ba med ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gnas su zin kyang ci ste la la zhig yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su shes pas ci zhig bya ste de ni gang du yang mkho ba med ngo //
translated: Even if it does exist, what is the use of understanding it through right knowledge? It is not needed anywhere.üîΩFor the sake of that, you will tire yourself out, like someone trying to examine the teeth of a crow.

original: de'i byir de ni bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin du gnas pa ma yin bar khyod yongs su ngal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dri bar 'gyur pa de'i phyir skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa ni yang dag par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin zhes
analyzed: de'i byir de ni bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin du gnas pa ma yin bar khyod yongs su ngal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dri bar 'gyur pa de'i phyir skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa ni yang dag par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin zhes
translated: Therefore, the accomplishment of all human goals is preceded by right knowledge.

original: pa 'di smos te des ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: pa 'di smos te des ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
translated: This is what is said. By this, the purpose of the purpose is shown.

original: de bas na tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the words.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa las mkho bar gyur pa las de'i phyir bsgrims te de yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa las mkho bar gyur pa las de'i phyir bsgrims te de yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Because right knowledge is needed for the accomplishment of all human goals, therefore one should strive to understand it.

original: de yongs su shes pa ni rab tu byed pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa ni rab tu byed pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: The understanding of that is stated in the treatise.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa mkho bar gyur pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam par bya'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa mkho bar gyur pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam par bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to understand the need for right knowledge, this chapter is begun.

original: de ni re zhig bsdu ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig bsdu ba'i don yin no //
translated: This is the summary meaning.

original: yan lag gi don ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na zhes bya ba la 'dir mi slu ba'i shes ba ni yang dag par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na zhes bya ba la 'dir mi slu ba'i shes ba ni yang dag par shes pa ste /
translated: The branch meaning: because it is preceded by right knowledge. Here, right knowledge is non-deceptive knowledge.

original: gang don byed pa la slu bar mi byed pa yin gyi ma nor ba gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang don byed pa la slu bar mi byed pa yin gyi ma nor ba gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin no //
translated: That which does not deceive in accomplishing the purpose is right knowledge, not just what is non-erroneous.

original: de lta na ni rab tu byed pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs sel bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rab tu byed pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs sel bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were so, this treatise would refute the YogƒÅcƒÅra system.

original: rab tu byed pa ni mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyi rjes su snyegs par 'jug par 'dod do //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ni mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyi rjes su snyegs par 'jug par 'dod do //
translated: The treatise is intended to engage by following the SautrƒÅntika and YogƒÅcƒÅra systems.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga'i lugs bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga'i lugs bsdu ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to include both systems,

original: mi slu ba'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that non-deceptive cognition is right knowledge.

original: gang la yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //
analyzed: gang la yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //
translated: That which is preceded by right knowledge is preceded by right knowledge.

original: sngon gyi sgras ni 'di rgyu yin par brjod de gang gi phyir 'bras bu bas rgyu sva ba de'i @3a * //
analyzed: sngon gyi sgras ni 'di rgyu yin par brjod de gang gi phyir 'bras bu bas rgyu sva ba de'i @3a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúbefore‚Äù indicates that it is the cause, because the cause is prior to the effect.

original: phyir de sngon du zhes brjod de yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩskyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don yin pas na skyes bu'i don to //
analyzed: phyir de sngon du zhes brjod de yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don yin pas na skyes bu'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be preceded by that, meaning it has right knowledge as its cause.üîΩThe accomplishment of all human goals means that it is for the sake of a human goal.

original: don zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dgos pa yin par brjod de skyes bu'i dgos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dgos pa yin par brjod de skyes bu'i dgos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúgoal‚Äù indicates the purpose, meaning for the sake of a human purpose.

original: de ni thams cad kyang yin pa skyes bu'i don yang yin pas skyes bu'i don thams cad de thams cad ces bya ba ni thag nye ba dang / rgyang ring ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: de ni thams cad kyang yin pa skyes bu'i don yang yin pas skyes bu'i don thams cad de thams cad ces bya ba ni thag nye ba dang / rgyang ring ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang /
translated: All means near and far, and likewise mundane and supramundane,

original: de bzhin du dor bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang ; btad snyoms su bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dor bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang ; btad snyoms su bya ba'o //
translated: and likewise to be rejected, to be adopted, and to be cultivated.

original: de la thag nye ba ni gang yul thag nye ba na yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la thag nye ba ni gang yul thag nye ba na yod pa'o //
translated: Among them, near means what exists in a nearby place.

original: rgyang ring ba ni gang thag ring po na yod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyang ring ba ni gang thag ring po na yod pa'o //
translated: Far means what exists in a distant place.

original: 'jig rten ba ni gang 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ba ni gang 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Mundane means what belongs to the category of cyclic existence.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Supramundane means what is called nirvana.

original: dor bar bya ba ni mi 'dod pa ste sbrul dang / tsher ma dang / dug dang / mtshon cha la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dor bar bya ba ni mi 'dod pa ste sbrul dang / tsher ma dang / dug dang / mtshon cha la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: To be rejected means what is undesirable, having the characteristics of a snake, a thorn, poison, a weapon, and so on.

original: blang bar bya ba ni 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba ni 'dod pa ste /
translated: To be adopted means what is desirable.

original: me tog phreng dang / tsan dan dang / gos dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: me tog phreng dang / tsan dan dang / gos dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristics of a garland of flowers, sandalwood, clothing, food, drink, bedding, and seats.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa gnyi ga las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms su bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa gnyi ga las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms su bya ba'o //
translated: Equanimity is the avoidance of both desire and aversion.

original: skyes bu'i don de thams cad kyi rgyu ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don de thams cad kyi rgyu ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: The cause of all of these aims of a person is right knowledge.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum la sogs pa'i shes pas dmigs nas mtshon cha dang / dug dang / tsher ma la sogs pa ni yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum la sogs pa'i shes pas dmigs nas mtshon cha dang / dug dang / tsher ma la sogs pa ni yongs su spong ngo //
translated: For, having observed with such knowledge as perception, one avoids weapons, poison, thorns, and so on.

original: me tog phreng la sogs pa ni len to //
analyzed: me tog phreng la sogs pa ni len to //
translated: One accepts a garland of flowers, and so on.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan dag la ni btang snyoms su byed do //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan dag la ni btang snyoms su byed do //
translated: One is indifferent to what is neither of these two.

original: skyes bu'i don thams cad grub pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don thams cad grub pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of all the aims of a person is the accomplishment of all the aims of a person.

original: 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir grub par byed pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir grub par byed pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúaccomplishment‚Äù here is used in the sense of ‚Äúaccomplisher.‚Äù

original: des ni 'di skad du skyes bu'i don grub par nges pa dang ldan pa gang ci snyed ba de thams cad kyi rgyu ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du skyes bu'i don grub par nges pa dang ldan pa gang ci snyed ba de thams cad kyi rgyu ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This passage shows that the cause of all those who possess the certainty of accomplishing the aims of beings is right knowledge.

original: yin pas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don yin la gang de ni rtag tu 'brel te /
analyzed: yin pas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don yin la gang de ni rtag tu 'brel te /
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúbecause of that.‚ÄùüîΩThis passage shows that it is taught because right knowledge is the antecedent of all the aims of beings.

original: des na 'di skad du gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du btang ba can @3b yin pa de'i phyir de bstan to zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di skad du gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du btang ba can @3b yin pa de'i phyir de bstan to zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is taught‚Äù means that right knowledge is taught.

original: de bstan to zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i shes pa dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan to zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i shes pa dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúright knowledge.‚Äù

original: ma ning gi rtags kyis bstan pa dang gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ning gi rtags kyis bstan pa dang gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The neuter affix is used because it is taught and because it is primary.

original: 'das ma thag pa yin yang skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa yin yang skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: Even though it is the most recent, it is not the accomplishment of all the aims of beings.

original: dngos su na gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su na gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the principal one.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa de ni log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas nor bar shes bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa de ni log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas nor bar shes bar byed do //
translated: That right knowledge is to be known as nonerroneous because it eliminates the four kinds of erroneous conception.

original: log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi ni grangs la log par rtog pa dang / rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa dang / spyod yul la log par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu la log par rtog pa'o //üîΩde la grangs la log par rtog pa ni kha cig gi ni gcig ste /
analyzed: log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi ni grangs la log par rtog pa dang / rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa dang / spyod yul la log par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu la log par rtog pa'o // de la grangs la log par rtog pa ni kha cig gi ni gcig ste /
translated: The four kinds of erroneous conception are: erroneous conception regarding number, erroneous conception regarding intrinsic nature, erroneous conception regarding the domain of experience, and erroneous conception regarding result.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Erroneous conception regarding number is as follows: for some, there is one,

original: phur bu pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: phur bu pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the Nirgranthas.

original: kha cig gi ni gsum ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig gi ni gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: For some, there are three,

original: grangs can pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: grangs can pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the Samkhyas.

original: rigs pa can rnams kyi ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams kyi ni bzhi'o //
translated: For the NaiyƒÅyikas, there are four.

original: spyod pa can rnams kyi ni drug go //üîΩrang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod pa can rnams kyi ni drug go // rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: For the CarvƒÅkas, there are six.

original: kha cig ni mngon sum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon sum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Erroneous conception regarding intrinsic nature is as follows: for some, direct perception is conceptual.

original: kha cig ni rnam par rtog pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam par rtog pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some are like those who have no concepts.

original: yul la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yul la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Misconception about the object is like this:

original: kha cig gis ni mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: Some say that the object of direct perception is only the particular,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na'o zhes brjod la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na'o zhes brjod la /
translated: and the object of inference is only the universal.

original: gzhan dag gis gzhan du brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis gzhan du brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Others say the opposite.

original: 'bras bu la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Misconception about the result is like this:

original: kha cig ni tshad ma las 'bras bu tha dad par khas len la /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshad ma las 'bras bu tha dad par khas len la /
translated: Some accept that the result is different from the valid means of knowledge,

original: kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin par khas len pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin par khas len pa lta bu'o //
translated: and some accept that it is not different.

original: de lta bas na de lta bu'i log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas rnam pa thams cad du ma nor bar yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta bu'i log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas rnam pa thams cad du ma nor bar yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by removing these four kinds of misconceptions, the nature of unmistaken, correct knowledge is taught in all aspects.

original: de la re zhig dang po kho nar grangs la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po kho nar grangs la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To begin with, in order to remove misconception about number,üîΩhe says,

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Right knowledge is twofold.

original: 'di la rnam pa gnyis yod pas na 'di ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa gnyis yod pas na 'di ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold because it has two aspects.

original: grangs kyi tshig smos pa nyid kyis ni rnam pa gnyis kho na'o zhes rnam par mngon te /
analyzed: grangs kyi tshig smos pa nyid kyis ni rnam pa gnyis kho na'o zhes rnam par mngon te /
translated: The very use of the numeral ‚Äútwo‚Äù makes it clear that there are only two aspects.

original: des na rnam pa gcig dang / rnam pa gsum la sogs pa bsal ba yin no //üîΩgrangs tsam gyis rnam pa gnyis su bstan gyi /
analyzed: des na rnam pa gcig dang / rnam pa gsum la sogs pa bsal ba yin no // grangs tsam gyis rnam pa gnyis su bstan gyi /
translated: Thus, the one aspect and the three aspects, etc., are excluded.

original: rnam pa gnyis @4a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis @4a * //
translated: The two aspects are taught by the mere numeral ‚Äútwo.‚ÄùüîΩBut since it is not known which are the two aspects,

original: po gang gis yin pa ni mi shes pas de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o zhes bye brag gis bstan to //
analyzed: po gang gis yin pa ni mi shes pas de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o zhes bye brag gis bstan to //
translated: it is taught by way of distinction: perception and inference.

original: dbang po la brtan pa ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: dbang po la brtan pa ni mngon sum ste /
translated: Perception is based on the sense faculties.

original: nges pa'i tshig 'di ni yul las shes pas mngon sum du byed pa nyid mtshon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig 'di ni yul las shes pas mngon sum du byed pa nyid mtshon par byed pa ste /
translated: This etymological explanation shows that perception is so called because it makes the object manifest through knowledge.

original: dper na 'gro bas na ba lang ngo zhes bya ba de la 'gro bas ni ba lang nyid nye bar mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: dper na 'gro bas na ba lang ngo zhes bya ba de la 'gro bas ni ba lang nyid nye bar mtshon par byed de /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúIt is a cow because it moves,‚Äù in this case, the moving shows that it is a cow.

original: de bas na ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i ril po la ba lang gi sgrar rjod par byed pa yin par ston par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dbang po la brten pa nyid kyis na yul la shes pas mngon sum du byed pa nyid mtshon nas
analyzed: de bas na ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i ril po la ba lang gi sgrar rjod par byed pa yin par ston par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dbang po la brten pa nyid kyis na yul la shes pas mngon sum du byed pa nyid mtshon nas
translated: Therefore, just as the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is used to refer to the whole that possesses cowness, in the same way, here, the word ‚Äúperception‚Äù is used to refer to the cognition of an object by a sense faculty.

original: rnam pa bzhi char yang mngon sum du brjod par ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi char yang mngon sum du brjod par ston to //
translated: This shows that all four types of perception are called ‚Äúperception.‚Äù

original: 'dis dpog pas na dpag pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis dpog pas na dpag pa ste /
translated: Inference is that by which one infers.

original: yongs su gcod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it determines.

original: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyis shes par bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyis shes par bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúafter‚Äù means ‚Äúsubsequently.‚Äù

original: phyis dpog pa ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: phyis dpog pa ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Inference is that by which one infers subsequently.

original: phyogs kyi chos 'dzin pa dang / 'brel pa dran ba sngon du btang pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos 'dzin pa dang / 'brel pa dran ba sngon du btang pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is preceded by the apprehension of the property of the position and the recollection of the relation.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o zhes rnam par dbye ba tha dad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o zhes rnam par dbye ba tha dad par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúPerception and inference‚Äù is taught as a different classification.

original: don gyis na yul tha dad par ston te /
analyzed: don gyis na yul tha dad par ston te /
translated: By implication, it teaches that they have different objects.

original: ji ltar de gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba tha dad pa de bzhin du yul yang tha dad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba tha dad pa de bzhin du yul yang tha dad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that just as the two are different in terms of their aspects, so too are their objects different.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum stobs mtshungs pa nyid du sdud do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum stobs mtshungs pa nyid du sdud do //
translated: It includes inference, which is equal in strength to direct perception.

original: ji ltar mngon sum don gyis skyed par byed pa yin pas mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum don gyis skyed par byed pa yin pas mi slu ba ste /
translated: Just as direct perception is nondeceptive because it is produced by its object,

original: de'i phyir tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba gnyis kyis don dang 'brel pas mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba gnyis kyis don dang 'brel pas mi slu ba ste /
translated: in the same way, inference is also nondeceptive because it is related to its object by means of both its nature and its origin.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition.

original: de ltar yin na gang la la dag tshad ma thams cad kyi gtso bo ni mngon sum yin no zhes brjod pa de bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na gang la la dag tshad ma thams cad kyi gtso bo ni mngon sum yin no zhes brjod pa de bsal ba yin te /
translated: If that is so, then it refutes those who say that direct perception is the chief of all valid cognitions.

original: gnyis ka yang mi slu ba kho nar ni 'dra na /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang mi slu ba kho nar ni 'dra na /
translated: If both are equal in being nondeceptive,

original: mngon sum gtso bo nyid yin no zhes su nyid kyis byas /
analyzed: mngon sum gtso bo nyid yin no zhes su nyid kyis byas /
translated: why did the master himself say that direct perception is the chief?

original: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate misconceptions about its nature,

original: de la mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúPerception is free from conceptuality and is non-erroneous.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgar ba'i don te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgar ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthere‚Äù has the sense of exclusion.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa gnyis las 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon sum dpag par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa gnyis las 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon sum dpag par byed do //
translated: Among the two kinds of valid cognition, perception is to be understood as having the characteristics that will be stated below.

original: mngon sum zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúperception‚Äù indicates the basis of the characteristic.

original: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o zhes bya bas ni mtshan @4b nyid bstan te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o zhes bya bas ni mtshan @4b nyid bstan te /
translated: The words ‚Äúfree from conceptuality and non-erroneous‚Äù indicate the characteristic.

original: des na 'di skad du rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is taught: ‚ÄúWhatever is free from conceptuality and non-erroneous should be understood as perception.‚Äù

original: de ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: That is the summarized meaning.

original: yan lag gi don ni rtog pa rnams dang bral ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni rtog pa rnams dang bral ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The subsidiary meaning: ‚ÄúFree from conceptuality‚Äù means free from conceptualization.

original: rtog pa dang bye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: rtog pa dang bye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from conceptuality‚Äù means ‚Äúfree from discursiveness.‚Äù

original: / yang na rtog pas 'bras ba ni rtog pa dang bral pa ste /
analyzed: / yang na rtog pas 'bras ba ni rtog pa dang bral pa ste /
translated: Or else, the phrase ‚Äúfree from conceptuality‚Äù means ‚Äúfree from the result of conceptuality.‚Äù

original: rtog pas spang zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pas spang zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from discursiveness‚Äù means ‚Äúfree from the cause of conceptuality.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa med ba ni ma 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med ba ni ma 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from error‚Äù means ‚Äúnon-erroneous.‚Äù

original: thob par byed pa'i yul la phyin ci ma log ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thob par byed pa'i yul la phyin ci ma log ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnon-erroneous‚Äù means ‚Äúnon-inverted with regard to the object that is to be attained.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir bye brag gnyis smras she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bye brag gnyis smras she na /
translated: Why are two distinctions mentioned?

original: smras pa ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni re zhig rab rib can gyi shes pa 'khrul pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni re zhig rab rib can gyi shes pa 'khrul pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúnon-erroneous‚Äù excludes the consciousness of one with eye-disease, which is erroneous.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa ni rjes su dpag pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa ni rjes su dpag pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúfree from conceptuality‚Äù excludes inference.

original: 'di ltar ma 'khrul pa nyid ni thob par byed pa'i yul la khas blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'khrul pa nyid ni thob par byed pa'i yul la khas blang bar bya'i /
translated: Thus, non-erroneousness should be accepted with regard to the object that is to be attained,

original: dmigs pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with regard to the object that is perceived.

original: gal te dmigs pa'i yul la ma 'khrul pa nyid khas len na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i yul la ma 'khrul pa nyid khas len na /
translated: If non-erroneousness is accepted with regard to the object that is perceived,üîΩthen

original: des ni 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs gsal bar byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs gsal bar byas par 'gyur te /
translated: This clarifies the YogƒÅcƒÅra system.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa'i ni dmigs pa'i shes pa thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa'i ni dmigs pa'i shes pa thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: Thus, the YogƒÅcƒÅra assert that all consciousnesses that apprehend objects are erroneous.

original: de bas na de'i lugs sel bar rab tu byed pa ni rtsom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i lugs sel bar rab tu byed pa ni rtsom par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the treatise is composed to refute their system.

original: rab tu byed pa ni mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rjes su snyegs par rtsom par 'dod la /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ni mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rjes su snyegs par rtsom par 'dod la /
translated: The treatise is composed to follow the SautrƒÅntikas and YogƒÅcƒÅras,

original: gnyi ga yang thob par byed pa'i yul la mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid la ni ma 'khrul ba yin par khas lan to //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang thob par byed pa'i yul la mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid la ni ma 'khrul ba yin par khas lan to //
translated: and both assert that nonerror is the characteristic of nondeception with regard to the object that is to be obtained.

original: de lta yin na go rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /üîΩde yang mi slu ba nyid du ma 'khrul par 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta yin na go rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur te / de yang mi slu ba nyid du ma 'khrul par 'dod do //
translated: If that is so, it follows that inference would also be direct perception,üîΩbecause it is asserted that inference is nondeceptive and nonerroneous.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that, the treatise states, ‚Äúfree from conceptuality.‚Äù

original: de bas na bye brag gnyi ga smos dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na bye brag gnyi ga smos dgos so //
translated: Therefore it is necessary to state both the general and specific characteristics.

original: grub pa'i mtha' la grags pa'i rtog pa bsal zhing /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' la grags pa'i rtog pa bsal zhing /
translated: The concepts that are renowned in philosophical tenets are cleared away.üîΩ

original: 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa ni shes pa la brjod pa dang / 'drer rung ba snang ba ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa ni shes pa la brjod pa dang / 'drer rung ba snang ba ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to eliminate the conceptual thought of the philosophical schools and to teach the conceptual thought of the world, he says: Conceptual thought is said to be cognition and the appearance of what is suitable to be mixed with verbalization.

original: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste smra bar byed pas ni sgra'i spyi'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste smra bar byed pas ni sgra'i spyi'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Since it causes the expression of meaning, it is said to be verbalization. Since it causes speech, it is the general nature of sound.

original: brjod pa dang 'dre ba ni brjod pa dang 'dre ba ste 'dre ba ni 'brel pa la bya'o //üîΩbrjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba @5a * //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dre ba ni brjod pa dang 'dre ba ste 'dre ba ni 'brel pa la bya'o // brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba @5a * //
translated: That which is mixed with verbalization is mixed with verbalization. Mixing is to be taken as connection.

original: ste don gyi phyi yin no //
analyzed: ste don gyi phyi yin no //
translated: That which is suitable to be mixed with verbalization is suitable to be mixed with verbalization. It is the meaning of the suffix.

original: de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir brjod par nus kyi /
analyzed: de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir brjod par nus kyi /
translated: Since it is pervaded by the possession of forward and reverse pervasion, it can be expressed.

original: don gyi bye brag rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo ni brjod par mi nus te de khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi bye brag rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo ni brjod par mi nus te de khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the particular meaning, the nature of the definition of its own nature, cannot be expressed because it is not a pervader.

original: shes pa gang la brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba dang snang ba de ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang la brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba dang snang ba de ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba yin te /
translated: That which appears as the object of a cognition, as suitable to be associated with verbal expression, is the appearance of the object as suitable to be associated with verbal expression.

original: don gyi spyi'i don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don gyi spyi'i don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means the universal of the object, the aspect of the object.

original: gzhan yang de ni brjod par bya ba yin pas rjod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ni brjod par bya ba yin pas rjod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the object of verbal expression, therefore it is verbalized.

original: bsnyad par bya ba don gyi spyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyad par bya ba don gyi spyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the universal of the object, the object to be expressed.

original: brjod pa dang 'dre ba ni brjod pa dang 'dre ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dre ba ni brjod pa dang 'dre ba'o //
translated: Being associated with verbal expression is being associated with verbal expression.

original: brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ste sgra'i spyi'i yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ste sgra'i spyi'i yin no //
translated: Being suitable to be associated with verbal expression is being suitable to be associated with verbal expression, which is the universal of sound.

original: des ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'thad pa nyid kyi don brjod par nus kyi /
analyzed: des ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'thad pa nyid kyi don brjod par nus kyi /
translated: This is able to express the meaning of the establishment of positive and negative concomitance.

original: sgra'i bye brag gis ni mi nus te de thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i bye brag gis ni mi nus te de thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But a particular sound is not able to do that, because it is not shared.

original: shes pa gang la brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba de ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang la brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba de ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba yin te /
translated: That which appears as the object of a cognition, as suitable to be associated with verbal expression, is the appearance of the object as suitable to be associated with verbal expression.

original: sgra'i spyi'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i spyi'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúgeneral aspect of sound‚Äù is the same as the term ‚Äúgeneral aspect of object.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa de gnyi ga yang brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig zur gnyis su bshad pa 'dis bstan par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa de gnyi ga yang brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig zur gnyis su bshad pa 'dis bstan par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that both of these types of conceptualization are indicated by the two phrases ‚Äúappearance‚Äù and ‚Äúsuitable to be mixed with verbal expression.‚Äù

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa ste blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa ste blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Cognition‚Äù means awareness, which is to say, the mind.

original: de dang bral ba'o zhes ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de dang bral ba'o zhes ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Free from that‚Äù means free from conceptualization.

original: rtog pa'i 'dam rdza ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa'i 'dam rdza ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúfree from the mud and mire of conceptualization‚Äù is the same as the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúfree from conceptualization.‚Äù

original: des ni 'di skad du sgra dang don gyi spyi'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du sgra dang don gyi spyi'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This passage indicates that a cognition that is not the general aspect of sound or the general aspect of object is a direct perceptual valid cognition.

original: rab rib dang / myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa la sogs pas 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba la rab rib ces bya ba ni mig gi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib dang / myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa la sogs pas 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba la rab rib ces bya ba ni mig gi gnod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEye disease‚Äù means an eye disorder.

original: myur du bskor ba zhes bya ba ni mgal me bskor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: myur du bskor ba zhes bya ba ni mgal me bskor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRapid motion‚Äù means, for example, the whirling of a firebrand.

original: grur zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni grus 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: grur zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni grus 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA boat‚Äù means traveling by boat.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rlung dang ma khris pa 'khrugs pas khams ma snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rlung dang ma khris pa 'khrugs pas khams ma snyoms pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConfusion‚Äù means an imbalance of the elements due to wind or bile disorders.

original: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa ni rab rib dang / myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa ni rab rib dang / myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang 'khrul pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEye disease, rapid motion, a boat, and confusion‚Äù means eye disease, rapid motion, a boat, and confusion.

original: de bshad la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni rab rib dang / myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bshad la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni rab rib dang / myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd so on‚Äù means eye disease, rapid motion, a boat, confusion, and so on.

original: sogs @5b pa'i sgras ni mig sngon por gyur pa dang / ser bor mthong ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs @5b pa'i sgras ni mig sngon por gyur pa dang / ser bor mthong ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the perception of blue eyes, yellow eyes, and so on.

original: gang la 'khrul ba skyed pa yod pa de ni 'khrul pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'khrul ba skyed pa yod pa de ni 'khrul pa skyed pa'o //
translated: That which produces error is the cause of error.

original: 'khrul pa skyed pa med pa de ni 'khrul pa mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa skyed pa med pa de ni 'khrul pa mi skye ba ste /
translated: That which does not produce error is not the cause of error.üîΩThe absence of error is not the cause of error, because it does not produce error.

original: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa dag gis 'khrul pa mi skyed pa ni rab rib dang / myur du bskor pa dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa dag 'khrug pa dag gis mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa dag gis 'khrul pa mi skyed pa ni rab rib dang / myur du bskor pa dang / grur zhugs pa dang / 'khrul pa dag 'khrug pa dag gis mi skyed pa'o //
translated: The absence of error is not the cause of error, because it does not produce error.

original: 'di ltar rab rib kyi gnod pa ni zla ba la gnyis su mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab rib kyi gnod pa ni zla ba la gnyis su mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the impairment of vision causes the perception of two moons.

original: myur du bskor ba ni mgal me la 'khor lo'o 'byung ngo //
analyzed: myur du bskor ba ni mgal me la 'khor lo'o 'byung ngo //
translated: The rapid spinning of a firebrand produces the appearance of a circle of fire.

original: grur zhugs ste 'gro bas ni chu dogs kyi shing 'gro bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: grur zhugs ste 'gro bas ni chu dogs kyi shing 'gro bar mthong ngo //
translated: The movement of trees on the bank of a river is perceived as the movement of the water itself by someone who has just embarked in a boat.

original: rlung dang mkhris ba la sogs pa 'khrugs pas ni dngos po 'bar ba la sogs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris ba la sogs pa 'khrugs pas ni dngos po 'bar ba la sogs par mthong ngo //
translated: One sees things as burning, etc., through the disturbance of the wind, bile, etc.

original: shes pa ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba la mdo las shes pa ma smos par ji ltar rnyed ce na /
analyzed: shes pa ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba la mdo las shes pa ma smos par ji ltar rnyed ce na /
translated: Consciousness is direct perception. How is it known that the Sutra does not mention consciousness?

original: rtog pa ni shes pa kho na dang 'brel la 'khrul ba yang shes pa'i chos yin pas ma mthong te /
analyzed: rtog pa ni shes pa kho na dang 'brel la 'khrul ba yang shes pa'i chos yin pas ma mthong te /
translated: Imagination is related only to consciousness, and error is a property of consciousness.

original: de lta bas na rtog pa dang 'brel ba dang ma 'khrul pa ni shes pa kho na la bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtog pa dang 'brel ba dang ma 'khrul pa ni shes pa kho na la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is related to imagination and is nonerroneous is to be understood as consciousness alone.

original: dper na be'u med pa'i dus ma khrid de shog cig ces byas na /
analyzed: dper na be'u med pa'i dus ma khrid de shog cig ces byas na /
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúBring the calf‚Äôs mother,‚Äù

original: rta rgod ma khrid de mi 'ong gi drus ma khrid de 'ong bas 'di ltar de nyid be'u dang 'brel bar mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rta rgod ma khrid de mi 'ong gi drus ma khrid de 'ong bas 'di ltar de nyid be'u dang 'brel bar mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: one does not bring the cow that is not related to the calf, but one brings the cow that is related to the calf.

original: 'dir yang rtog pa dang 'khrul pa ni shes pa kho na dang 'brel par mthong gi gzhan dag ni ma yin pas shes pa kho na mngon sum du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir yang rtog pa dang 'khrul pa ni shes pa kho na dang 'brel par mthong gi gzhan dag ni ma yin pas shes pa kho na mngon sum du 'dod do //
translated: In the same way, here, imagination and error are seen to be related only to consciousness, not to anything else. Therefore, consciousness alone is accepted as direct perception.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni mngon sum zhes bsnyad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni mngon sum zhes bsnyad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The four kinds of direct perception are:

original: de ni dbang po las byung ba dang / yid dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa dang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dbang po las byung ba dang / yid dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa dang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: 1. that which arises from the sense faculties, 2. mental, 3. self-awareness, and 4. yogic perception.

original: log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba 'di bstan te /
analyzed: log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba 'di bstan te /
translated: This classification is taught in order to eliminate false notions.

original: kha cig ni dbang po nyid mthong ba po yin par 'dod pas de bsal ba'i phyir ni dang po ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang po nyid mthong ba po yin par 'dod pas de bsal ba'i phyir ni dang po ste /
translated: Some believe that the sense faculties themselves are the perceiver. In order to eliminate that notion, the first kind of direct perception is taught.

original: dbang po las byung ba'i shes pa mngon sum yin gyi dbang po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba'i shes pa mngon sum yin gyi dbang po ni ma yin no //
translated: The direct perception that arises from the sense faculties is the perceiver, not the sense faculties themselves.

original: kha cig ni yid kyis mngon sum la skyon 'dogs te ;
analyzed: kha cig ni yid kyis mngon sum la skyon 'dogs te ;
translated: Some believe that mental direct perception is faulty.

original: de'i phyir skyon de yongs su spang ba'i ched du gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon de yongs su spang ba'i ched du gnyis pa'o //
translated: In order to eliminate that notion, the second kind of direct perception is taught.

original: kha cig ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rang rig pa khas mi len te /
analyzed: kha cig ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rang rig pa khas mi len te /
translated: Some do not accept that the mind and mental factors are self-aware.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir gsum pa'o //
translated: In order to eliminate that notion, the third kind of direct perception is taught.

original: kha cig ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis mngon sum khas mi len te /üîΩde bsal ba'i phyir mngon sum bzhi pa smos so //
analyzed: kha cig ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis mngon sum khas mi len te / de bsal ba'i phyir mngon sum bzhi pa smos so //
translated: Some do not accept that yogis have direct perception.

original: dbang @6a * //
analyzed: dbang @6a * //
translated: In order to refute that, the fourth type of direct perception is mentioned.

original: po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams la dbang por 'dod kyi dbang po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams la dbang por 'dod kyi dbang po ni ma yin no //
translated: The five sense faculties are accepted as faculties, but they are not faculties.

original: yid kyi mngon sum ni logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum ni logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mental direct perception is taught separately.

original: de bas na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa ni dbang po las byung ba'i mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa ni dbang po las byung ba'i mngon sum yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that is based on the eye faculty and so on is direct perception that arises from the faculties.üîΩThe immediately preceding object is the object that immediately precedes it.üîΩIt is the direct cause of the consciousness that arises from the sense faculty.

original: rang gi yul gyis de ma thag tu yul lhan cig byed pa can dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyis de ma thag tu yul lhan cig byed pa can dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ste /
translated: It is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousness.

original: rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin gyi /üîΩrnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni der rang gi yang yin la yul yang yin pas rang gi yul te /
analyzed: rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin gyi / rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni der rang gi yang yin la yul yang yin pas rang gi yul te /
translated: It is generated by the condition.üîΩConsciousness means that it is its own object, and therefore it is its own object.

original: bdag gi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the referent object of itself.

original: rang yul gyi de ma thag ba ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: rang yul gyi de ma thag ba ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa ste /
translated: The immediately preceding object of itself is the immediately preceding object of its own object.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa las byung ba nyid dang 'dra ba la ni de ma thag pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa las byung ba nyid dang 'dra ba la ni de ma thag pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: That which is similar to the second moment is called the immediately preceding condition.

original: de ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yang yin la yul yang yin pas rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yul lo //
analyzed: de ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yang yin la yul yang yin pas rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yul lo //
translated: It is the immediately preceding object of its own object, and it is an object.

original: dbang po'i shes pa gang la de lhan cig byed pa yod pa de ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yul gyi lhan cig byed pa can dbang po'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa gang la de lhan cig byed pa yod pa de ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yul gyi lhan cig byed pa can dbang po'i shes pa ste /
translated: That which has the immediately preceding object of its own object as its object is the sense consciousness that has the immediately preceding object of its own object as its object.

original: dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa des skyed pa gang yin pa de ni yid tsam la brten pa'i phyir yid kyi mngon sum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa des skyed pa gang yin pa de ni yid tsam la brten pa'i phyir yid kyi mngon sum zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is produced by that sense consciousness that is the immediately preceding condition of the similar sense consciousness is called mental direct perception because it is based on the mere mental faculty.

original: 'dir rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yul zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog par byed pa ma yin pa'i skyon dang / rigs mi mthun pa'i yul la 'dzin pa'i skyon yang yongs su spangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa yul zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog par byed pa ma yin pa'i skyon dang / rigs mi mthun pa'i yul la 'dzin pa'i skyon yang yongs su spangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúobject‚Äù for the immediate object should be understood to completely avoid the fault of not conceiving the object because it is apprehended and the fault of apprehending an object of a dissimilar type.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi mngon sum de ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la skye ba gang yin pa de'i yul de yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi mngon sum de ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la skye ba gang yin pa de'i yul de yin par 'dod do //
translated: Thus mental direct perception is asserted to have as its object that which arises in the second moment immediately after the object of a sense consciousness.

original: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par thal ba'i nyes pa yang yongs su lta ga la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par thal ba'i nyes pa yang yongs su lta ga la 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore how could the fault of the nonexistence of apprehended object and apprehending subject arise?

original: gang gi tshe de ma thag pa'i sgra rigs mthun pa la yang bya ba de'i cha rigs mi mthun pa'i yul la 'dzin par yang thal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ma thag pa'i sgra rigs mthun pa la yang bya ba de'i cha rigs mi mthun pa'i yul la 'dzin par yang thal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: When the term ‚Äúimmediate‚Äù is applied to a similar type, how could it follow that it apprehends an object of a dissimilar type?

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa zhes bya pa'i tha tshig des ni long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal ba'i nyes pa yang yongs su spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa zhes bya pa'i tha tshig des ni long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal ba'i nyes pa yang yongs su spangs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúproduced by the immediately preceding condition of a sense consciousness‚Äù means that the fault of the blind and deaf not existing is completely avoided.

original: long ba dang 'on pa gnyis kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni mtshungs ba de ma thag pa'i rkyen dbang po'i rnam par shes pa med do //üîΩde bas na gang la la dag na re yid kyi rnam par shes pas phyi @6b rol gyi yul mngon sum du byed par khas len na /
analyzed: long ba dang 'on pa gnyis kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni mtshungs ba de ma thag pa'i rkyen dbang po'i rnam par shes pa med do // de bas na gang la la dag na re yid kyi rnam par shes pas phyi @6b rol gyi yul mngon sum du byed par khas len na /
translated: For the mental consciousness of the blind and deaf does not have the immediately preceding condition of a sense consciousness.

original: 'di ltar long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de yongs su spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de yongs su spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who claim that mental consciousness perceives external objects should understand that the fault of the blind and deaf not existing is completely avoided.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i thams cad rang rig ba zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kyang yin la sems dang sems las byung ba yang yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i thams cad rang rig ba zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kyang yin la sems dang sems las byung ba yang yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do //
translated: All minds and mental factors are called ‚Äúself-awareness‚Äù because they are all minds and mental factors.

original: thams cad ces smos pa ni nor ba'i shes pa rnams kyang yongs su bsdus te /
analyzed: thams cad ces smos pa ni nor ba'i shes pa rnams kyang yongs su bsdus te /
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù includes mistaken consciousnesses.

original: de dag gis rang gi ngo bo rab tu gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rang gi rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis rang gi ngo bo rab tu gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rang gi rig pa yin no //
translated: The clarity of their own nature is self-awareness.

original: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rig par byed bzhin du skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rig par byed bzhin du skye ste /
translated: Thus all minds and mental factors arise in such a way that they are aware of their own nature, because they have the nature of being aware of their objects.

original: dper na mar me ni rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa bzhin du skye'i /
analyzed: dper na mar me ni rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa bzhin du skye'i /
translated: For example, a lamp arises in such a way that it illuminates itself, because it has the nature of being an illuminator.

original: rang gi ngo bo rab tu gsal bar bya ba la mar me gzhan la mi ltos so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rab tu gsal bar bya ba la mar me gzhan la mi ltos so //
translated: But the lamp does not depend on another lamp to illuminate itself.

original: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang rang gi ngo bo rtogs par bya ba la shes pa gzhan la mi ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang rang gi ngo bo rtogs par bya ba la shes pa gzhan la mi ltos pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, minds and mental factors do not depend on another cognition to realize their own nature.

original: de'i phyir rang grub pa'i ngo bo rnams ni bdag nyid la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang grub pa'i ngo bo rnams ni bdag nyid la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those that are established by themselves are direct perception with regard to themselves.üîΩThe cognition of a yogi that arises from the culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the valid knowledge of inference.

original: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' las byung ba rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' las byung ba rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don te /
translated: The perfect meaning is the unmistaken meaning,üîΩthe four noble truths.üîΩMeditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.üîΩMeditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
translated: The perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.üîΩMeditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.üîΩThe perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.üîΩMeditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.üîΩThe perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.üîΩMeditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.üîΩThe perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.üîΩMeditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.üîΩThe perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.

original: de bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: de bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa ste /
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.üîΩThe perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.

original: bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.üîΩThe perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.üîΩMeditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.üîΩThe perfect meaning is the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on that is the meditation on the perfect meaning.üîΩMeditation is the cultivation of that.üîΩThe culmination of the meditation on the perfect meaning is the cognition of a yogi.

original: de'i rab ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' las byung ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ste /üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de'i rab ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' las byung ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ste /üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The perfect meaning

original: de'i mtha' ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' ste /
translated: The limit of that is the limit of the highest meditation on the meaning of reality.

original: mtha' ni chos kyi mchog chos so //
analyzed: mtha' ni chos kyi mchog chos so //
translated: The limit is the supreme mundane state.

original: de las skyes pa ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from that is that which arises from the limit of the highest meditation on the meaning of reality.

original: rnal 'byor ni ring nge 'dzin la bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ring nge 'dzin la bya'o //
translated: Yoga is concentration.

original: de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor ba rnams so //
analyzed: de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor ba rnams so //
translated: Those who have that are yogis.

original: de dag gi shes pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: Their knowledge is the knowledge of yogis.

original: 'di ltar de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba ni byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams gsal bar snang ba dang / ma nor ba'i rnam pa dang ldan par 'byung ste /üîΩdper na lha la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shes pa 'byung @7a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba ni byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams gsal bar snang ba dang / ma nor ba'i rnam pa dang ldan par 'byung ste / dper na lha la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shes pa 'byung @7a * //
translated: Thus, knowledge that arises by the power of meditating on that arises in the aspect of unmistaken appearance of things that have arisen, are arising, and will arise.

original: ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rnam pa can ma nor bar 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rnam pa can ma nor bar 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, knowledge that arises through the blessing of gods and so on arises in the aspect of things that have arisen, are arising, and will arise without error.

original: rnal 'byor gyi mthus bsam gtan ba rnams kyi shes pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / thag ring ba dang / bar du chod pa dang / phra mo'i dngos po yul gsal bar snang zhing ma nor ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi mthus bsam gtan ba rnams kyi shes pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / thag ring ba dang / bar du chod pa dang / phra mo'i dngos po yul gsal bar snang zhing ma nor ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa 'byung ste /
translated: By the power of yoga, the cognition of contemplatives has the aspect of clearly perceiving and not erring with respect to objects that are past, future, distant, obstructed, or subtle.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted as a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni sems rtse gcig pa lhag ba med pa thob pa rnal 'byor ba'i dbang phyug rnams kyi shes pas dngos po byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul dang ldan pa ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dag ma nor bar ston pa'i rgyu yin ba'i phyir tshad ma yin te 'byung po dang gdon khyad par can babs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni sems rtse gcig pa lhag ba med pa thob pa rnal 'byor ba'i dbang phyug rnams kyi shes pas dngos po byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul dang ldan pa ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dag ma nor bar ston pa'i rgyu yin ba'i phyir tshad ma yin te 'byung po dang gdon khyad par can babs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, the syllogism is: The cognition of the masters of yoga, who have attained one-pointed concentration free from faults, is a valid cognition with respect to the objects that have arisen and will arise, because it is the cause for unerringly teaching the infinite things that have arisen and will arise, like the cognition of a spirit or a special demon that has entered the body.

original: gang dag tshad mar mi rung ba bzhin byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dag ma nor bar ston pa'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag tshad mar mi rung ba bzhin byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dag ma nor bar ston pa'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it would not be the cause of unerringly teaching the immeasurable things that have occurred and will occur, just as it is not a valid cognition.

original: dper na smyon pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smyon pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the consciousness of a madman.

original: thob par byed pa med na byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dag ma nor bar ston pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i don yin no //
analyzed: thob par byed pa med na byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dag ma nor bar ston pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the refuting valid cognition is that if it is not a means of acquiring knowledge, it is not tenable as the cause of unerringly teaching the immeasurable things that have occurred and will occur.

original: 'dod rgyal gyis ni bdag tu med pa ma nor bar ston mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal gyis ni bdag tu med pa ma nor bar ston mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for a random occurrence to unerringly teach the nonexistence of a self.

original: de'i phyir rnam bar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam bar bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the Elucidation statement is:

original: dper na 'byung po dang / gdon khyad par can babs na byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams lung ston bar byed pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba rnams la yang byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ma nor bar lung ston par dmigs so //
analyzed: dper na 'byung po dang / gdon khyad par can babs na byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams lung ston bar byed pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba rnams la yang byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ma nor bar lung ston par dmigs so //
translated: For example, when a spirit or a special demon has entered someone, it is observed that they can predict the things that have happened and will happen. In the same way, it is observed that yogins and yoginƒ´s can predict without error the things that have happened and will happen.

original: dper na aa ru ra la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa'i nad bzlog ba la nus pa dang / smin pa la sogs par drang srong rnams kyis ma nor bar lung bstan pa dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na aa ru ra la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa'i nad bzlog ba la nus pa dang / smin pa la sogs par drang srong rnams kyis ma nor bar lung bstan pa dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is observed that sages can predict without error the future illnesses of arura and so on, and their cure.

original: yang dper na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la ma 'ongs pa'i ltas bcu lung bstan pa bden par dmigs pa dang / ma la sogs lung bstan pa dang / dus 'grib par lung bstan pa dang / rgyal po mya ngan med la sogs pa lung bstan pa dang /
analyzed: yang dper na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la ma 'ongs pa'i ltas bcu lung bstan pa bden par dmigs pa dang / ma la sogs lung bstan pa dang / dus 'grib par lung bstan pa dang / rgyal po mya ngan med la sogs pa lung bstan pa dang /
translated: Again, for example, it is observed that the ten future omens of the teaching of the Bhagavat ≈öƒÅkyamuni are true predictions, and the predictions of MƒÅra and so on, the predictions of the decline of the teaching, and the predictions of King A≈õoka and so on are observed to be true.

original: re ba'i tshal dang / kha che la sogs pa'i yul phyin ci ma log par lung bstan pa dam bcas pa dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: re ba'i tshal dang / kha che la sogs pa'i yul phyin ci ma log par lung bstan pa dam bcas pa dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The forest of hope, Kashmir, etc., are examples of correct predictions.

original: yul la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate false conceptions about the object, he says:

original: de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The object of that is a particular,

original: mngon @7b sum gyi tshad ma bstan pa gang yin pa de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos na ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon @7b sum gyi tshad ma bstan pa gang yin pa de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos na ma yin te /
translated: The object of that, i.e., of the direct valid cognition taught above, should be seen as a particular only, not as a universal.

original: spyi'i ni dngos po med pa yin pa dang / mngon sum ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i ni dngos po med pa yin pa dang / mngon sum ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a universal is a non-entity, and direct perception has as its object the intrinsic nature of an entity.
