analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be inferred exists‚Äù is a reference to the property of the thesis that will be stated later in the text. The phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be inferred exists‚Äù is the first rule.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äú

original: rigs mi mthun pa la gcig tu med pa nyid ni tshul gsum pa yin te /üîΩ'dir med pa zhes smos pas ni thun mong la ma nges pa dang 'gal ba bsal to //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa la gcig tu med pa nyid ni tshul gsum pa yin te / 'dir med pa zhes smos pas ni thun mong la ma nges pa dang 'gal ba bsal to //
translated: The third mode is the absence of the thing in a dissimilar instance.üîΩHere, the word ‚Äúabsence‚Äù excludes the common locus of the two, and the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes the presence of the thing in a dissimilar instance.

original: bstan pa smos pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa yongs su spangs so //
analyzed: bstan pa smos pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa yongs su spangs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúin‚Äù excludes the presence of the thing in a part of the similar instance.

original: nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha mar smos ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha mar smos ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is used because the other two modes are not certain.

original: gsum char la spangs pa nyid kyis gsum char la yang des rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum char la spangs pa nyid kyis gsum char la yang des rig par bya'o //
translated: And the third mode is ascertained by the exclusion of the other two.

original: tshul gsum po de dag ni bdag nyid ni tshad ma ji lta bu dag gis nges pa yin par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum po de dag ni bdag nyid ni tshad ma ji lta bu dag gis nges pa yin par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: These three modes should be understood as ascertained by whatever means of valid knowledge.

original: gzhan du na ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yid ches par bya bar mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yid ches par bya bar mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, one would not be able to have confidence in the object of inference.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang gang yin snyam pa la de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir chos can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang gang yin snyam pa la de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir chos can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the object to be inferred? Therefore, the object to be inferred is called the property-possessor here because it is the particular that is desired to be known.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: Here means in the definition of the reason.

original: shes par 'dod pa ni rtogs par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa ni rtogs par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desired to be known means desired to be understood.

original: bye brag ces bya ba ni khyad par la bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag ces bya ba ni khyad par la bya'o //
translated: Particular means distinction.

original: gang la shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag yod pa'i de ni shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag yod pa'i de ni shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That which has the particular that is desired to be known is the one who has the particular that is desired to be known.

original: chos rnams gang la yod pa de ni chos can te /üîΩdes ni 'di skad du chos can gang gi bye brag 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'dod pa'i chos can de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: chos rnams gang la yod pa de ni chos can te / des ni 'di skad du chos can gang gi bye brag 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'dod pa'i chos can de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin la /
translated: The property-possessor is that in which properties exist.üîΩThis indicates that the property-possessor whose particular is desired to be known is the object to be inferred.

original: de ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi skabs su yin par khong du chad par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi skabs su yin par khong du chad par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And this should be understood to be the context of the definition of the reason.

original: @10a * // gzhan du ni chos kyis khyad par byas pa'i chos can ni rjes su dpag bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @10a * // gzhan du ni chos kyis khyad par byas pa'i chos can ni rjes su dpag bar bya ba yin no //
translated: In other cases, the subject qualified by the property is what is to be inferred.

original: 'o na mthun pa'i phyogs pa gang yin snyam pa la /üîΩmthun pa'i phyogs ni bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos spyi dang don mthun pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'o na mthun pa'i phyogs pa gang yin snyam pa la / mthun pa'i phyogs ni bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos spyi dang don mthun pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the similar instance?üîΩThe similar instance is that which is similar to the property of the thesis in general.

original: mthun par dpag pa ni mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par dpag pa ni mthun pa'o //
translated: The similar instance is similar to the thesis.

original: shes pa 'dra bas yongs su gcad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa 'dra bas yongs su gcad par bya ba yin te /
translated: It is that which is to be determined by a similar cognition.

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is similar, that is, it is synonymous.

original: don 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: don 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: That which is similar in meaning is the similar instance.

original: rnam pa gang gis mthun zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mthun zhe na /
translated: In what way is it similar?

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: that which is similar to the property of the thesis in general.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba yang yin la chos kyang yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos te /
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba yang yin la chos kyang yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos te /
translated: That is the thesis and it is a property, thus it is the property of the thesis.

original: de'i spyi ni bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos kyi spyi'o //
analyzed: de'i spyi ni bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos kyi spyi'o //
translated: Its generality is the generality of the property of the thesis.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi bye brag ni don so sor nges ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi bye brag ni don so sor nges ba'i phyir /
translated: The particular of the property to be established is the object of the ascertainment of the individual.

original: de dang ni mi 'gal yang mthun pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dang ni mi 'gal yang mthun pa ma yin pas /
translated: It is not compatible with that, but is not incompatible.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthe universal of the property to be established.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gang yin snyam ba la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gang yin snyam ba la /
translated: What is the discordant side?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúThe discordant side is not the compatible side.‚Äù

original: gang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin ba de thams cad ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin ba de thams cad ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is not the compatible side is called the discordant side.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù means whatever is other than the compatible side.

original: dper na tsha ba'i reng ba bsgrub par bya ba lta ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i dngos po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tsha ba'i reng ba bsgrub par bya ba lta ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i dngos po lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the proof of the property to be established, ‚Äúhot,‚Äù it is like the thing that is neither hot nor cold.

original: de dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs de dang 'gal ba sta /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs de dang 'gal ba sta /
translated: ‚ÄúContradictory to that‚Äù means contradictory to that compatible side.

original: dper na tsha ba'i reg pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba las grang ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tsha ba'i reg pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba las grang ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the proof of the mere thing that is the object of the term ‚Äúhot,‚Äù cold is the similar class.

original: de med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs med ba ste /
analyzed: de med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs med ba ste /
translated: The absence of that is the absence of the similar class.

original: dper na mdo sde ba'i mi rtag pa nyis grub par byed pa la mi rtag pa nyid med pa tsam zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na mdo sde ba'i mi rtag pa nyis grub par byed pa la mi rtag pa nyid med pa tsam zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, in the proof of impermanence by the SautrƒÅntikas, the mere absence of impermanence is the dissimilar class.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la rtag par de gang yin pas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la rtag par de gang yin pas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because space and so on are permanent, it is not accepted as the similar class.

original: don rnam pa gsum par mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum par mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ste /
translated: The third type of object is called the dissimilar class because it is not the similar class.

original: med pa ni dngos su mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos su mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: The absence of the similar class is not the actual dissimilar class.

original: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba gnyis ni brgyud pas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba gnyis ni brgyud pas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa nyid do //
translated: The other and the contradictory are the absence of the similar class by implication.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni di zhig snyam pa la de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni di zhig snyam pa la de'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason that possesses the characteristics of a reason as they have been explained is called the property of the subject.

original: tshul gsum po dag ni lhag ma gsum kho na dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshul gsum po dag ni lhag ma gsum kho na dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The three modes are only possessed by the remaining three.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gsum ni gsum kho na la @10b srid de lhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gsum ni gsum kho na la @10b srid de lhag pa ni med do //
translated: The three modes as they have been taught are only possible for the remaining three.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i don te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of a mode.

original: rtags gsum char la yang tshul gsum po dag blta bar bya'i /üîΩtshul re re'am /
analyzed: rtags gsum char la yang tshul gsum po dag blta bar bya'i / tshul re re'am /
translated: All three reasons should be viewed as having the three modes.üîΩThey are not just one mode

original: tshul gnyis gnyis par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul gnyis gnyis par ni ma yin no //
translated: or two modes.

original: rtags gsum yang gang dag yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: rtags gsum yang gang dag yin snyam pa la /
translated: What are the three reasons?

original: ma dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Non-observation, nature, and effect.

original: rang rang gi ming gis rtags gsum ston bar byed do //
analyzed: rang rang gi ming gis rtags gsum ston bar byed do //
translated: Each of these three reasons is indicated by its own name.

original: de la mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni re zhig mi dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni re zhig mi dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ston par byed do //
translated: Among them, non-observation is the first reason.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig go //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúFor example‚Ä¶‚Äù is a word of illustration.

original: phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa me de zhes bya ba ni phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa me de zhes bya ba ni phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase in some particular place is a locative term.

original: de la 'grel pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'grel pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The commentary should be done as follows.

original: phyogs kyi bye brag ba 'ba' zhig na bum med de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag ba 'ba' zhig na bum med de zhes bya ba la /
translated: In some particular place, there is no pot.

original: 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba des ni chos can bstan to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba des ni chos can bstan to //
translated: The phrase in some particular place indicates the subject.

original: phyogs kyi bye brag ces bya bas ni de nyid bye brag tu byas pa ste rgol ba 'dod pa'i phyogs na bum pa med do zhes bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag ces bya bas ni de nyid bye brag tu byas pa ste rgol ba 'dod pa'i phyogs na bum pa med do zhes bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The phrase in some particular place indicates the particular place, and it shows that the pot does not exist in the place that is accepted by the opponent.

original: phyogs thams cad na bum pa med par sgrub ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad na bum pa med par sgrub ba yang ma yin la /
translated: It does not prove that the pot does not exist in all places,

original: gang yang rung ba zhig na yang ma yin no //üîΩdmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las zhes bya ba nges ni gtan tshigs kyi bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig na yang ma yin no // dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las zhes bya ba nges ni gtan tshigs kyi bye brag bstan to //
translated: nor does it prove that it does not exist in some other place.üîΩThe phrase in the perceptible indicates the particular kind of reason.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya bas ni shes pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya bas ni shes pa yin par ston to //
translated: The word perceptible indicates that it is an object of knowledge.

original: de ni rig par bya ba yin pas rig bya ste yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni rig par bya ba yin pas rig bya ste yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the object of cognition, and thus it is called the object of cognition.

original: dmigs pa'i rig bya ni dmigs pa'i rig bya'o //üîΩder gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig bya ni dmigs pa'i rig bya'o // der gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ste /
translated: The object of cognition of perception is the object of cognition of perception.üîΩThe state of being that is the object of cognition of perception is the state of being the object of cognition of perception.

original: dmigs pa'i yul nyid du rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul nyid du rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is suitable to be the object of cognition.üîΩBecause the ground that is the basis of the state of being is not perceived.

original: sdod pa'i sa gzhi mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdod pa'i sa gzhi mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that it does not appear.

original: 'di skad du phyogs la sogs pa ni snang ba mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa ni mi snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di skad du phyogs la sogs pa ni snang ba mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa ni mi snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: In other words, because the pot, which is of a nature suitable to appear equally with the directions, etc., does not appear.

original: bum pas stod pas sa gzhi stong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bum pas stod pas sa gzhi stong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the ground is empty of pot.

original: 'on na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de yang gang yin snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de yang gang yin snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: But what is that state of being the object of cognition of perception?

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba nyid dang / rang bzhin khyad par can zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩdmigs pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba nyid dang / rang bzhin khyad par can zhes bya ba smos te / dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.

original: rkyen gzhan nyid dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag go //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan nyid dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe other conditions‚Äù indicates the other conditions.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni der bum pa nyid do /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni der bum pa nyid do /
translated: The observed object condition is the vase itself.

original: de las gzhag pa dag ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dag go @11a * //
analyzed: de las gzhag pa dag ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dag go @11a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe other conditions‚Äù indicates the immediately preceding condition and so on.

original: de dag tshang ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag tshang ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe completeness of the other conditions‚Äù indicates the completeness of the observed object condition.

original: tshogs pa ni tshang ba'i sgrar brjod do //üîΩkhyad par can gyi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin khyad par can te /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni tshang ba'i sgrar brjod do // khyad par can gyi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin khyad par can te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe completeness of the collection‚Äù indicates the completeness of the other conditions.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.

original: de gnyis ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: de gnyis ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.

original: 'o na rang bzhin khyad par can gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin khyad par can gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of a special object‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object that is the observed object condition‚Äù indicates the observed object condition.

original: rang bzhin gang yod la dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag kyang yod na mngon sum kho nar 'gyur pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yod la dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag kyang yod na mngon sum kho nar 'gyur pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If the other conditions, the object that exists by its own nature, are present, then it is direct perception.

original: dngos po gang zhig yod cing mig la sogs pa nye bar gyur la bskal pa rnam pa gsum gyis ma bskal ni mthong bar nus pa 'di ni 'dir rang bzhin khyad bar can du bzhed de /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig yod cing mig la sogs pa nye bar gyur la bskal pa rnam pa gsum gyis ma bskal ni mthong bar nus pa 'di ni 'dir rang bzhin khyad bar can du bzhed de /
translated: The object that exists, the eye, etc. are present, and the three conditions are not absent, then it is able to see. This is the special nature that is accepted here.

original: des na 'di skad du mig la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang ltar rung ba bum pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du mig la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang ltar rung ba bum pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the collection of the eye, etc. is suitable to see, because the pot is not perceived.

original: 'dir ni bum pa med do zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni bum pa med do zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, it is taught that the pot does not exist.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the definition of a reason of nature, he says:

original: rang bzhin ni rang yod pa tsam du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi gtan tshigs te zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang yod pa tsam du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi gtan tshigs te zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: Nature is a reason that is the mere existence of the property to be established.

original: yod pa tsam zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa yod pa tsam la bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa tsam zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa yod pa tsam la bya ba'o //
translated: Mere existence refers to the mere existence of the probandum.

original: yod pa tsam du gyur pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni yod pa tsam du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa tsam du gyur pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni yod pa tsam du gyur pa'o //
translated: That which has the state of being merely existent is merely existent.

original: yod pa tsam du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa tsam du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that a reason based on nature is with regard to the probandum that is merely existent.

original: dper na shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThis is a tree because it is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.‚Äù

original: 'di ni shing ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni shing sha ba tsam dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni shing ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni shing sha ba tsam dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: This is a reason based on nature because it is merely related to being a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: de lta bas na des sgrub par byed do //üîΩ'bras bu ni dper na du ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na des sgrub par byed do // 'bras bu ni dper na du ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it proves that.üîΩAn effect is, for example, ‚ÄúFire exists there because smoke exists.‚Äù

original: de na me yod pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ston par byed de /
analyzed: de na me yod pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ston par byed de /
translated: This shows a reason based on an effect.

original: me la rag lus te skye ba'i du na gang na yod pa de na me yod par khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: me la rag lus te skye ba'i du na gang na yod pa de na me yod par khong du chud par byed do //
translated: One should understand that where there is smoke that arises in dependence on fire, there is fire.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir rtags gsum du rnam par gzhag snyam pa de'i phyir 'di gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir rtags gsum du rnam par gzhag snyam pa de'i phyir 'di gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa'o //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhy are the three reasons established?‚Äù

original: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bos rjes su dpag par bya ba rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir /üîΩdngos po bsgrub pa dang / dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang gnyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bos rjes su dpag par bya ba rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir / dngos po bsgrub pa dang / dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang gnyis so //
translated: One is a logical reason for negation.üîΩBecause the object to be inferred is twofold in nature, either as an existent or as a nonexistent.üîΩTherefore, there are two types of logical reason: one that establishes an existent and one that establishes an absence.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la dngos po'i ngo bo yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la dngos po'i ngo bo yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object to be inferred is also twofold in nature, either as an existent or as a nonexistent.

original: dngos po dang tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The object to be inferred is either different from or not different from its nature.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnam pa gnyis yod pas dngos po bsgyur pa yang rnam pa @11b gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnam pa gnyis yod pas dngos po bsgyur pa yang rnam pa @11b gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Since the object to be inferred is twofold in nature, the existent that is to be inferred is also twofold.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs dngos po dang tha dad pas kyang bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa bsgrub par mi nus la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs dngos po dang tha dad pas kyang bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa bsgrub par mi nus la /
translated: Thus, a logical reason that is different from the existent to be established cannot establish the nondifference of the object to be established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs tha dad pas kyang bsgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs tha dad pas kyang bsgrub par mi nus te /
translated: Nor can a logical reason that is not different from the object to be established establish the object to be established.

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa tha mi dad pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa tha mi dad pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason of nature is that which is not different from the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason of effect is that which is different from the probandum.

original: mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension is the reason of non-existence.

original: des bas na gang gi phyir gnyis pa dngos po sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: des bas na gang gi phyir gnyis pa dngos po sgrub par byed la /
translated: Therefore, because the second establishes an existent,

original: gcig ni dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rtags gsum ste /
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rtags gsum ste /
translated: and the first establishes a negation, there are three reasons.

original: gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa yin la /
translated: Two are reasons of existence,

original: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩ'o na ci'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kho na yin par blta bar bya'o // 'o na ci'i phyir /
translated: and one is a reason of negation.

original: dngos po sgrub par byed pa gnyis kho na yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: dngos po sgrub par byed pa gnyis kho na yin snyam pa la /
translated: Now, why are there only two reasons that establish existence?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel ba yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel ba yod na /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúIf there is a connection of nature,

original: don gyis do ngo bar byed de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don gyis do ngo bar byed de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it establishes the meaning by implication.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa dang ; / rang bzhin gyi ngo bos 'brel pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa dang ; / rang bzhin gyi ngo bos 'brel pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'brel ba ste /
translated: The relation of intrinsic nature is the relation of intrinsic nature.

original: de yod na rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi do nyid ches par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yod na rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi do nyid ches par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When that exists, the reason is the proof of the meaning of the definition of the probandum.

original: ci'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho na yod na don gyis don go bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho na yod na don gyis don go bar byed ce na /
translated: Why, when only the relation of intrinsic nature exists, does the meaning of one thing indicate the meaning of another?

original: de'i phyir de dang ma 'brel na der mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ma 'brel na der mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause, if there is no relation, there is no certainty that there is no error.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig gang dang ma 'brel pa de ni der mi 'khrul par gdon mi za ba ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig gang dang ma 'brel pa de ni der mi 'khrul par gdon mi za ba ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because, if something is not related to something else, it is not necessarily not erroneous with regard to that.

original: 'brel par yod na go bar byed pa dang / go bar bya ba yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: 'brel par yod na go bar byed pa dang / go bar bya ba yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, when there is a relation, it should be understood that there is the meaning that is indicated and the meaning that indicates.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: da ni gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa dang / ngo bos 'brel pa gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa dang / ngo bos 'brel pa gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate what is related to what, and what is related by nature, he says:

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don la rtog par 'brel pa de yang dngos sun 'grub par byed pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don la rtog par 'brel pa de yang dngos sun 'grub par byed pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That which is related to the object of reference is also the nature of the object that is directly established.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par na /
translated: Because, ultimately,

original: rtags 'ga' zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir de ni de dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags 'ga' zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir de ni de dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: some evidence is the nature of the object to be established, therefore it is related to that.üîΩBecause it arises from the object of reference,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don las byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rtags 'ga' zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i don las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don las byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rtags 'ga' zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i don las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because some evidence arises from the object of reference,

original: de ni de dang 'brel pa med pa /
analyzed: de ni de dang 'brel pa med pa /
translated: it is not related to that.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir don las byung ba'i kho na @12a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir don las byung ba'i kho na @12a * //
translated: Because it is the nature of the object of reference and because it arises from the object of reference,

original: rtags kyi 'brel pa nyid du brjod ce na /
analyzed: rtags kyi 'brel pa nyid du brjod ce na /
translated: If you say that the relation is that of evidence,

original: de'i phyir / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / de las byung ba ma yin pa de ni de dang 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / de las byung ba ma yin pa de ni de dang 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it is said: ‚ÄúThat which is not of its nature and does not arise from it is not related to it, because its nature is unrelated.‚Äù

original: gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig tu rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin pa dang / gang yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don las byung ba ma yin pa de ni de dang rnam pa gang gis 'brel par brjod pa /
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig tu rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin pa dang / gang yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don las byung ba ma yin pa de ni de dang rnam pa gang gis 'brel par brjod pa /
translated: That which is not of the same nature as that which is to be established and that which does not arise from the object to be established is not related to it in any way.

original: ma 'brel pa ni rtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa ni rtags pa ma yin te /
translated: What is unrelated is not evidence,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be the evidence for anything.

original: de lta bas na de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba gnyis kho nas 'brel pa nyid du brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba gnyis kho nas 'brel pa nyid du brjod par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, the relation is said to be only that of being of the same nature or arising from it.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not anything else.

original: / gal te de ltar yin du zin kyang de las ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te de ltar yin du zin kyang de las ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what?

original: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba de gnyis ka rang bzhin dang 'bras bu kho na yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba de gnyis ka rang bzhin dang 'bras bu kho na yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúBoth of those are only the nature and the effect.‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The nature of that is the relation of the reason of nature.

original: de las byung ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The effect of that is the relation of the reason of effect.

original: de'i phyir / de gnyis kho nas dngos po 'grub po zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de gnyis kho nas dngos po 'grub po zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúThings are established by only those two.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba gnyis rang bzhin dang 'bras bu kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba gnyis rang bzhin dang 'bras bu kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because both the nature of that and the effect of that are only the nature and the effect,

original: de gnyis kho nas dngos po sgrub par nus kyi /
analyzed: de gnyis kho nas dngos po sgrub par nus kyi /
translated: things are able to be established by only those two.

original: 'brel pa med pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not established by others that are unrelated.

original: de lta bas na dngos po sgrub pa ni gnyis kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po sgrub pa ni gnyis kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the establishment of things is only by those two.

original: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes bshad pa yin pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes bshad pa yin pa de gang zhe na /
translated: One is the reason of negation.

original: de'i phyir / dgag pa sgrub pa yang mi dmigs pa ji skad smos pa kho nas 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dgag pa sgrub pa yang mi dmigs pa ji skad smos pa kho nas 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe negation is established by the very non-observation as was just explained.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs pa'i shes bshad pa gang yin pa gcig po de nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs pa'i shes bshad pa gang yin pa gcig po de nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The very non-observation that was explained as the cognition of the non-observation of the perceptible is the reason for the negation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Why is that? Therefore he says,

original: dngos po yod na ni de mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po yod na ni de mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúbecause it is impossible if the thing exists.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa'i 'gyur ba ni mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa'i 'gyur ba ni mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is impossible for a thing to exist.

original: mi dmigs pa ji skad du bshad pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las she na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ji skad du bshad pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las she na /
translated: From what is the non-observation as was just explained the means of establishing the convention of non-existence?

original: gzhan du na ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i don dmigs pa'i reg byar ma gyur pa rnams la rang gi mngon sum log kyang dngos po med pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i don dmigs pa'i reg byar ma gyur pa rnams la rang gi mngon sum log kyang dngos po med pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Otherwise, if it were otherwise, then even when one‚Äôs own direct perception is absent with regard to objects that are separated by place, time, and nature, one would ascertain the non-existence of the thing.

original: gal te ji ltar smos pa'i khyab par mi brten pa /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar smos pa'i khyab par mi brten pa /
translated: If one does not accept the pervasion as stated,

original: de'i tshe @12b dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin pa yul dang / dus dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag gis bskal pa'i don gang dag yin pa de dag la sgrub pa po'i mngon sum log pa gang yin pa des dngos po med par nges par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe @12b dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin pa yul dang / dus dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag gis bskal pa'i don gang dag yin pa de dag la sgrub pa po'i mngon sum log pa gang yin pa des dngos po med par nges par byed mi nus so //
translated: then the non-existence of the object cannot be ascertained by the absence of perception of the probandum, which is an object, time, or nature that is remote by virtue of being separated by a great distance, a long time, or an indistinct form.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù should be understood to mean ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin rnams ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dag ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin rnams ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúObject, time, and nature‚Äù are the object, time, and nature.

original: de dag gis bskal pa la ni de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gis bskal pa la ni de skad ces brjod do //
translated: That which is separated by them is called ‚Äúremote.‚Äù

original: de la yul dpag tu med pas bar du chod pa ni yul gyis bskal pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la yul dpag tu med pas bar du chod pa ni yul gyis bskal pa rnams so //
translated: That which is separated by a great distance of object is ‚Äúremote by virtue of being separated by a great distance.‚Äù

original: bskal pa mi nyung ba zhig gis bar du chod par dag ni dus kyis bskal pa rnams so //
analyzed: bskal pa mi nyung ba zhig gis bar du chod par dag ni dus kyis bskal pa rnams so //
translated: That which is separated by a long time is ‚Äúremote by virtue of being separated by a long time.‚Äù

original: dbang pos mi sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag ni yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang pos mi sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag ni yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that things that are not perceived by the senses are naturally isolated from the past and future.

original: de'i phyir 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba des i dmigs pa'i rkyen tshang pa med par ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba des i dmigs pa'i rkyen tshang pa med par ston to //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúnot perceived‚Äù indicates that the conditions for perception are not complete.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa zhes bya ba des ni rang bzhin khyad par can gyi dngos po med par ston par byed de /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa zhes bya ba des ni rang bzhin khyad par can gyi dngos po med par ston par byed de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúisolated by place, time, and nature‚Äù indicates that there is no such thing as a nature that is not a particular.

original: de lta bas ni mi dmigs pa ji skad bshad pa nyid dgag pa sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bas ni mi dmigs pa ji skad bshad pa nyid dgag pa sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the non-perception that has been explained is a proof of a negative.

original: de ltar re zhig dus kyi bye brag khas mi blang bar ji skad smos pa'i mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa sgrub pa nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dus kyi bye brag khas mi blang bar ji skad smos pa'i mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa sgrub pa nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: Thus, we have explained that non-perception, as it has been described, is a proof of a negative without any reference to a particular time.

original: da ni dus kyi bye brag yongs su smos pas de bsgrub pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dus kyi bye brag yongs su smos pas de bsgrub pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the proof of a negative is established by reference to a particular time, he says,

original: mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe application of mindfulness that is nondelusion‚Äù is stated.

original: dran pa skyed par byed pa'i 'du byed yin te /
analyzed: dran pa skyed par byed pa'i 'du byed yin te /
translated: It is the application that generates mindfulness.

original: dran pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dran pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the seed of mindfulness.

original: mi rmongs pa dran pa'i 'du byed bum pa la sogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do //üîΩsgrub pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang ltar gyi log ces bya ba ni 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi dus ni stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa gang yin pa'i phyogs la sogs pa de dang mthun par rung ba'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa dang /
analyzed: mi rmongs pa dran pa'i 'du byed bum pa la sogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do // sgrub pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang ltar gyi log ces bya ba ni 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi dus ni stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa gang yin pa'i phyogs la sogs pa de dang mthun par rung ba'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa dang /
translated: That which has the application of mindfulness that is nondelusion, such as a pot, is called that.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe direct perception of the establisher that is past and future‚Äù is stated.üîΩThat which is the object of observation, such as a direction that is empty of the nature of the past and present, is a direction, etc.,üîΩthat is suitable as a concordant aspect. That which is a pot, etc., is the nature that is suitable as a concordant aspect of the past and present.

original: da ltar gyi phyogs dang mthun par rung ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'das pa dang da ltar du bstan to //
analyzed: da ltar gyi phyogs dang mthun par rung ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'das pa dang da ltar du bstan to //
translated: Because of that, it is taught as past and present.

original: gzhan du na ni phyogs la sogs pa na bum pa la sogs pa med na /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni phyogs la sogs pa na bum pa la sogs pa med na /
translated: Otherwise, if a pot, etc., does not exist in a direction, etc.,

original: 'das pa nyid du 'am /
analyzed: 'das pa nyid du 'am /
translated: it would not be past.

original: de ltar nyid du lhag la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar nyid du lhag la 'gyur /
translated: Thus, it is the remainder.

original: sgrub pa po ni lha sbyin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni lha sbyin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúperceiver‚Äù is Devadatta, etc.

original: de'i mngon sum gyi longs @13a * //
analyzed: de'i mngon sum gyi longs @13a * //
translated: The object of his direct perception isüîΩthe pot, etc.

original: su gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: su gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the object of his direct perception,

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni mngon sum yin no //üîΩ'dir yang mngon sum gyi yongs su gcad par bya ba phyogs la sogs pa dang mthun par rung ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni mngon sum yin no // 'dir yang mngon sum gyi yongs su gcad par bya ba phyogs la sogs pa dang mthun par rung ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the pot, etc. are direct perception.

original: bum pa la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du bstan to //
translated: Here, the pot, etc. are taught to be direct perception because they are the object of direct perception, and because they are suitable as the nature of the directions, etc.

original: don dam par na de na bum pa la sogs pa med na ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur /
analyzed: don dam par na de na bum pa la sogs pa med na ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur /
translated: If ultimately there is no pot, etc. there, how can it be direct perception?

original: de skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni sgrub pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi log pa ni ma yin pa la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni sgrub pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi log pa ni ma yin pa la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: In the manner explained, the direct perception of the perceiver is not based on the past and present, but is based on the unreal.

original: gzhan gyi dngo po'i mtshan nyid du yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngo po'i mtshan nyid du yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is the characteristic of the object of another.

original: bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i sa gzhi'i rang bzhin no zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i sa gzhi'i rang bzhin no zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the nature of the ground that is empty of the pot, etc.

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug ste zhes bya ba la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni 'di na bum pa med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dang / ngo bo de brjod pa dang dogs pa med pas phyogs la sogs pa der 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa'o //üîΩshes pa dang brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad de ni des 'jug par byed pas na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug ste zhes bya ba la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni 'di na bum pa med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dang / ngo bo de brjod pa dang dogs pa med pas phyogs la sogs pa der 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa'o // shes pa dang brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad de ni des 'jug par byed pas na /
translated: The expression ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù is used in the sense of the cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúHere there is no pot,‚Äù and in the sense of the expression that is free from the nature of that [cognition] and the doubt.üîΩThe expression ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù is characterized by cognition, expression, and engagement.

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug go //
translated: That expression ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù is used in the sense of engagement by that [cognition].

original: de ni 'di skad du 'das pa dang / da lar 'byung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'das pa dang / da lar 'byung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: This is what is being said: The past and present objects are only non-apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i yul ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i yul ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that the establishment of the expression ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù is of the past and present objects, not of the future objects.

original: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi phyogs la chos can ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi phyogs la chos can ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the subject in the aspect of the future time is not directly perceived.

original: stong pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang dmigs par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: stong pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang dmigs par mi 'grub po //
translated: The aspect of the empty side, which has the characteristic of an object, is also not established as an object.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ni chos can yang mngon sum du gyur la /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ni chos can yang mngon sum du gyur la /
translated: In the past, the subject was directly perceived,

original: bum pas stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs kyang dran pas /
analyzed: bum pas stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs kyang dran pas /
translated: and the aspect of the empty side of the vase was also remembered.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be the application of mindfulness that is not confused.

original: de bas na khar tsang la sogs pa'i nyi ma dag la bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs la sogs pa dran pa la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na khar tsang la sogs pa'i nyi ma dag la bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs la sogs pa dran pa la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, on the days of the new moon and so forth, when the aspect of the empty side of the vase and so forth is remembered, the convention of non-existence is applied.

original: da ltar gyi dus la ni chos can bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i phyogs kyang mngon sum du 'grub ste ;
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus la ni chos can bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i phyogs kyang mngon sum du 'grub ste ;
translated: In the present, the side devoid of the subject, the vase and so forth, is also directly established.

original: de lta bas na der ni dngos po med pa'i tha dad gdags par yang bla'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na der ni dngos po med pa'i tha dad gdags par yang bla'o //
translated: Therefore, there it is also designated as the difference of non-existence.

original: mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos pas ni /
analyzed: mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos pas ni /
translated: By saying the application of mindfulness that is not confused,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yongs su bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yongs su bsal ba yin te /
translated: the unestablished reason is eliminated.

original: gzhan du na ni stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs la sogs pa mi dran na /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni stong pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs la sogs pa mi dran na /
translated: Otherwise, if one does not recall the aspect of the nature of emptiness, etc.,

original: mi dmigs pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: non-apprehension itself is not established.

original: @13b 'das pa dang / da ltar zhes bya bas ni dus kyi bye brag yongs su smos par bstan no //
analyzed: @13b 'das pa dang / da ltar zhes bya bas ni dus kyi bye brag yongs su smos par bstan no //
translated: By past and present, he shows that he has mentioned a particular time.

original: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum zhes smos pas kyang sgrub pa po ma lus pa'i mngon sum gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum zhes smos pas kyang sgrub pa po ma lus pa'i mngon sum gsal ba yin no //
translated: By the direct perception of the establisher, he clarifies that it is the direct perception of all establishers.

original: sgrub pa po ma lus pa'i mngon sum smos pas ni gtan tshigs 'grub par mi 'gyur pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgrub pa po ma lus pa'i mngon sum smos pas ni gtan tshigs 'grub par mi 'gyur pa nyid de /
translated: By the direct perception of all establishers, he shows that the reason is not established,

original: sgrub pa po thams cad kyi mngon sum log pa ni phyir rgol ba la mi 'grub po //
analyzed: sgrub pa po thams cad kyi mngon sum log pa ni phyir rgol ba la mi 'grub po //
translated: because the cessation of the direct perception of all establishers is not established for the opponent.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las she na /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las she na /
translated: From what is it that the non-apprehension just explained is the engagement of the expression non-existence of entity?

original: de nyid kyi dngos po med par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dngos po med par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because of the ascertainment of that very non-existence of entity.

original: dran pa mnyams pa'i sa bon sgrub pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i yul gyi dngos po log pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis dngos po med pa nges par byed nus kyi /
analyzed: dran pa mnyams pa'i sa bon sgrub pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i yul gyi dngos po log pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis dngos po med pa nges par byed nus kyi /
translated: That very non-perception of past and present objects is able to ascertain non-existence,

original: gzhan ma 'ongs pa'i yul gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma 'ongs pa'i yul gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by other future objects.

original: de ltar re zhig sngar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo dang / dus kyi bye brag bshad zin to //üîΩda ni sbyor pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sngar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo dang / dus kyi bye brag bshad zin to // da ni sbyor pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the nature of non-perception by the previously explained reasons and the distinction of time have been explained.üîΩNow, in order to teach the distinction of application, it is said:

original: de ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is of eleven kinds due to the distinction of application.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Application

original: mtshan nyid gsum sgrub par byed pa'i tshig brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum sgrub par byed pa'i tshig brjod pa yin no //
translated: is the expression of the characteristics establishing the three natures.

original: de ni bye brag gis mi dmigs pa rnam pa bcu gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bye brag gis mi dmigs pa rnam pa bcu gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: That becomes non-perception of eleven kinds due to the distinction.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to teach the distinction of aspects, it is said: The non-perception of nature...

original: rang bzhin gyi dngos po rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dngos po rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of a thing is not perceived.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this, he says:

original: dper na 'di du ba med de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na 'di du ba med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThere is no smoke here.‚Äù

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe'i tshig yin te 'di thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe'i tshig yin te 'di thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example‚Äù is a word that illustrates. All of this should be understood.

original: 'di ni bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
translated: The subject is indicated by the word ‚Äúhere.‚Äù

original: du ba med de zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: du ba med de zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no smoke‚Äù indicates the property to be established.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag ni yod na bltar rung ba'i rung bzhin du ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag ni yod na bltar rung ba'i rung bzhin du ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not perceived, although it is perceptible‚Äù means that when the other conditions for perception are present, smoke is not perceived, although it is perceptible.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi dmigs so zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi dmigs so zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The non-perception of an effect is like saying, ‚ÄúThere is no smoke here.‚Äù

original: dpe ni dper na 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpe ni dper na 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The example is ‚Äúfor example, here, where there is no unobstructed power that is the cause of smoke.‚Äù

original: nus pa thogs pa med pa me dang bud shing la sogs pa du ba'i rgyu gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med pa me dang bud shing la sogs pa du ba'i rgyu gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have unobstructed power, which is the cause of smoke, such as fire and fuel, are called that.

original: 'di ni zhes bya bas ni chos can @14a * //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya bas ni chos can @14a * //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù indicates the subject.

original: bstan te / du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med ces bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: bstan te / du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med ces bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere there is no unobstructed power that is the cause of smoke‚Äù indicates the property of the thesis.

original: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di ni du ba med pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di ni du ba med pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no smoke‚Äù is like that.

original: gal te 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag yod na ni du ba 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: gal te 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag yod na ni du ba 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: This means that because this is only the absence of smoke, therefore, if the unobstructed power that is the cause of smoke existed here, smoke would arise.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pas na khyab par byed pa ste /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pas na khyab par byed pa ste /
translated: Non-apprehension of the pervader is as follows:üîΩThat which pervades is the pervader.

original: de mi dmigs pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of that is called non-apprehension of the pervader.

original: dper na 'di na shing med pa'i phyir shing sha ba med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya bas ni dpe ston to //
analyzed: dper na 'di na shing med pa'i phyir shing sha ba med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya bas ni dpe ston to //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúBecause there is no tree here, there is no shinshapa tree.‚Äù

original: shing ni shing sha pa la khyab par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: shing ni shing sha pa la khyab par byed pa yin te /
translated: The tree is the pervader of the shinshapa tree.

original: de ldog pa na de yang ldog par byed do //
analyzed: de ldog pa na de yang ldog par byed do //
translated: When that is absent, it also becomes absent.

original: 'di ni zhes bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù indicates the subject.

original: shing med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas phyir zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: shing med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas phyir zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no tree‚Äù indicates the reason.

original: shing sha ba med do zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ston to //üîΩrang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi 'gal ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: shing sha ba med do zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ston to // rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi 'gal ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no shinshapa tree‚Äù indicates the property to be proven.üîΩApprehension of what is contradictory to the nature is as follows:üîΩThat which is contradictory to the nature is contradictory to the nature.

original: de dmigs pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The apprehension of that is called apprehension of what is contradictory to the nature.

original: dpe ni dper na 'di na me yod pa'i phyir grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos pa'o //
analyzed: dpe ni dper na 'di na me yod pa'i phyir grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos pa'o //
translated: An example is: ‚ÄúBecause fire exists here, there is no cold touch.‚Äù

original: 'di na zhes bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
translated: Here, the subject is indicated by ‚Äúhere.‚Äù

original: me yod pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs bsnyad do //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs bsnyad do //
translated: The reason is stated by ‚Äúbecause fire exists.‚Äù

original: grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan te /
translated: The property to be proven is indicated by ‚Äúthere is no cold touch.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar me ni grang ba'i reg pa dang lhan cig par 'gal bas de yod nag rang ba'i reg pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar me ni grang ba'i reg pa dang lhan cig par 'gal bas de yod nag rang ba'i reg pa zlog par byed do //
translated: Thus, because fire is incompatible with cold touch, when it exists, cold touch is eliminated.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The observation of an effect that is incompatible is when an effect that is incompatible is observed.

original: de dmigs pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is meant by ‚Äúthe observation of that.‚Äù

original: dper na 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya bas ni dpe ston to //
analyzed: dper na 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya bas ni dpe ston to //
translated: An example is: ‚ÄúBecause smoke exists here, there is no cold touch.‚Äù

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can yin no //
translated: Here, the subject is indicated by ‚Äúhere.‚Äù

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The words because of the existence of smoke are the reason.

original: grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin no //
translated: The words there is no cold touch are the predicate of the proposition.

original: grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba ni me yin la /
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba ni me yin la /
translated: Fire is incompatible with cold touch.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni du ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni du ba yin te /
translated: Smoke is its effect.

original: de bas na gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, where there is smoke, there is fire.

original: gang la me yod pa de na grang ba'i reg pa ga la yod /üîΩ'gal ba khyab pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab @14b pa ni 'gal khyab ste /
analyzed: gang la me yod pa de na grang ba'i reg pa ga la yod / 'gal ba khyab pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab @14b pa ni 'gal khyab ste /
translated: Where there is fire, how can there be cold touch?

original: de dmigs pa la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: The words the observation of the pervasion by the incompatible refer to the observation of the pervasion by the incompatible.

original: dpe ni dper na dngos po 'byung po la yang 'jig par nges par 'gyur ba med do zhes smos so //
analyzed: dpe ni dper na dngos po 'byung po la yang 'jig par nges par 'gyur ba med do zhes smos so //
translated: The example is as follows: For example, it is not the case that an entity that has arisen will not certainly come to an end.

original: nges par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The words will certainly come to an end mean will inevitably come to an end, which is to say, will certainly come to an end.

original: dngos po byung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po skyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po byung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po skyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe occurrence of an entity‚Äù means the arising of an entity.

original: dngos po byung ba 'jig pa zhes bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po byung ba 'jig pa zhes bya bas ni chos can bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe destruction of an entity that has occurred‚Äù indicates the property that is the subject of the discussion.

original: nges par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit would not definitely occur‚Äù indicates the property that is to be established.

original: des ni 'di skad du dngos po skyes pa gang gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du dngos po skyes pa gang gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúThat which is the arising of an entity does not necessarily constitute its destruction.‚Äù

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause it would depend upon another cause.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos par khas len to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos par khas len to //
translated: The destruction of an entity is accepted as depending upon another cause.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gdon mi za ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gdon mi za ba ma yin no //
translated: That which depends upon another cause is not necessarily existent.

original: dper na ras la tshon lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ras la tshon lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a cloth is not necessarily colored.

original: 'dir yang nges par 'gyur ba nyid ni nges par 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid du lhan cig bar 'gal ba /
analyzed: 'dir yang nges par 'gyur ba nyid ni nges par 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid du lhan cig bar 'gal ba /
translated: Here, the property of being definitely existent is incompatible with the property of not being definitely existent.

original: des ni rgyu gzhan ltos pa la khyab pas /
analyzed: des ni rgyu gzhan ltos pa la khyab pas /

analyzed: grang ba ni rgyu'i nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir yang grang ba'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu ni grang ba yin la /

analyzed: grang ba ni mer lhan cig bar 'gal te /

analyzed: gang na me yod pa de na grang ba'i rig pa ga la yod /

analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ste /

analyzed: gal te don gzhan yod pa dang / dgag pa dag gi sbyor ba tha dad du gyur kyang /

analyzed: brgyud pas 'di'i nang du 'du bar dgongs kyi /

analyzed: du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //

original: gang na du ba med pa de na de'i rgyu dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa kho na dag mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: gang na du ba med pa de na de'i rgyu dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa kho na dag mi dmigs pas /
translated: In the case of the nonobservation of a pervader, since the object pervaded by that is not observed,üîΩthe pervader is not observed.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'dus so //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'dus so //
translated: The nonobservation of an entity is included within the nonobservation of a nature.

original: sgrub pa po rnams kyi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnams kyi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intentions of the proponents are different.

original: la la ni 'bras bu med pa'i sgo nas rgyu med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la ni 'bras bu med pa'i sgo nas rgyu med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some will understand the absence of cause in terms of the absence of effect.

original: la la ni rang bzhin med pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: la la ni rang bzhin med pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: Some will understand it in terms of the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du khyad par byed pa me mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs par brgyud par khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩrang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la yang me yod par grang ba med par rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par byed pa me mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs par brgyud par khong du chud par bya'o // rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la yang me yod par grang ba med par rtogs par byed la /
translated: In the same way, one should understand the non-apprehension of the differentiator and the non-apprehension of the cause.üîΩIn the case of the apprehension of an intrinsic nature that is incompatible, one understands that where there is fire, there is no cold.

original: gang na me yod pa de na dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa grang ba'i reg pa mi dmigs pas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du'o //
analyzed: gang na me yod pa de na dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa grang ba'i reg pa mi dmigs pas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du'o //
translated: Since the cold that is the object of apprehension is not apprehended where there is fire, it is included in the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la yang du bas me bsgrubs nas grang ba med par khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la yang du bas me bsgrubs nas grang ba med par khong du chud par byed do //
translated: In the same way, in the case of the apprehension of an effect that is incompatible, one understands that where there is smoke, there is no cold, having established the fire.

original: der yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa grang ba mi dmigs pas na /
analyzed: der yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa grang ba mi dmigs pas na /
translated: Since the cold that is the object of apprehension is not apprehended there,

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du ba nyid do //
translated: it is included in the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: 'gal ba khyab pa mi dmigs pa la yang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid kyis nges par 'gyur ba med pa nyid bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'gal ba khyab pa mi dmigs pa la yang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid kyis nges par 'gyur ba med pa nyid bsgrubs nas /
translated: In the case of non-apprehension of the pervasion of the contradictory, the non-existence of the definite occurrence is established by the dependence on another cause.

original: nges par 'gyur ba nyid sel bar byed de /
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba nyid sel bar byed de /
translated: Then the definite occurrence is eliminated.

original: de yang der dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na mi dmigs pa zhes @16b snga ma bzhin du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang der dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na mi dmigs pa zhes @16b snga ma bzhin du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is included in the non-apprehension of just that which is the object of the apprehension of that, as before.

original: de ni dpe'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni dpe'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
translated: That should be understood by way of example.

original: 'di ltar gos kyi tshon thams cad du snang du rung ba'i rang bzhin yin yang mi dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gos kyi tshon thams cad du snang du rung ba'i rang bzhin yin yang mi dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, even though the nature of cloth is suitable to appear as all colors, it is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du rgya 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i bar la yang du bas me bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i bar la yang du bas me bsgrubs te /
translated: Similarly, up to the apprehension of the effect of the contradictory, fire is established by smoke.

original: grang ba zlog bar byed la /
analyzed: grang ba zlog bar byed la /
translated: And cold is eliminated.
