original: ded log na gang na yang spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i me med par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: ded log na gang na yang spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i me med par sgrub par byed de /
translated: And when the sun reverses, fire is established as not existing anywhere, having the particular of being called ‚Äúthe hair of the sky,‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang der dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i me de lha bu kho nas mi dmigs pas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang der dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i me de lha bu kho nas mi dmigs pas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since the fire that is the observed object of that is not observed by the god alone, it is included within the nonobservation of a nature.

original: gang dag 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis bya ba dang tha mi dad pa dag gis bye brag med par nye bar brtags nas /
analyzed: gang dag 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis bya ba dang tha mi dad pa dag gis bye brag med par nye bar brtags nas /
translated: Those who, having imagined that the effect and the cause are not different from the action, are not different,

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du'o zhes brjod pa de dag gi de ni btags pas 'du ba yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du'o zhes brjod pa de dag gi de ni btags pas 'du ba yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: say that they are included within the nonobservation of a nature. But their inclusion is by designation, not ultimately.

original: dam bca' ba'i phyogs gcig kyang gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i phyogs gcig kyang gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even one part of a thesis becomes a pseudo reason.

original: brgyud pa'i don yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: brgyud pa'i don yang mi 'thad do //
translated: And the meaning of the indirect proof is not tenable.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa dag la yang mi mthun pa can gyi tshad mas bzlog par brjod pas 'du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa dag la yang mi mthun pa can gyi tshad mas bzlog par brjod pas 'du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for the observation of a contradictory object, and so on, they are included within the expression ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù since they are refuted by a valid cognition that is incompatible with them.

original: gang zhig gang dang mthun par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang mthun par 'gyur /
translated: What is compatible with what?

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni sbyor ba mi srid pa yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni sbyor ba mi srid pa yin nam /
translated: Is it impossible to have an inference for oneself?

original: der mi dmigs par sbyor ba'i bye brag las rnam pa bcu gcig go zhes bya ba ga las she na yang de'i phyir sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las bdag nyid kyang de bzhin du rnam par bcad pa rtogs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: der mi dmigs par sbyor ba'i bye brag las rnam pa bcu gcig go zhes bya ba ga las she na yang de'i phyir sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las bdag nyid kyang de bzhin du rnam par bcad pa rtogs par 'gyur bas /
translated: How is it that there are eleven types of application of non-observation?

original: bdag gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang bye brag bstan to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang bye brag bstan to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúeven for oneself, inference for one‚Äôs own sake is taught to have different types due to the differences in the application of non-observation that is seen and cultivated.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba rnams mthong ba ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnams mthong ba ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúApplication of non-observation that is seen‚Äù means that it is understood.

original: de yang tha dad du mngon du byed pa ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: de yang tha dad du mngon du byed pa ni goms pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCultivated‚Äù means that it is made manifest in a differentiated way.

original: de lta bas na sbyor ba rnams la shin tu goms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyor ba rnams la shin tu goms pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, due to being very familiar with the applications,

original: bdag nyid kyang gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig rnam par dpyad pa rtog par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig rnam par dpyad pa rtog par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: even for oneself, when one analyzes something,

original: sbyor ba'i tshul kho nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshul kho nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: one understands it in just the way that one has seen the application.

original: de bas na bdag gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag bstan to //
translated: Therefore, even for inference for one‚Äôs own sake, the application of non-observation is taught to have different types.

original: rnam par dpyad pa rtog pa ni dgag pa yid ches pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa rtog pa ni dgag pa yid ches pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The thought that analyzes is synonymous with ‚Äúthe ascertainment of negation.‚Äù

original: yang na rnams par dpyad par rtogs pa ste bye brag tu rtogs zhes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na rnams par dpyad par rtogs pa ste bye brag tu rtogs zhes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, the thought that analyzes is synonymous with ‚Äúthe ascertainment of distinction.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la bye brag smos kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la bye brag smos kyi /
translated: The non-apprehension of intrinsic reality is specified.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la ni de med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la ni de med pas de'i phyir /
translated: The non-apprehension of effect is not that, and therefore,

original: ji ltar na de dag mi 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir med pa'i tha @17a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag mi 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na / de'i phyir med pa'i tha @17a * //
translated: how can they be non-erroneous?üîΩTherefore, the non-apprehension that establishes the term ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is all of that.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause, etc. is the negation that is explained.

original: snyad sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa'i de thams cad la rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i dgag pa bshad pa gang yin pa gang ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba kho na dag las dmigs pa dang /üîΩmi dmigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snyad sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa'i de thams cad la rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i dgag pa bshad pa gang yin pa gang ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba kho na dag las dmigs pa dang /üîΩmi dmigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That which is the object of apprehension is only that which is apprehended and not apprehended.

original: bye brag de ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa mi dmigs pa rnam pa mang po bshad pa gang yin pa de thams cad du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag de ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa mi dmigs pa rnam pa mang po bshad pa gang yin pa de thams cad du blta bar bya ste /
translated: The specific is to be seen in all of those many types of non-apprehension that prove the term non-existence.

original: gal te rgyu la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs ba zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs ba zhig yin na ni /
translated: If the cause, etc., were the observed object of non-apprehension,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu la sogs pa dgag pa sgrub nus kyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu la sogs pa dgag pa sgrub nus kyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
translated: then at that time the effect, etc., could be refuted, but not otherwise.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa yang gal te dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa yang gal te dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba zhig yin na /
translated: As for the contradiction of nature, etc., if that were the observed object,

original: de tshe mi mthun pa can dgag par nus pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tshe mi mthun pa can dgag par nus pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: then at that time the contradictory could be refuted, but not otherwise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir / gzhan dag la ni 'gal ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzhan dag la ni 'gal ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said: ‚ÄúBecause the existence and non-existence of contradiction, cause, and effect are not established for others.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa ni 'gal ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa ni 'gal ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dag ste /
translated: The existence and non-existence of contradiction, cause, and effect are the existence and non-existence of contradiction, cause, and effect.

original: de dag mi 'grub pa la ni de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de dag mi 'grub pa la ni de skad ces brjod do //
translated: But if they are not established, then that is what is said.

original: de ni 'di skad du gang dag dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba ma yin pa de dag la ni 'gal ba yang mi 'grub la /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang dag dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba ma yin pa de dag la ni 'gal ba yang mi 'grub la /
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúFor those things that are not objects of perception, the establishment of their incompatibility is not established.

original: 'gal ba med pa yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa yang mi 'grub po //
translated: And the nonestablishment of their incompatibility is not established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par yang mi 'grub la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par yang mi 'grub la /
translated: The existence of cause and effect is not established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med par yang mi 'grub bo zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med par yang mi 'grub bo zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: And the nonexistence of cause and effect is not established.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa rgyun chags su 'jug pa gang dag mthong ba rnams la ni 'ga' zhig nye bas mi snang na ni de dang 'gal par yid ches par yang nus la /üîΩgang dag 'ga' zhig nye na yang de kho na bzhin du 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa rgyun chags su 'jug pa gang dag mthong ba rnams la ni 'ga' zhig nye bas mi snang na ni de dang 'gal par yid ches par yang nus la / gang dag 'ga' zhig nye na yang de kho na bzhin du 'dug ste /
translated: For those things that are objects of perception, which are seen to occur in a continuous series, if something is not seen because it is too close, then it is possible to be convinced that it is incompatible with that.üîΩBut for those things that are not seen because they are too close, it is not possible to be convinced that they are incompatible with that.

original: dmigs pa de la ni 'gal ba med do zhes nges par byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa de la ni 'gal ba med do zhes nges par byed do //
translated: And for those things that are not objects of perception, it is ascertained that there is no incompatibility with that object.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang yod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang yod na /
translated: In the same way, for those things that are objects of perception,

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa sngon ma mthong ba gang zhig dmigs ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa sngon ma mthong ba gang zhig dmigs ba la /
translated: That which is the object of observation of a prior non-observation of a thing that is an object of observation

original: de ni de med par ni mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ni de med par ni mi dmigs na /
translated: is not observed in the absence of that.

original: de ni de las byung ngo zhes de gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges par byed la /
analyzed: de ni de las byung ngo zhes de gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges par byed la /
translated: One ascertains that those two are the nature of cause and effect.

original: gang med kyang gang zhig dmigs pa de gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du med par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gang med kyang gang zhig dmigs pa de gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du med par rtog par byed do //
translated: One ascertains that those two, which are observed even though they do not exist, are not the nature of cause and effect.

original: de lar re zhig med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ba dmigs ba'i rig byar @17b gyur pa las mi dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lar re zhig med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ba dmigs ba'i rig byar @17b gyur pa las mi dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
translated: First, the proof of the term non-observation has been explained as the non-observation of that which is the object of observation of a prior observation.

original: 'o na de las gzhan pas ci zhig bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de las gzhan pas ci zhig bsgrub ce na /
translated: What is established by that other than that?

original: bskal pa'i yul mi dmigs pa mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa log pa'i mtshan nyid ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin te zhes bya ba smos te bskal ba'i yul mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa log pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: bskal pa'i yul mi dmigs pa mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa log pa'i mtshan nyid ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin te zhes bya ba smos te bskal ba'i yul mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa log pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The direct perception and inference of a non-existent object are the characteristics of the reversal of doubt, which is the cause of doubt.

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason for the convention of non-existence is not that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad ma log kyang don med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma log kyang don med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because even when the valid cognition is reversed, the non-existence of the object is not established.

original: tshad ma log pa'i mtshan nyid ni bskal ba'i yul mi dmigs pa ste /üîΩtshad ma log kyang don mad par grub bo //
analyzed: tshad ma log pa'i mtshan nyid ni bskal ba'i yul mi dmigs pa ste / tshad ma log kyang don mad par grub bo //
translated: The characteristic of the reversal of valid cognition is the non-perception of a non-existent object.üîΩEven when the valid cognition is reversed, the non-existence of the object is established.

original: tshad ma ni don gyi 'bras bu yin pas tshad ma log pas rgyu tsam ldog par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: tshad ma ni don gyi 'bras bu yin pas tshad ma log pas rgyu tsam ldog par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Since valid cognition is the result of the object, even when the valid cognition is reversed, the mere cause is not established to be reversed.

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i rgya cher 'brel ba slob ma la phan pa las le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i rgya cher 'brel ba slob ma la phan pa las le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the second chapter of the Student's Benefit, the commentary on the Drop of Reasoning.

original: // / yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i zhar la rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi bye brag gis rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su khas blangs pa de las rang gi don ni spros pa dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: // / yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i zhar la rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi bye brag gis rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su khas blangs pa de las rang gi don ni spros pa dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
translated: Having presented correct knowledge, the two types of inference are accepted in terms of one's own purpose and the purpose of others. Among those, the one for one's own purpose has already been explained with elaboration.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, wishing to explain inference for the purpose of others,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: it is stated:

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ste zhes smos so /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ste zhes smos so /
translated: Inference for the purpose of others is the statement of a reason having the three modes.

original: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Because it expresses this, it is called statement, which means words.

original: 'di tshul gsum pa can yin pas na 'di ni tshul gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tshul gsum pa can yin pas na 'di ni tshul gsum pa'o //
translated: Because it has the three modes, it is having the three modes.

original: 'di ni tshul gsum pa yang yin la rtags kyang yin pas tshul gsum ba'i rtags te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshul gsum pa yang yin la rtags kyang yin pas tshul gsum ba'i rtags te /
translated: Because it is both having the three modes and a reason, it is a reason having the three modes.

original: brjod pa la ni de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa la ni de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is what is called a statement.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bshad na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bshad na /
translated: Having explained that inference is correct knowledge,

original: ji ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i tshig yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i tshig yin zhe na ;
translated: how is it the words of inference?

original: de'i phyir / rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause the effect is designated upon the cause.‚Äù

original: rgyu ni tshig yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni tshig yin la /
translated: The cause is the statement.

original: 'bras bu ni rjes su dpag ba der sgro btags pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rjes su dpag ba der sgro btags pas /
translated: The effect is the inference that is designated upon that.

original: tshig de nyid la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: tshig de nyid la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba bshad de /
translated: Therefore, that statement itself is explained as ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: The meaning is that it is called ‚Äúinference‚Äù because it is the cause of inference.üîΩIt is of two types.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to inference for the sake of another.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin na /
translated: When the sign that has the three modes is stated,

original: ji ltar rnam pa gnyis zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gnyis zhes bya zhe na /
translated: how is it of two types?

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It says, ‚Äúdue to the difference in the application.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni tshig tu 'god pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni tshig tu 'god pa ste /
translated: Application is the arrangement in words.

original: de'i phyir bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is of two types due to the difference in that.

original: @18a */ rnam pa gnyis po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: @18a */ rnam pa gnyis po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the two types?

original: chos mthun pa nyid can dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid can no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid can dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid can no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The reason is of two kinds: that which has a similar property and that which has a dissimilar property.

original: 'di ni chos mthun pa yin pas 'di ni chos mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos mthun pa yin pas 'di ni chos mthun pa'o //
translated: This is a similar property, thus it is a reason having a similar property.

original: chos de'i dngos po chos mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos de'i dngos po chos mthun pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of that property is the property of similarity.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni chos mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni chos mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba'o /
translated: That which has it is called one having the property of similarity.

original: 'di chos mi mthun pa yin pas chos mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di chos mi mthun pa yin pas chos mi mthun pa'o //
translated: This is a dissimilar property, thus it is a reason having a dissimilar property.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dngos po ni chos mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dngos po ni chos mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of a dissimilar property is the property of dissimilarity.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can te /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can te /
translated: That which has it is called one having the property of dissimilarity.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa dang / ldog ba dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa dang / ldog ba dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with having a positive concomitance and having a negative concomitance.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa ni chos mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa ni chos mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yin la /
translated: If having a positive concomitance is the application of a reason having a similar property,

original: ldog pa dang ldan pa ni chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yin na /
analyzed: ldog pa dang ldan pa ni chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yin na /
translated: and having a negative concomitance is the application of a reason having a dissimilar property,

original: don du yang bye brag yod na /
analyzed: don du yang bye brag yod na /
translated: then in fact there is a difference.

original: de ci'i phyir sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said that it is of two types due to the difference in application?

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis don du ni bye brag ci yang med do zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩchos mthun pa nyid can yang tshul gsum la ltos par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis don du ni bye brag ci yang med do zhes bya ba smos te / chos mthun pa nyid can yang tshul gsum la ltos par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that in fact these two are not different at all.üîΩThat which has the property of being similar must be related to the three modes.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can yang tshul gsum la ltos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can yang tshul gsum la ltos par bya ba yin te /
translated: That which has the property of being dissimilar must be related to the three modes.

original: de bas na thams cad la tshul gsum yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad la tshul gsum yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since all have the three modes,

original: don la ni bye brag phra mo mang med do //
analyzed: don la ni bye brag phra mo mang med do //
translated: in fact there are not many subtle differences.

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni 'dir sbyor ba'i bye ba kho nar zad kyi ;
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni 'dir sbyor ba'i bye ba kho nar zad kyi ;
translated: Except for the difference in application,

original: don ma yin te /
analyzed: don ma yin te /
translated: there is no difference in meaning.

original: 'di ltar gcig la ni rjes su 'gro ba dngos po rjod par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig la ni rjes su 'gro ba dngos po rjod par byed la /
translated: In this way, in the first, the positive concomitance is stated directly,

original: ldog pa ni shugs kyis go bar byed do //
analyzed: ldog pa ni shugs kyis go bar byed do //
translated: while the counterpervasion is understood implicitly.

original: gnyis pa la yang ldog pa ni dngos su rjod par byed la /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang ldog pa ni dngos su rjod par byed la /
translated: In the second, the counterpervasion is stated directly,

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni don gyis shes par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni don gyis shes par byed do //
translated: while the positive concomitance is understood implicitly.

original: de la chos mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba ni re zhig dang dngos por nye bar 'god pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba ni re zhig dang dngos por nye bar 'god pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúhaving a similar property‚Äù means that the subject is posited as an entity.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang mi dmigs pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du grub ste zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bsnyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang mi dmigs pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du grub ste zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bsnyad pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú That which is an object of perception but is not perceived is established as the object of the convention of nonexistence‚Äù is the explanation of the concomitance of perception.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig mthong ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig mthong ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú For example, like seeing some other thing, such as the horn of a rabbit‚Äù means

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mthong ba 'di ni dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mthong ba 'di ni dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Seeing the object of the convention of nonexistence is like seeing the horn of a rabbit and so on.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa ste rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa ste rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äù ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù means ‚Äúestablished‚Äù or ‚Äúunderstood.‚Äù

original: des ni dpe bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dpe bstan to //
translated: This teaches the example.

original: phyogs kyi bye brag gang na dmigs pa'i rig byar 'gyur ba bum pa mi dmigs zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag gang na dmigs pa'i rig byar 'gyur ba bum pa mi dmigs zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
translated: ‚Äú In a particular place, the object of perception, the vase, is not perceived‚Äù teaches the property of the subject.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs @18b kyi sbyor ba ni gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i sbyor ba chos mthun pa nyid can ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs @18b kyi sbyor ba ni gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i sbyor ba chos mthun pa nyid can ston pa'o //
translated: The application of the reason of nature is the application of the second reason, which is the one that has the same property.

original: gang yod par de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang yod par de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Whatever exists, all of that is impermanent.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, like a pot, etc.

original: gang zhes bya ni dngos po ci yang rung ba yod pa de thams cad ni ril gyis mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ni dngos po ci yang rung ba yod pa de thams cad ni ril gyis mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Whatever is called ‚Äúthat‚Äù is any existent thing. All of that is completely impermanent.

original: des ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam bstan to //
translated: This shows mere concomitance.

original: rang bzhin dag pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba bye brag dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba bye brag dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The application of the pure nature is the application of the reason of nature, which is free from distinctions. This is what it means.

original: gang skye ba dang ldan pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: gang skye ba dang ldan pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Whatever possesses arising is impermanent. This statement is the concomitance of the second reason of nature.

original: rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba'o zhes bye brag bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos kho nas bye brag tu byas nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba'o zhes bye brag bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos kho nas bye brag tu byas nas /
translated: The application of intrinsic nature is by means of a particular quality that is intrinsic to the subject.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor bar byas ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor bar byas ba ste /
translated: The application of intrinsic nature is made by means of a particular quality that is intrinsic to the subject alone.

original: 'di ltar skye ba ni dngos su skye ba dang ldan pa dang tha mi dad mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba ni dngos su skye ba dang ldan pa dang tha mi dad mod kyi /
translated: Thus, although arising is not different from that which possesses arising,

original: 'on kyang gang la skye ba yod pa de skye ba dang ldan pa'o zhes bye brag tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang la skye ba yod pa de skye ba dang ldan pa'o zhes bye brag tu bstan to //
translated: nevertheless, it is taught as a particular quality: that which has arising is that which possesses arising.

original: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
analyzed: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
translated: The application of the third type of reason of intrinsic nature, the forward pervasion, is taught by the statement, ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent.‚Äù

original: khyad par gyi bye brag gis te zhes bya ba la khyad par ni bye brag ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi bye brag gis te zhes bya ba la khyad par ni bye brag ste /
translated: By means of a particular quality. A particular quality is a particular.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba bye brag mi mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba bye brag mi mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The application of a reason of intrinsic nature is one in which the particular quality is not evident.

original: ji ltar na bye brag mi mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bye brag mi mngon zhe na /
translated: How is the particular quality not evident?

original: rang gi ngo bo grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa'i do bo ni byas pa zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo grub par bya ba'i phyir ro // gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa'i do bo ni byas pa zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because it is established in its own nature.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúdependent on the activity of another‚Äù is ‚Äúproduced.‚Äù

original: gang zhig pha rol gyi byed pa la brten nas ltos ba zhes bya bar tshigs rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang zhig pha rol gyi byed pa la brten nas ltos ba zhes bya bar tshigs rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is to be applied to that which is called ‚Äúdependent‚Äù because it depends on the activity of another.

original: dngos po gang zhig gis rang gi ngo bo sgrub pa'i phyir rgyu rnams kyi byed pa la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig gis rang gi ngo bo sgrub pa'i phyir rgyu rnams kyi byed pa la ltos pa ste /
translated: That is, any entity that depends on the activity of causes in order to establish its own nature.

original: gang gi phyir byas pa zhes brjod pa de'i phyir bye brag mi mngon ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byas pa zhes brjod pa de'i phyir bye brag mi mngon ba ste /
translated: Because it is called ‚Äúproduced,‚Äù it is not manifest as a specific nature.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gzhan yin no //
translated: It is a reason of nature.üîΩThe same should be understood for ‚Äúarising immediately after‚Äù and ‚Äúhaving a difference of conditions.‚Äù

original: btsam ma thag tu 'byung ba dang / rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can nyid la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de dag kyang khyad par gyi bye brag la ltos pa kho nas yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: btsam ma thag tu 'byung ba dang / rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can nyid la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de dag kyang khyad par gyi bye brag la ltos pa kho nas yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: These reasons of nature should be understood as depending on the difference of the specific nature.

original: 'di ltar brtsal zhes bya ba rgyu'i byed pa la ltos te grub pa gang yin pa de ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtsal zhes bya ba rgyu'i byed pa la ltos te grub pa gang yin pa de ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is established in dependence on the activity of a cause is called ‚Äúthat which arises immediately upon exertion.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, because it arises immediately upon exertion, it is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bye brag mi mngon pa @19a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bye brag mi mngon pa @19a * //
translated: This is also a natural reason, but the distinction is not explicit.

original: yin no // rkyen gyi bye brag ni rkyen gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: yin no // rkyen gyi bye brag ni rkyen gyi bye brag go //
translated: The distinction of conditions is the distinction of conditions.

original: 'di rkyen gyi bye brag las tha dad ba'i dad tshul can yin bas 'di ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can no //üîΩde'i dngos po ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can nyid de /
analyzed: 'di rkyen gyi bye brag las tha dad ba'i dad tshul can yin bas 'di ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can no // de'i dngos po ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can nyid de /
translated: Since it has a mode of being that is different from the distinction of conditions, it is distinguished by the distinction of conditions.üîΩIts state is being distinguished by the distinction of conditions.

original: rgyu'i bye brag gis rjes su mthun pa can nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: rgyu'i bye brag gis rjes su mthun pa can nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The meaning is that it has a mode of being that is in accordance with the distinction of causes.

original: /'di ltar 'jim pa'i gong bu chung ngu las ni bum pa chung ngur 'gyur la /
analyzed: /'di ltar 'jim pa'i gong bu chung ngu las ni bum pa chung ngur 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, from a small lump of clay, a small pot arises.

original: chen po las ni chen por 'gyur ba dang / rdza mkhan mkhas pas byed na ni sdu gur 'gyur la /
analyzed: chen po las ni chen por 'gyur ba dang / rdza mkhan mkhas pas byed na ni sdu gur 'gyur la /
translated: If a skilled potter makes it, it is beautiful;

original: mi mkhas pas byed na ni mi sdug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi mkhas pas byed na ni mi sdug par 'gyur te /
translated: if an unskilled potter makes it, it is ugly.

original: de'i phyir rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bye brag mi mngon pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bye brag mi mngon pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is different due to the difference in conditions, it is impermanent. This is also a natural reason, where the difference is not explicitly stated.

original: yod pa'am skye ba dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: yod pa'am skye ba dang ldan pa'am /
translated: The words ‚Äúexistent,‚Äù ‚Äúendowed with arising,‚Äù

original: byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs kyi chos nye bar ston pa'o zhes bya ba la sngar ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum char gyi rjes su 'gro ba tsam bstan to //
analyzed: byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs kyi chos nye bar ston pa'o zhes bya ba la sngar ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum char gyi rjes su 'gro ba tsam bstan to //
translated: and ‚Äúproduced‚Äù indicate the property of the subject. Previously, the mere pervasion of all three types of natural reasons was shown.

original: da ni go rims bzhin du phyogs kyi chos rnams bstan pa ste /
analyzed: da ni go rims bzhin du phyogs kyi chos rnams bstan pa ste /
translated: Now, the property of the subject is shown in order,

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i sgra dang skye ba dang ldan pa'i sgra dang / byas pa'i sgra sbyor ba tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i sgra dang skye ba dang ldan pa'i sgra dang / byas pa'i sgra sbyor ba tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: using the words ‚Äúexistent,‚Äù ‚Äúendowed with arising,‚Äù and ‚Äúproduced.‚Äù The word ‚Äúor‚Äù is used to show that these are different applications.

original: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba can gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes sngar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa gang yin pa de dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba can gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes sngar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa gang yin pa de dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: The term ‚Äúmere‚Äù is used in the definition of the reason based on the nature of things that was stated earlier, ‚ÄúA reason based on the nature of things is a reason that is related to the property of the subject and to the probandum in such a way that the probandum is a property of the subject.‚Äù

original: bsgrub pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúAll of these probandum properties.‚Äù

original: sngar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum char gyi phyogs kyi chos bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: sngar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum char gyi phyogs kyi chos bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The property of the subject that was stated in the proof of the three types of reasons based on the nature of things are

original: rang gi bsgrub pa ji lta bu dag gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub pa ji lta bu dag gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúthe mere probandum properties.‚Äù

original: gang gi bdag gi tshad ma gang yin pas rang gi tshad ma de dag gis sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang / sgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'brel par grub pa kho na khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi bdag gi tshad ma gang yin pas rang gi tshad ma de dag gis sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang / sgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'brel par grub pa kho na khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúmere‚Äù is used in the definition of the reason based on the nature of things that was stated earlier, ‚ÄúA reason based on the nature of things is a reason that is related to the property of the subject and to the probandum in such a way that the probandum is a property of the subject.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ni sgrub pa'i chos tsam mo //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ni sgrub pa'i chos tsam mo //
translated: The mere probandum property is the nature of the probandum property.

original: sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ni sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'o ;üîΩ/ rjes su 'brel pa ni mthun par 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ni sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'o ; / rjes su 'brel pa ni mthun par 'brel pa ste /
translated: The property of the probandum is related to the mere property of the reason.üîΩ‚ÄúRelated‚Äù means ‚Äúconnected.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang la sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel par grub pa yod pa de la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // sgrub par bya ba'i chos gang la sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel par grub pa yod pa de la /
translated: It is a synonym for ‚Äúconcomitant.‚ÄùüîΩWhen the property of the probandum is established as related to the mere property of the reason,

original: bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa ji lta bu dag gis sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su brel pa'i sgrub par @19b bya ba'i chos kho na la phyogs kyi chos de dag gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa ji lta bu dag gis sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su brel pa'i sgrub par @19b bya ba'i chos kho na la phyogs kyi chos de dag gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: then the property of the subject, which is the property of the reason related to the mere property of the reason, is the proof.

original: ci'i phyir bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos de sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos de sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel ce na /
translated: Why is the property of the probandum related to the mere property of the reason?

original: de'i phyir dngos su na de nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos su na de nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is actually its nature.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar don dam par ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid byas pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, ultimately, the nature of impermanence is that which is produced.

original: byas pa yang gzhan la mi rtag pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa yang gzhan la mi rtag pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one is produced and another is impermanent.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rgyu dang rkyan rnams kyis byas pa gang yin ba de nyid 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyan rnams kyis byas pa gang yin ba de nyid 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: That which is produced by causes and conditions has the nature of being subject to destruction.

original: rang bzhin yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And nature is the reason.

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid gtan tshigs kho nar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid gtan tshigs kho nar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the nature of the probandum is taught to be the reason alone.

original: ji ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang rjes su ma 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang rjes su ma 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: How could it not be related to the probandum?

original: 'di ltar de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa la rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa la rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is said that it is related to just that, it is called nature.

original: ce ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde grub la de ma grub na /
analyzed: ce ci'i phyir zhe na / de grub la de ma grub na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause if that is established, it is established.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If that is not established, it does not have the nature of that.

original: gal te sgrub pa'i chos byas pa can nyid la sogs pa ni sgrub pa de'i tshe byas pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid gnyis don dam par na rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa'i chos byas pa can nyid la sogs pa ni sgrub pa de'i tshe byas pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid gnyis don dam par na rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If the property of being produced, etc. were the same in reality as impermanence, then the property of being produced, etc. would not be established at the time of the proof.

original: 'khrul pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: And error would be possible.

original: gal te byas pa nyid grub zin pa la phyis dbyibs la sogs pa rgyu gzhan gyis mi rtag pa nyid du byed na /
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid grub zin pa la phyis dbyibs la sogs pa rgyu gzhan gyis mi rtag pa nyid du byed na /
translated: If, after the property of being produced is already established, impermanence is made by another cause, such as shape,

original: de'i tshal 'khrul pa srid na /
analyzed: de'i tshal 'khrul pa srid na /
translated: then at that time error would be possible.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa yang rang gi rkyen la rag pas 'byung ba'i phyir de la gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin pas 'ga' zhig mi 'jig kyang srid so ;
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa yang rang gi rkyen la rag pas 'byung ba'i phyir de la gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin pas 'ga' zhig mi 'jig kyang srid so ;
translated: And since shape, etc. also arise in dependence on their own conditions, it is not necessarily the case that they arise from that. Therefore it is possible that some do not perish.

original: /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ni zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa nyid can gyis rjes su dpag pa kho na'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ni zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa nyid can gyis rjes su dpag pa kho na'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ston par byed do //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe application of a reason based on effect‚Äù shows only the application of a reason that has the property of the subject in an inference.

original: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod de zhes bya ba la gang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gang na du ba yod pa de thams pa de thams cad na me yod do zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod de zhes bya ba la gang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gang na du ba yod pa de thams pa de thams cad na me yod do zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Where there is smoke, there is fire - the word where refers to the place where there is smoke, and the phrase there is fire means that fire exists in that place. This is called the positive concomitance.

original: dper na tshang ba la sogs pa bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dpe ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na tshang ba la sogs pa bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dpe ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase for example, like a kitchen, etc. is the example.

original: 'di na yang du ba yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yul du du ba ston par byed pa na phyogs kyi chos ston par byed do //üîΩ'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub ba kho nal rgyu bsgrub @20a * //
analyzed: 'di na yang du ba yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yul du du ba ston par byed pa na phyogs kyi chos ston par byed do // 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub ba kho nal rgyu bsgrub @20a * //
translated: The phrase here also there is smoke shows the presence of smoke in the place that is the object of the thesis. In this way, the property of the subject is shown.

original: par bya bar 'bras bu gtan tshigs su brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: par bya bar 'bras bu gtan tshigs su brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the effect is stated as the reason in order to prove the cause, which has already been established as having the nature of a cause and effect.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang sngar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo bsgrub bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang sngar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo bsgrub bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of an effect-reason, the nature of cause and effect must first be established.

original: phyis ni rgyu grub par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu gtan tshigs nyid du brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyis ni rgyu grub par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu gtan tshigs nyid du brjod bar bya'o //
translated: Later, in order to establish the cause, the effect is stated as the reason.

original: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo rtags su nges na go bar byed pa yin gyi ma nges pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo rtags su nges na go bar byed pa yin gyi ma nges pa ni ma yin no /
translated: Thus, if the nature of the reason is ascertained, it is a proof, but if it is not ascertained, it is not.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The syllogism that has a dissimilar instance

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de dag bshad par bya ste /üîΩgang yod la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba de ni dmigs pa kho nar gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod pa la gal te de /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de dag bshad par bya ste / gang yod la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba de ni dmigs pa kho nar gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod pa la gal te de /
translated: The syllogism that has a dissimilar instance is as follows:üîΩWhatever exists and is an object of observation is observed.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar dmigs pa yin na de'i tshe gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar dmigs pa yin na de'i tshe gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If something exists and is an object of observation, then it is observed.

original: des na ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: des na ldog pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the contrapositive is taught.üîΩFor example, it is like the particularities of blue and so forth.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpe yin no //
translated: This is the dissimilar instance.

original: 'di na ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa bum pa de ltar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di na ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa bum pa de ltar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the object of observation that is an object of observation, the pot, is not observed.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag dmigs pa ltar 'di na bum pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag dmigs pa ltar 'di na bum pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: As the particular, such as blue, which is the object of perception, is perceived, so the pot is not perceived here.

original: 'di zhes bya bas ni 'dod pa'i phyogs bstan to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bas ni 'dod pa'i phyogs bstan to //
translated: The word here indicates the subject.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di mi dmigs pa'i chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di mi dmigs pa'i chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The application of non-apprehension is the application of non-apprehension of this.

original: rtag pa nyid med na yod pa'am skyed pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid med na yod pa'am skyed pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: If there is no permanence, there is existence or origination,üîΩor if there is no producedness,

original: byas pa nyid med pa yin na zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum mtshar gyi yang ldog pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: byas pa nyid med pa yin na zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum mtshar gyi yang ldog pa ston par byed do //
translated: this shows the reverse of the three kinds of natural reasons.

original: sgra ni yod pa'am skye ba dang ldan pa'am byas pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos rnams bstan to //
analyzed: sgra ni yod pa'am skye ba dang ldan pa'am byas pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos rnams bstan to //
translated: Sound is existent, originated, or produced,üîΩthese are the properties of the subject.

original: rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba de dag ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can dag yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba de dag ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can dag yin no //
translated: These are the applications of natural reasons with the property of the dissimilar.

original: me med na du ba mi 'byung ba nyid ces bya bas ni ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: me med na du ba mi 'byung ba nyid ces bya bas ni ldog pa bstan to //
translated: The words if there is no fire, there is no smoke indicate the negative pervasion.

original: 'di na ni yod ces pas ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: 'di na ni yod ces pas ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
translated: The words here there is indicate the property of the subject.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can ston par byed do //
translated: The words this is an inference based on a reason that is an effect indicate that this is an inference based on a reason that is an effect, which is a type of inference based on a reason that is dissimilar to the subject.

original: chos mthun pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa las yang rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pa dang / tshul gnyis su mngon pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos mthun pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa las yang rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pa dang / tshul gnyis su mngon pa ma yin nam /
translated: In an inference based on a reason that is similar to the subject, is there not also the presence of the three modes, namely, the presence of the reason in the subject, the positive pervasion, and the negative pervasion?

original: ji ltar na gzhan don rjes su dpag ba @20b tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan don rjes su dpag ba @20b tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the statement of the three modes of the reason is for the sake of another in an inference based on a reason that is dissimilar to the subject?

original: de'i phyir don gyis na chos mthun pas kyang sbyor ba la chos mi mthun pa nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyis na chos mthun pas kyang sbyor ba la chos mi mthun pa nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that even in a syllogism based on a reason that is similar to the subject, the dissimilar case is understood.

original: gang gi phyir nus pa'i sgo chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la chos mi mthun pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa'i sgo chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la chos mi mthun pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because in the case of a syllogism that has the same property, the capacity is understood to be the dissimilar property,

original: ji skad du smras pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: therefore the consequence of the fault as stated does not arise.

original: nus pa yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: nus pa yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: And what is the capacity?

original: de med na bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de med na bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it does not exist, then the probandum does not follow from the reason.

original: gal te ldog pa med na de'i phyir bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rje su 'gro ba mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te ldog pa med na de'i phyir bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rje su 'gro ba mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If there is no pervasion, then the probandum does not follow from the reason.

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs te zhes bya bas ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs te zhes bya bas ni //
translated: Similarly, the pervasion is understood by means of the dissimilar example.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang nus pas rjes su 'gro bas rtogs 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang nus pas rjes su 'gro bas rtogs 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of a syllogism that has the dissimilar property, the pervasion is understood by means of the capacity.

original: 'o na nus pa de yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na nus pa de yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: And what is that capacity?

original: de med na ni bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de med na ni bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If that is not so, then if the probandum does not exist, the reason is not established as not existing.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: If the probandum does not follow the reason,

original: de'i tshe bsgrub bar bya ba med par yang ci'i phyir yod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgrub bar bya ba med par yang ci'i phyir yod par mi 'gyur /
translated: then why would it not exist even if the probandum does not exist?

original: rjes su 'gro ba med na ldog pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med na ldog pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: If there is no pervasion, then the counter pervasion is not established.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa med na gcig log bas gzhan nges par ldog pa ma yin no zhes smos te ;
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa med na gcig log bas gzhan nges par ldog pa ma yin no zhes smos te ;
translated: If there is no natural relation, then the negation of one does not entail the negation of the other.

original: gal te rang bzhin dang 'brel pa dang / rang bzhin gyi ngo bos 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin dang 'brel pa dang / rang bzhin gyi ngo bos 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no natural relation, then there is no relation by nature.

original: de'i tshe gcig log kyang gzhan ldog par nges pa med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig log kyang gzhan ldog par nges pa med de /
translated: Then, even if one is negated, the other is not necessarily negated.

original: 'ga' zhig la rta med ces te ba lang dag kyang med pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la rta med ces te ba lang dag kyang med pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just because someone does not have a horse, it is not the case that they do not have cows.

original: de yang thams cad kyi rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi 'brel pa ci yang rung ci snyed pa de thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus te /
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi 'brel pa ci yang rung ci snyed pa de thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus te /
translated: Moreover, all things have two modes is to say that whatever is the relation of all things is included within two modes.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba zhes smos pa yin no zhes bya ba la de'i bdag nyid ni de'i bdag go //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba zhes smos pa yin no zhes bya ba la de'i bdag nyid ni de'i bdag go //
translated: That is, they are of the same nature or they arise from it.

original: de'i bdag gi dngos po ni de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bdag gi dngos po ni de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That which is of the same nature as that is of its nature.

original: 'di de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas 'di ni 'di'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas 'di ni 'di'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Since this is the characteristic of being of the same nature as that, it is the characteristic of being of its nature.

original: de las skyes pa ni de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni de las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from that is arisen from it.üîΩSince this is the characteristic of arising from that, it is the characteristic of arising from it.

original: 'di ni de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te 'di ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te 'di ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This was explained earlier.üîΩTherefore, the relation should be indicated by stating the difference.

original: des na ldog pa brjod pas 'brel par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'brel pa yod na gcig log pas gzhan ldog @21a * //üîΩpar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na ldog pa brjod pas 'brel par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'brel pa yod na gcig log pas gzhan ldog @21a * //üîΩpar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since the relation exists, the reversal of one thing is the reversal of the other.

original: med na ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs des gang 'ga' zhig ldog pas gzhan ldog par brjod de /
analyzed: med na ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs des gang 'ga' zhig ldog pas gzhan ldog par brjod de /
translated: If it does not exist, then the reason ‚Äúbecause it does not exist‚Äù is said to be a ‚Äúdifferent reason,‚Äù since it is a different reason.

original: des ni bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa de gnyis 'brel par brjod do //
analyzed: des ni bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa de gnyis 'brel par brjod do //
translated: Thus, the two, that which is to be refuted and that which refutes it, are said to be related.üîΩTherefore, the word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù includes only the relation,

original: de lta bas na ldog ba'i tshig gis ni 'brel pa bsdus pa kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i tshig kho nas 'brel ba sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na ldog ba'i tshig gis ni 'brel pa bsdus pa kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i tshig kho nas 'brel ba sdud par byed do //
translated: that is, the word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù alone includes the relation.

original: gal te de ltar yin du zin kyang des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin du zin kyang des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the point?

original: 'brel pa gang yin pa de yang rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa gang yin pa de yang rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAnd that relation is called ‚Äòpervasion.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: 'brel pa bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes bya'o //
translated: That very relation which is taught is called ‚Äúpervasion.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo yad rung ldog pa'i sgo yang rung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo yad rung ldog pa'i sgo yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether it is by way of pervasion or by way of difference,

original: tshig gcig brjod pas kyang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtags yod pa dang med ba bstan par 'gyur bas zhes bya bas ni gal te rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas sbyor bar byed dam /üîΩ'on te ldog pa'i sgo nas sbyor bar byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshig gcig brjod pas kyang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtags yod pa dang med ba bstan par 'gyur bas zhes bya bas ni gal te rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas sbyor bar byed dam / 'on te ldog pa'i sgo nas sbyor bar byed kyang rung ste /
translated: Thus, whether one formulates the proof by the method of agreement or by the method of difference,

original: 'on kyang bshad pa'i tshul gyis na mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod pa dang med pa bshad pa ni yod pa dang med pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bshad pa'i tshul gyis na mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod pa dang med pa bshad pa ni yod pa dang med pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: the presence and absence in the two, the similar instance and the dissimilar instance, are explained by the method of explanation, and the presence and absence are demonstrated.

original: gnyis kas kyang rtags ni so sor byed do //
analyzed: gnyis kas kyang rtags ni so sor byed do //
translated: And both of them individually perform the function of the reason.

original: de ltar na tshig gnyis sbyor ba nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig gnyis sbyor ba nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, there is no certainty in the application of the two terms.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba gcig la chos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi tshig gnyis sbyor ba nges pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba gcig la chos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi tshig gnyis sbyor ba nges pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in a single formulation, there is no certainty in the application of the two terms, that which has the property of the similar instance and that which has the property of the dissimilar instance.

original: re zhig de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis gcig gis gcig sdud pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis gcig gis gcig sdud pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the pervasion and the counter pervasion of the effect and nature reason are explained as mutually inclusive.

original: gtan tshigs gsum pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum pa'i phyir /
translated: The third reason is

original: mi dmigs pa la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: stated in the line ‚ÄúAlso, with respect to non-observation.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgang yod la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de ni dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par mi dmigs na /üîΩde lta bu med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba grub bo zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yod na gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes ldog pa brjod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'bras bu rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang yod la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de ni dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par mi dmigs na / de lta bu med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba grub bo zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yod na gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes ldog pa brjod pa de'i tshe /
translated: This means that it is not only the effect and nature reasons that have this property.üîΩIf it were the case that whatever exists and is an observable phenomenon is necessarily observed, then, since non-observation is taught,üîΩit would be established that the pervasion is that if the reason, the existence of an observable phenomenon, is present, then the predicate, non-observation, must be present.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i shugs kyis med do zhes bya ba rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i shugs kyis med do zhes bya ba rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When the counter pervasion is stated in this way, then, by the force of the non-observation of an observable phenomenon, it is understood that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba grub pa bsdus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba grub pa bsdus pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inclusion of the establishment of the forward pervasion is alone sufficient.

original: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba sdud @21b pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba sdud @21b pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the inclusion of the forward pervasion is complete.

original: mi dmigs pa la ldog pa sdud pa ni bdag nyid kyis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la ldog pa sdud pa ni bdag nyid kyis brtag par bya'o //
translated: The inclusion of the reverse pervasion by nonobservation should be understood by yourself.

original: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa gnyis la yang phyogs ma bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa gnyis la yang phyogs ma bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: In the case of both the positive and negative forms of inference, is not the subject not stated?

original: ji ltar na phyogs bstan pa med par de rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyogs bstan pa med par de rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the subject be understood in the absence of a statement of the subject?

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba 'di gnyis ka la yang phyogs bstan par nges pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba 'di gnyis ka la yang phyogs bstan par nges pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúin both of these syllogisms, there is no certainty that the subject must be stated.‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar phyogs bstan par bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa'i nges pa'i 'di ni med do //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar phyogs bstan par bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa'i nges pa'i 'di ni med do //
translated: There is no certainty that the subject must be stated, that is, there is no certainty that the subject must be stated without fail.

original: 'di ltar chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba las yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang mi dmigs pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad
analyzed: 'di ltar chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba las yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang mi dmigs pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad
translated: All that is an observed object that is not observed is the object of the term nonexistence.üîΩSince this includes all things, if a pervasion is made, then in this place, the property of the subject, ‚Äúthe observed object that is not observed,‚Äù is taught.

original: kyi med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes dngos po ma lus pa bsdus pas rjes su 'gro ba byas na 'di na yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa bum pa mi dmigs so zhes phyogs kyi chos bstan par shugs kyis 'di na bum pa med do
analyzed: kyi med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes dngos po ma lus pa bsdus pas rjes su 'gro ba byas na 'di na yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa bum pa mi dmigs so zhes phyogs kyi chos bstan par shugs kyis 'di na bum pa med do
translated: By implication, it becomes ‚Äúin this place, there is no pot.‚ÄùüîΩSince this includes all things, whatever is taught as the property of the subject in any place where a pervasion is made, the probandum is established by force.

original: zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma lus pa bsdus pas rjes su 'gro ba gang dang gang na phyogs kyi chos bstan pa de dang de na bsgrub par bya ba stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur na phyogs bstan ci dgos de bzhin du chos
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma lus pa bsdus pas rjes su 'gro ba gang dang gang na phyogs kyi chos bstan pa de dang de na bsgrub par bya ba stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur na phyogs bstan ci dgos de bzhin du chos
translated: What is the use of teaching the subject?

original: mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yal gang yod la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yal gang yod la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de ni /
translated: Also, in the case of a syllogism that has an incompatible reason, whatever is the object observed of the convention of existence,üîΩthat is necessarily observed.

original: dmigs pa kho nar nga gyur na zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul dngos po gang ji snyed pa de thams cad dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur na /
analyzed: dmigs pa kho nar nga gyur na zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul dngos po gang ji snyed pa de thams cad dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur na /
translated: If all the objects of the convention of existence were objects observed,

original: gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes ldog pa brjod na /üîΩ'di na ni de 'dra ba'i bum pa de ltar mi dmigs zhes phyogs kyi chos bstan pa shugs nyid kyis 'dir yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma lus pa bsdus pas ldog pa bstan pa gang
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes ldog pa brjod na / 'di na ni de 'dra ba'i bum pa de ltar mi dmigs zhes phyogs kyi chos bstan pa shugs nyid kyis 'dir yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma lus pa bsdus pas ldog pa bstan pa gang
translated: then it would be said that they are necessarily observed.üîΩBut here, the property of the subject is stated by the force of the words ‚Äúsuch a pot is not observed here,‚Äù and it follows that ‚Äúhere there is no object of the convention of existence.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the statement of the contrapositive of the syllogism, which is

original: yin pa de dang / phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba'i de gnyi ga'i stobs kyis dam bcas pa rtogs pas dam bcas pa ma bstan te /
analyzed: yin pa de dang / phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba'i de gnyi ga'i stobs kyis dam bcas pa rtogs pas dam bcas pa ma bstan te /
translated: stated by the force of both the property of the subject and the pervasion,üîΩsince it includes all things.

original: gzhan du na gang rtogs pa med pa de bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan du na gang rtogs pa med pa de bstan to //
translated: Otherwise, that which is not understood would be stated.

original: gal te shugs kyis dam bca' ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te shugs kyis dam bca' ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the meaning of the proposition were understood by implication,

original: de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i tshig la ngo mi chod pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i tshig la ngo mi chod pa ci yod /
translated: then what is the point of the words of the proposition?

original: 'di ltar skabs kyi shugs kyis log par rtog pa'i yul gyi don nges par shes pa dang / phyogs kyi chos dang khyad par bstan @22a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar skabs kyi shugs kyis log par rtog pa'i yul gyi don nges par shes pa dang / phyogs kyi chos dang khyad par bstan @22a * //
translated: In this way, the object of a mistaken conception is ascertained by the force of the context, and the meaning of the proposition is understood by the force of the property of the subject and the reason.

original: pa'i stobs kyis dam bcas pa'i don khong du chud pa de la phyogs bstan pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: pa'i stobs kyis dam bcas pa'i don khong du chud pa de la phyogs bstan pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of stating the subject in that case?

original: de ni rnam par nges pa'i tshig brjod pa la blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: de ni rnam par nges pa'i tshig brjod pa la blta bar bya'i /
translated: That should be considered a statement that ascertains the meaning.

original: spyod pa brjod par ni phyogs bstan kyang nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: spyod pa brjod par ni phyogs bstan kyang nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But if the subject is stated in a story, there is no fault.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nges pa med de zhes bya ba smros so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nges pa med de zhes bya ba smros so //
translated: That is why it says, ‚ÄúThere is no certainty.‚Äù

original: ci ste rnam pa thams cad du phyogs bstan pa dgag par dogs pa kho na zhes 'ba' zhig yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa thams cad du phyogs bstan pa dgag par dogs pa kho na zhes 'ba' zhig yin par gyur na ni /
translated: But if it is only suspected that the subject is being refuted in every way,

original: de'i tshe 'di skad du gdon mi za bar bstan par mi bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di skad du gdon mi za bar bstan par mi bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be explained as follows: ‚ÄúIt is not necessary to state the subject.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam par nges pa'i tshig brjod par phyogs mi bstan par chug na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par nges pa'i tshig brjod par phyogs mi bstan par chug na /
translated: If one does not indicate a position by stating a definition,

original: spyod pa brjod pa gang du bstan pa der ni phyogs ci lta bu zhig ces bstan par bya zhes bya la /
analyzed: spyod pa brjod pa gang du bstan pa der ni phyogs ci lta bu zhig ces bstan par bya zhes bya la /
translated: then one should indicate what kind of position is indicated in the statement of a syllogism.

original: mtshan nyid ci lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyogs shig bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ci lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyogs shig bstan par bya zhe na /
translated: What kind of definition should one indicate?

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na dang / bdag nyid dang / 'dod pa dang / ma brtsal bas bstan par bya ba ni phyogs so zhes bstan par bya ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na dang / bdag nyid dang / 'dod pa dang / ma brtsal bas bstan par bya ba ni phyogs so zhes bstan par bya ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúa position is that which is to be indicated by one‚Äôs own nature, by oneself, by desire, and by non-investigation‚Äù indicates that

original: don gang zhig rgol ba'i 'dod pas yul du byas nas bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo kho nar ston cing /
analyzed: don gang zhig rgol ba'i 'dod pas yul du byas nas bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo kho nar ston cing /
