translated: a position is an object that is taken as the object of the proponent‚Äôs desire and is indicated as the nature of the probandum,

original: mngon sum la sogs pas sel bar mi byed pa de lta bu'i don ni phyogs so zhes bstan te /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pas sel bar mi byed pa de lta bu'i don ni phyogs so zhes bstan te /
translated: and that is not eliminated by perception and so on.

original: de ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: That is the summarized meaning.

original: yan lag gi don ni /
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni /
translated: The meaning of the branches is as follows.

original: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba kho nar 'dod par zhes bya ba ni phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo ma gtogs pa ngo bo gzhan du 'os pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba kho nar 'dod par zhes bya ba ni phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo ma gtogs pa ngo bo gzhan du 'os pa ma yin pas /
translated: ‚ÄúBy its own nature‚Äù means ‚Äúit is only the thesis.‚Äù Since the position is not suitable to have a nature other than the nature of the thesis,

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bos zhes bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bos zhes bshad mod kyi /
translated: therefore, it is explained as ‚Äúby its own nature.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin par khong du chung par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin par khong du chung par bya'o //
translated: However, it should be understood as ‚Äúit is only the thesis.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba kho nar 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba kho nar 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúBy its own nature‚Äù means ‚Äúit is only the thesis.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa nyid yin yang rung na ma yin zhes bya ba bsnan pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo kho na 'ba' zhig tu bstan par bya ba la phyogs kho nar brjod kyi /
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid yin yang rung na ma yin zhes bya ba bsnan pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo kho na 'ba' zhig tu bstan par bya ba la phyogs kho nar brjod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is the proof‚Äù is added to indicate that it is only the nature of the thesis that is to be taught,

original: ngo bo gzhan spang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan spang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not another nature.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo gzhan dang yang ldan par bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo gzhan dang yang ldan par bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the teaching that the thesis has another nature that is the proof?

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs mig gis gzung ba nyid ni sgra la ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs mig gis gzung ba nyid ni sgra la ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is impermanent, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is perceptible by the eyes‚Äù is not established with respect to sound, so it is the thesis.

original: gang zhig sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúSound is impermanentüîΩbecause it is perceptible by the eyes.‚Äù

original: mig gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smra bar byed pa de'i mig gis gzung ba de ni sgral ma grub pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smra bar byed pa de'i mig gis gzung ba de ni sgral ma grub pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: That ‚Äúit is perceptible by the eyes‚Äù is not established with respect to sound, so it is the thesis.

original: de'i phyir bsnan pa med pa @22b mig gis gzung ba bstan pa yang phyogs nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsnan pa med pa @22b mig gis gzung ba bstan pa yang phyogs nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúit is perceptible by the eyes‚Äù is stated as the subject, and it follows that it is the subject itself.

original: gal te de las bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo yod pa ci'i phyir phyogs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de las bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo yod pa ci'i phyir phyogs ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWhy is the existence of the nature of the thesis not the subject?‚Äù

original: de 'dir ni sgrub pa kho nar brjod pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba nyid kho nar mi 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de 'dir ni sgrub pa kho nar brjod pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba nyid kho nar mi 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: because here it is only stated as the probandum, it is not asserted as the subject.

original: mig gis gzung ba nyid la bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yod mod kyi /
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba nyid la bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yod mod kyi /
translated: Although ‚Äúit is perceptible by the eyes‚Äù does have the nature of the probandum,

original: 'on kyang gtan tshigs nyid du ston pa na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo kho na 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtan tshigs nyid du ston pa na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo kho na 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: However, when it is being shown to be a reason, it is not just the nature of the probandum alone,

original: bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin no //
translated: but also the nature of the proof.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba yin yang sgrub pa'i ngo bo lhag par yod pa'i phyir bsnan pa'i tshig gis phyogs nyid yin pa zlog go //
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba yin yang sgrub pa'i ngo bo lhag par yod pa'i phyir bsnan pa'i tshig gis phyogs nyid yin pa zlog go //
translated: Therefore, even though it is the probandum, because it has the nature of the proof in excess, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes the position.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de'i tshe /
translated: ‚Äú Itself‚Äù means at that time.

original: rgol bas sgrub pa smras pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa smras pas /
analyzed: rgol bas sgrub pa smras pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa smras pas /
translated: ‚Äú That which is stated by the proponent as the proof‚Äù means that which is stated as the proof.

original: bdag nyid kyis bstan par bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni phyogs kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bstan par bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni phyogs kho na yin gyi /
translated: That which is the object to be stated by oneself is only the position,

original: bstan bcos byed pas bstan par bya ba'i don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas bstan par bya ba'i don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but it is not the object to be stated by the author of the treatise. This is the meaning.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rgol bas bstan par bya ba la phyogs kho nas brjod pas so ;
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rgol bas bstan par bya ba la phyogs kho nas brjod pas so ;
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because the proponent expresses only the position in what is to be stated.

original: / gal te bstan bcos 'ga' zhig la brten te sgrub pa smra na yang zhes bya ba ni re zhig bstan bcos 'ga' zhig la brten te /
analyzed: / gal te bstan bcos 'ga' zhig la brten te sgrub pa smra na yang zhes bya ba ni re zhig bstan bcos 'ga' zhig la brten te /
translated: If one were to argue on the basis of some treatise, then even so,üîΩthe certainty of the object to be established on the basis of some treatise is not certain.

original: phyogs su bya ba'i nges pa yin pa de ni nges pa med mod kyi 'on kyang gal te bstan bcos khas blangs te /üîΩtshad mar byed na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: phyogs su bya ba'i nges pa yin pa de ni nges pa med mod kyi 'on kyang gal te bstan bcos khas blangs te / tshad mar byed na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: However, if one accepts a treatise and takes it to be valid cognition,üîΩthen even so, the author of that treatise accepts many proofs in that treatise.üîΩEven though the author of that treatise accepts many properties,

original: bstan bcos de byed pas bstan bcos sgrub pa mang zhig khas len du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba bstan bcos gang la brten te sgrub pa smra ba'i bstan bcos de gang gis byas pa'i bstan bcos de byed pa des log par rtog pa'i yul chos
analyzed: bstan bcos de byed pas bstan bcos sgrub pa mang zhig khas len du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba bstan bcos gang la brten te sgrub pa smra ba'i bstan bcos de gang gis byas pa'i bstan bcos de byed pa des log par rtog pa'i yul chos
translated: if the opponent accepts a treatise and argues on the basis of that treatise, then the object of the opponent's misconception is the property of the subject.

original: can la gal te chos mang zhig khas blangs par gyur kyang 'on kyang /
analyzed: can la gal te chos mang zhig khas blangs par gyur kyang 'on kyang /
translated: Even though the author of that treatise accepts many properties,

original: de'i tshe rgol ba des chos gang bsgrub par 'dod pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgol ba des chos gang bsgrub par 'dod pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: at that time, the opponent wishes to establish only that which is to be established.

original: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba kho nas chos gang bsgrub par 'dod pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba kho nas chos gang bsgrub par 'dod pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The opponent himself wishes to prove a thesis,

original: bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but the author of the treatise does not.

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe rgol bas bstan 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs nyid khas len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe rgol bas bstan 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs nyid khas len pa de'i tshe /
translated: This is what is being taught: When the opponent himself accepts the position that is to be proven,

original: rgol ba bstan bcos khas len pa'i sgo nas smra na yang bdag nyid 'dod pa'i chos kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgol ba bstan bcos khas len pa'i sgo nas smra na yang bdag nyid 'dod pa'i chos kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: then even if the opponent speaks in terms of accepting the treatise, he is proving only the thesis that he himself wishes to prove.

original: bstan bcos byed pas khas blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don gang la rtsod par sgrub par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don 'chad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas khas blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don gang la rtsod par sgrub par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don 'chad de /
translated: The treatise author does not accept it.üîΩThe word ‚Äúwish‚Äù means the object of the dispute that is to be proven.

original: dngos @23a * //
analyzed: dngos @23a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúobject‚Äù has the meaning of

original: po gang rtsod pa byung ba'i rtsod pa'i gzhi'i dngos po nyid grub bar 'dod bas bsgrub ba bkod pa'i don de ni 'dod ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: po gang rtsod pa byung ba'i rtsod pa'i gzhi'i dngos po nyid grub bar 'dod bas bsgrub ba bkod pa'i don de ni 'dod ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of the dispute, the thing itself that is asserted to be established, is called the thesis.

original: de ni tshig tu ma smras kyang bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni tshig tu ma smras kyang bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Even though it is not stated in words, it is the object of affirmation.

original: gal te log par rtog pa'i yul don de tshig gis ma brjod kyang /
analyzed: gal te log par rtog pa'i yul don de tshig gis ma brjod kyang /
translated: Even though the object of a mistaken conception is not stated in words,

original: 'on kyang de ni bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: nevertheless, it is the object of affirmation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is the basis of the dispute.

original: de'i phyir de kho nar rtsod pa gang gi phyir rtsod pa de ji ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho nar rtsod pa gang gi phyir rtsod pa de ji ltar na /
translated: Therefore, how can the object of the dispute, for the sake of which there is a dispute,

original: bsgrub par bya ba kho na ma yin /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba kho na ma yin /
translated: not be the object of affirmation?

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi gang la de tshig tu ma brjod kyang bsgrub par bya bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi gang la de tshig tu ma brjod kyang bsgrub par bya bar 'dod ce na /
translated: With regard to the basis of the dispute, even though it is not stated in words, why is it asserted to be the object of affirmation?

original: de'i phyir / dper na 'dus pa yin ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dper na 'dus pa yin ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
translated: For example, because the eyes and so on are collections, they are for the sake of another.

original: mal cha dad stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mal cha dad stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like the parts of a bed, a seat, and so on.

original: dper na mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pas /
analyzed: dper na mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pas /
translated: For example, the parts of a bed, a seat, and so on are the nature of a collection.

original: gzhan gyi don du mthong ba ltar de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du mthong ba ltar de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the eye and so on are the nature of a collection.

original: gzhan gyi don yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are for the benefit of another. This is the meaning of the syllogism.

original: 'dir bdag gi don zhes ma brjod kyang bdag gi don nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba 'dir gal te dmigs la sogs pa ni bdag gi don te zhes ma brjod kyang bdag gi don kho nar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir bdag gi don zhes ma brjod kyang bdag gi don nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba 'dir gal te dmigs la sogs pa ni bdag gi don te zhes ma brjod kyang bdag gi don kho nar sgrub par byed do //
translated: Here, although the meaning of ‚Äúfor one‚Äôs own benefit‚Äù is not stated, it is established as being for one‚Äôs own benefit. In this syllogism, although the meaning of ‚Äúfor one‚Äôs own benefit‚Äù is not stated, it is established as being for one‚Äôs own benefit.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi don tsam zhig yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi don tsam zhig yin na /
translated: If that were not so, if it were merely for the benefit of another,

original: grub pa sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be the establishment of what is already established.

original: bdag la log par rtog pas sgrub pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: bdag la log par rtog pas sgrub pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: It is only established by the misconception of a self.

original: de'i phyir de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is to be established as that.

original: des na smras pa tsam kho na nyid bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: des na smras pa tsam kho na nyid bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that mere speech is not the object of affirmation.

original: de skad du ma smras kyang 'dod pas yul du byas pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa de'i phyir smras pa kho na 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de skad du ma smras kyang 'dod pas yul du byas pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa de'i phyir smras pa kho na 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it is not stated in that way, the object of affirmation is not mere speech alone, since it is the object of desire.

original: ci lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'dod pas yul du byas pa yang bsgrub par byas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pas yul du byas pa yang bsgrub par byas pa kho na yin no //
translated: The object of desire is also the object of affirmation.

original: ma bsal ba zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de dang ldan du zin kyang bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa dang / rang gi tshig rnams kyis sel ba gang yin pa de ni phyogs ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma bsal ba zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de dang ldan du zin kyang bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa dang / rang gi tshig rnams kyis sel ba gang yin pa de ni phyogs ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúunspecified‚Äù is a characteristic. Even though it possesses that characteristic, the object of affirmation is not the object of desire, since it is specified by direct perception, inference, renown, and one‚Äôs own words.üîΩThe term ‚Äútaught‚Äù is a characteristic.

original: ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i don bsgrub pa'i skabs yin yang /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i don bsgrub pa'i skabs yin yang /
translated: Even though it possesses that characteristic, the object of affirmation is not the object of desire, since it is specified by direct perception, inference, renown, and one‚Äôs own words.

original: gal mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa dang / rang gi tshig gis sel bar byed na /
analyzed: gal mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa dang / rang gi tshig gis sel bar byed na /
translated: If it is refuted by perception, inference, testimony, or one's own words,üîΩthen at that time, the meaning is not established.

original: de'i @23b tshe don de phyogs ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ma bsal ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i @23b tshe don de phyogs ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ma bsal ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In that case, the term unrefuted is used to indicate that it is not refuted.üîΩHere, the refutation by perception is like saying sound is not audible.

original: de la mngon sum gyis gsal ba ni dper na sgra ni mnyan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba thogs pa ni nyan pa ste /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis gsal ba ni dper na sgra ni mnyan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba thogs pa ni nyan pa ste /
translated: Audible means perceptible by the ear,

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩnyan pa la grags pa'am /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // nyan pa la grags pa'am /
translated: which is to say, by the ear-consciousness.üîΩAudible is known to the ear,

original: nyan pas gzung bar bya ba ni mnyan du rung ba'o //
analyzed: nyan pas gzung bar bya ba ni mnyan du rung ba'o //
translated: or audible means to be apprehended by the ear.

original: mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa ni mnyan du mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa ni mnyan du mi rung ba ste /
translated: Inaudible means not audible.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la grags par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la grags par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is to say, it will not be known to the ear-consciousness.

original: de lta bas na 'dir sgra ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir sgra ni chos can yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, sound is the subject.

original: mnyan du mi rung ba nyid ni bsgrub par ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: mnyan du mi rung ba nyid ni bsgrub par ba'i chos yin no //
translated: Inaudibility is the property to be established.

original: sgra ni mnyan du mi rung ba nyid do zhes dam 'cha' na ;
analyzed: sgra ni mnyan du mi rung ba nyid do zhes dam 'cha' na ;
translated: If one asserts that sound is not audible,

original: de ni mngon sum gyis sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyis sel bar byed do //
translated: it is refuted by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra'i rnam par snang ba ni srog chags so cog gis rang gis rang rig ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra'i rnam par snang ba ni srog chags so cog gis rang gis rang rig ste /
translated: Thus, the auditory consciousness appearing in the aspect of sound is self-cognized by all living beings.

original: des na mnyan par bya ba nyid du rang gis rig pa'i grags pas mnyan du mi rung ba nyid sel bar byed do //
analyzed: des na mnyan par bya ba nyid du rang gis rig pa'i grags pas mnyan du mi rung ba nyid sel bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the claim that it is not audible is refuted by the renown that it is self-cognized as audible.

original: rjes su dpag pas bsal ba ni dper na bum pa ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la bum pa rtag pa nyid du dam 'cha' na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas bsal ba ni dper na bum pa ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la bum pa rtag pa nyid du dam 'cha' na /
translated: Refutation by inference is like, for example, if one asserts that a pot is permanent,

original: byas pa la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas sel bar byed de /
analyzed: byas pa la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas sel bar byed de /
translated: it is refuted by the inference of being produced.

original: 'di ltar byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong la /
translated: Thus, it is seen that what is produced is impermanent.

original: bum pa yang byas pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa yang byas pa yin te /
translated: And a pot is also produced.

original: des na rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: So how could it be permanent?

original: grags pas bsal ba ni dper na ri bong can ni zla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: grags pas bsal ba ni dper na ri bong can ni zla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Refutation by renown is like, for example, saying that the rabbit-bearer is not the moon.

original: la la zhig ri bong can ni zla ba'i sgrar brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na /
analyzed: la la zhig ri bong can ni zla ba'i sgrar brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na /
translated: Some people make the assertion that ‚Äúthe rabbit-bearer is not the referent of the word ‚Äòmoon.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: de ni ri bong can zla ba'i sgrar brjod pa nyid du gnag rdzi mo yan chad la grags pas sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de ni ri bong can zla ba'i sgrar brjod pa nyid du gnag rdzi mo yan chad la grags pas sel bar byed do //
translated: This is refuted by the fact that everyone from cowherds on up knows that the rabbit-bearer is the referent of the word ‚Äúmoon.‚Äù

original: yang na don thams cad la sgra thams cad kyi brjod par byar rung bas sel bar byed de /
analyzed: yang na don thams cad la sgra thams cad kyi brjod par byar rung bas sel bar byed de /
translated: Or else, it is refuted by the fact that all words are suitable to refer to all objects,

original: sgra dang don du 'brel ba ni brdar btags pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra dang don du 'brel ba ni brdar btags pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the relation between words and their referents is a matter of social convention.

original: dper na bum pa la yang zla ba'i sgrar brjod par bya ba nyid du rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la yang zla ba'i sgrar brjod par bya ba nyid du rung ngo //
translated: For example, it is suitable to refer to a pot as the referent of the word ‚Äúmoon.‚Äù

original: rang gi tshig gis sel ba ni dper na rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis sel ba ni dper na rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Refutation by one‚Äôs own words is like, for example, the statement, ‚ÄúInference is not a valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: gang zhig rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes smra na yang /
analyzed: gang zhig rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes smra na yang /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúInference is not a valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: de ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal to /
analyzed: de ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal to /
translated: But that contradicts his own words.

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin na tshig de nyid kyang brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin na tshig de nyid kyang brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If inference were not a valid cognition, then even that statement would not be a subject of discussion.

original: 'di ltar tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus la /
translated: Because a statement is included in inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin na tshig kyang tshad mar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin na tshig kyang tshad mar ga la 'gyur /
translated: If inference is not a valid cognition, how could a statement be a valid cognition?

original: @24a * // tshig de tshad ma ma yin na ci'i phyir brjod ces rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo //üîΩphyogs ltar snang ba bzhin bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba la lung dang 'gal ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i khongs su 'dus par mkhyen nas /

translated: If that statement is not a valid cognition, why would you make it? original: grub pa dang ma grub kyang sgrub pa nyid du 'dod pa dang / de'i tshe rgol ba bdag nyid kyis sgrub par mi 'dod pa dang / smras pa tsam dang bsal ba las bzlog pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub kyang sgrub pa nyid du 'dod pa dang / de'i tshe rgol ba bdag nyid kyis sgrub par mi 'dod pa dang / smras pa tsam dang bsal ba las bzlog pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: and that which is established and not established as the probandum, and at that time, that which the proponent himself does not wish to establish, and that which is the opposite of what is merely stated and what is eliminated is the probandum.

original: 'dir bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni re re la yang sbyar bar bya ste /üîΩdes na 'di skad du grub pa las bzlog pa dang / ma grub kyang sgrub pa nyid 'dod pa las bzlog pa dang / de'i tshe rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par mi 'dod pa las bzlog pa dang / smras pa tsam las bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni re re la yang sbyar bar bya ste / des na 'di skad du grub pa las bzlog pa dang / ma grub kyang sgrub pa nyid 'dod pa las bzlog pa dang / de'i tshe rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par mi 'dod pa las bzlog pa dang / smras pa tsam las bzlog pa dang /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúopposite‚Äù should be applied to each of the four.

original: bsams pa tsam las bzlog pa ni phyogs yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsams pa tsam las bzlog pa ni phyogs yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it is taught that the opposite of what is established, the opposite of what is not established as the probandum but is accepted as the probandum, the opposite of what the proponent himself does not wish to establish at that time, and the opposite of what is merely stated and what is merely intended should be regarded as the thesis.

original: de ltar re zhig de ni bzlog pa'i sgo nas phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig de ni bzlog pa'i sgo nas phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that is the definition of a thesis from the perspective of the opposite.

original: da ni bsgrub pa'i ngo bor ston par byed do //
analyzed: da ni bsgrub pa'i ngo bor ston par byed do //
translated: Now, he shows the definition of a thesis in terms of what is to be established.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bor zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bor zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the nature of that‚Äù means ‚Äúin the nature of the probandum alone.‚Äù

original: rgol ba'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa sel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe opponent‚Äôs assertion‚Äù is the assertion of the author of the treatise.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni smras pa tsam nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni smras pa tsam nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAssertion‚Äù is not just a statement.

original: ma bsal ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma bsal ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot eliminated‚Äù means ‚Äúthe property of the subject.‚Äù

original: phyogs zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde ltar na phyogs kyi mtshan nyid skyon med par bstan la yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar na phyogs kyi mtshan nyid skyon med par bstan la yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúPosition‚Äù means ‚Äúthe probandum.‚ÄùüîΩThus, the definition of the position is taught without fault.

original: de ltar phyogs kyi mtshan nyid nyes pa dang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs kyi mtshan nyid nyes pa dang bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the definition of the position is explained without fault.

original: de ltar re zhig yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, inference endowed with the correct definition has been explained.

original: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the apparent inference, he says:

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ste zhes smras ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ste zhes smras ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The inference for the sake of others is the statement of a reason having the three modes.

original: smras pa zhes smos pas ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang 'brel par ston to //
analyzed: smras pa zhes smos pas ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang 'brel par ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äústatement‚Äù shows that it is related to a seeming reason.üîΩWith respect to that, even if one does not state the three modes, it is a seeming proof.

original: de la tshul gsum pas tshul gcig ma smras na yang sgrub pa ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba @24b ni phyogs kyi chos dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshul gsum pas tshul gcig ma smras na yang sgrub pa ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba @24b ni phyogs kyi chos dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The three modes are the property of the subject, the forward pervasion, and the counter pervasion.

original: tshul gsum las gal te gcig nyid ma brjod na yang de'i tshe ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul gsum las gal te gcig nyid ma brjod na yang de'i tshe ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not state any one of the three modes, then it is said to be a ‚Äúflawed proof that is incomplete.‚ÄùüîΩEven if one states them, if there is doubt or nonestablishment with respect to the subject or the property of the subject, then it is a flawed proof that is contradictory.

original: de smras kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa gnyis la ma grub bam the tshom za na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum las gang yang rung ba zhig smras kyang /
analyzed: de smras kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa gnyis la ma grub bam the tshom za na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum las gang yang rung ba zhig smras kyang /
translated: Even if one states any one of the three modes, if there is doubt or nonestablishment with respect to the subject or the property of the subject, then it is a flawed proof that is contradictory.

original: gal te rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis la ma grub bam the tshom za bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis la ma grub bam the tshom za bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the proponent and opponent do not agree or have doubts about the property of the subject,

original: 'on kyang bsgrub pa ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub pa ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: then it is a pseudo-reason.

original: de ltar re zhig bsgrub pa ltar snang ba spyir bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bsgrub pa ltar snang ba spyir bstan to //
translated: Thus, in general, pseudo-reasons have been presented.

original: bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos can dang 'brel pa'i tshul gcig ma grub bam the tshom za na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos can dang 'brel pa'i tshul gcig ma grub bam the tshom za na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to present them in particular, he says: If the mode of the property of the subject is not established or is doubted, it is a pseudo-reason of non-establishment.

original: chos can dang 'brel pa ni chos can dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: chos can dang 'brel pa ni chos can dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The mode of the property of the subject is the property of the subject.

original: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the property of the subject.

original: de ma grub bam the tshom za ba ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ma grub bam the tshom za ba ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: If it is not established or is doubted, it is a pseudo-reason called non-establishment.

original: dpe bstan ba'i phyir dper na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa la mig gis gzung ba nyid ni gnyi ga la ma grub pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpe bstan ba'i phyir dper na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa la mig gis gzung ba nyid ni gnyi ga la ma grub pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to present an example, he says: For example, in the proof that sound is impermanent, being perceptible by the eye is not established for both.

original: sgra mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin par ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ga yang khas mi len to //üîΩshing rnams la sems pa yod par bsgrub pa la shun pa thams cad bshus nas 'chi ba ni phyir rgol ba las ma grub ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe phyogs kyi gos can na re shing rnams la sems pa yod de /üîΩshun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i phyir ro zhes sangs rgyas pa la tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sgra mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin par ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ga yang khas mi len to // shing rnams la sems pa yod par bsgrub pa la shun pa thams cad bshus nas 'chi ba ni phyir rgol ba las ma grub ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe phyogs kyi gos can na re shing rnams la sems pa yod de / shun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i phyir ro zhes sangs rgyas pa la tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: Both the proponent and opponent do not accept that sound is perceptible by the eye.üîΩIn the proof that trees have minds, the opponent‚Äôs reason ‚Äúbecause they die when all their bark is removed‚Äù is not established.üîΩWhen the one wearing the robes of the directions says to the Buddhist, ‚ÄúTrees have minds because they die when all their bark is removed,‚Äù

original: shing dag la shun pa thams cad bshus pas 'chi bar sangs rgyas pa la ma grub bo //
analyzed: shing dag la shun pa thams cad bshus pas 'chi bar sangs rgyas pa la ma grub bo //
translated: then for the Buddhist, the reason ‚Äúbecause they die when all their bark is removed‚Äù is not established for trees.

original: ci'i phyir ma grub zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma grub zhe na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: de ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid la 'chi ba yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid la 'chi ba yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is accepted that death is the cessation of consciousness, faculties, and life.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / tshe zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩde dag 'gag pa ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / tshe zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // de dag 'gag pa ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'o //
translated: Consciousness, faculties, and life force are to be connected with each of the terms.üîΩTheir cessation is the cessation of consciousness, faculties, and life force.

original: mtshan nyid de 'chi ba gang la 'chi ba de ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'chi ba yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de 'chi ba gang la 'chi ba de ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'chi ba yin te /
translated: Death is characterized by the cessation of consciousness, faculties, and life force.

original: sangs rgyas pa dag ni de lta bu'i 'chi ba khas len gyi skam pa tsam la ni ma yin no //üîΩde yang shing dag la mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i 'chi @25a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag ni de lta bu'i 'chi ba khas len gyi skam pa tsam la ni ma yin no // de yang shing dag la mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i 'chi @25a * //
translated: Buddhists accept death in this sense, not mere drying up.üîΩAnd that is impossible for trees,

original: ba shing dag la mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: ba shing dag la mi srid pa'o //
translated: that kind of death is impossible for trees.

original: bde ba la sogs pa sems pa med par sgrub pa la skye ba can nam mi rtag pa nyid ni grangs can rgol ba bdag nyid la ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba gang gi tshe /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sems pa med par sgrub pa la skye ba can nam mi rtag pa nyid ni grangs can rgol ba bdag nyid la ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba gang gi tshe /
translated: In the proof that pleasure and so on are not mental, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya opponent‚Äôs production or impermanence is not established for himself.

original: grangs can na re bde ba can la sogs pa ni sems pa med pa ste /
analyzed: grangs can na re bde ba can la sogs pa ni sems pa med pa ste /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya says, ‚ÄúThe Buddha and so on are not sentient,üîΩbecause they are born or because they are impermanent.‚Äù

original: skye ba'i phyir ram mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes sangs rgyas pa la tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir ram mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes sangs rgyas pa la tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the SƒÅ·πÉkhya takes that as a valid cognition,

original: bde ba la sogs pa dag la skye ba 'am mi rtag par ni grangs can bdag nyid la ma grub ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dag la skye ba 'am mi rtag par ni grangs can bdag nyid la ma grub ste /
translated: the SƒÅ·πÉkhya himself has not established that pleasure and so on are born or impermanent.

original: de'i ni ci yang skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //üîΩde bzhin du de'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i ni ci yang skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do // de bzhin du de'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: Because for him nothing is born or destroyed.

original: de'i gzhi la the tshom za na ma grub ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe /üîΩgtan tshig bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i gzhi la the tshom za na ma grub ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe / gtan tshig bdag nyid dam /
translated: Similarly, if there is doubt about the nature of that or its basis, it is called unestablished.

original: de'i gzhi la the tshom za bar gyur na /
analyzed: de'i gzhi la the tshom za bar gyur na /
translated: When there is doubt about the nature of the reason or its basis,

original: de'i tshe grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: at that time it is a fallacious reason that appears to be established.

original: 'dir dpe ni /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni /
translated: Here is an example:

original: dper na me bsgrub par bya ba la rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na me bsgrub par bya ba la rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For example, when establishing fire, the elements that are doubted as being things such as steam are like that.

original: rlangs pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rlangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rlangs pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rlangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those which are steam, etc. are steam, etc.

original: de dag gi dngos po ni rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po ni rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: The nature of those is the nature of steam, etc.

original: rlangs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rlangs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the essence of steam, etc.

original: 'byung ba rnams 'dus pa ni 'byung ba 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams 'dus pa ni 'byung ba 'dus pa ste /
translated: The collection of the elements is the collection of elements.

original: me grub par bya ba la de gtan tshigs su byed na gang gi tshe 'di ci rlangs pa'am /üîΩrdul lam ; du ba 'am /
analyzed: me grub par bya ba la de gtan tshigs su byed na gang gi tshe 'di ci rlangs pa'am / rdul lam ; du ba 'am /
translated: If that is taken as the reason for establishing fire, then when there is doubt as to whether it is steam,üîΩsmoke,

original: khug rna yin zhes rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: khug rna yin zhes rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: or fog, it is an unestablished reason that appears to be a reason, because of the doubt as to the nature of steam, etc.

original: de'i gzhi la the tshom za ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i gzhi la the tshom za ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the doubt as to its basis,

original: dper na rma bya'i sgra grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rma bya'i sgra grags pa'i phyir /
translated: he says, for example, because the sound of a peacock is heard,

original: ri sul 'di na rma bya yod do zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ri sul 'di na rma bya yod do zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: a peacock exists in this mountain valley.

original: rma bya'i sgra 'byin pa ni rma bya'i sgra'o //
analyzed: rma bya'i sgra 'byin pa ni rma bya'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound of a peacock is the sound of a peacock.

original: ri sul ni ri'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: ri sul ni ri'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: A mountain valley is one part of a mountain.

original: gal te la la zhig 'di skad du rma bya'i sgra grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te la la zhig 'di skad du rma bya'i sgra grags pa'i phyir /
translated: If someone were to make the following statement:

original: ris sul 'di na rma bya yod do zhes tshad mar byed na /
analyzed: ris sul 'di na rma bya yod do zhes tshad mar byed na /
translated: ‚ÄúSince the sound of a peacock‚Äôs cry is heard, a peacock exists in this mountain cave,‚Äù

original: de na rma bya'i sgra grags pa ni des na 'dod pa dang 'brel pa'i ri sul ni the tshom za'o //
analyzed: de na rma bya'i sgra grags pa ni des na 'dod pa dang 'brel pa'i ri sul ni the tshom za'o //
translated: then one would doubt whether the mountain cave connected with that sound is the one that is desired.

original: ji ltar the tshom za zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar the tshom za zhe na ;
translated: How is there doubt?

original: sgra grags pa'i yul mi rtogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrma bya'i sgra de grags pa'i yul la the tshom za ste /
analyzed: sgra grags pa'i yul mi rtogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te / rma bya'i sgra de grags pa'i yul la the tshom za ste /
translated: He says: ‚Äúbecause the place where the sound is heard is not ascertained.‚ÄùüîΩOne doubts the place where that sound of a peacock is heard.

original: rma bya'i sgra 'di ri sul gang na grags zhes de la the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: rma bya'i sgra 'di ri sul gang na grags zhes de la the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: One doubts whether that sound of a peacock is heard in this mountain cave.

original: chos can ma grub na yang ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can ma grub na yang ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If the property possessor is not established, then the reason is not established.

original: dper na bdag thams cad na gnas par sgrub pa la @25b thams cad la dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩkun na gnas pa ni thams cad na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dper na bdag thams cad na gnas par sgrub pa la @25b thams cad la dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni / kun na gnas pa ni thams cad na gnas pa ste /
translated: For example, in the proof that ‚Äúthe self is all-pervading,‚Äù the property of the subject, ‚Äúthe quality of being observed in all,‚Äù is not established.üîΩ‚ÄúAll-pervading‚Äù means ‚Äúall-pervading.‚Äù

original: thams cad na yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad na yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúAll-pervading‚Äù means ‚Äúexisting in all.‚Äù

original: thams cad na dmigs pa'i yon tan rnams gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad na dmigs pa'i yon tan rnams gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin all places‚Äù is to be construed with the phrase ‚Äúthe qualities that are observed.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni thams cad dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni thams cad dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid do //
translated: The property of that is the quality of being observed in all places.

original: su zhig thams cad na dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid kyis bdag thams cad na gnas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de la gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: su zhig thams cad na dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid kyis bdag thams cad na gnas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de la gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
translated: If someone were to prove that the self exists in all places by the quality of being observed in all places, then the reason would be unestablished.

original: 'di ltar gang na thams cad na dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid kyi chos yod par brjod pa'i bdag de nyid ma grub bo ;
analyzed: 'di ltar gang na thams cad na dmigs pa'i yon tan nyid kyi chos yod par brjod pa'i bdag de nyid ma grub bo ;
translated: This is because the self that is said to have the property of being observed in all places is not established.

original: pha rol po'i lo rgyus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po'i lo rgyus ni 'di yin te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs story is as follows.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni bdag gi yon tan rnams yin zhes grags la de dag kyang yul thams cad na ngas pa'i lha sbyin la dmigs so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni bdag gi yon tan rnams yin zhes grags la de dag kyang yul thams cad na ngas pa'i lha sbyin la dmigs so //
translated: It is well known that pleasure and so on are the qualities of the self, and they are observed in Devadatta, who exists in all places.

original: bya ba med pa'i phyir bdag la ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de /
analyzed: bya ba med pa'i phyir bdag la ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de /
translated: The self does not have coming and going because it does not have action.

original: gang gi phyir de'i yon tan thams cad ni dmigs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i yon tan thams cad ni dmigs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because all of its qualities are observed,

original: bdag ni thams cad na gnas par nges so zhe'o /
analyzed: bdag ni thams cad na gnas par nges so zhe'o /
translated: I am certain that I exist everywhere.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: // / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // / bam po gsum pa /
translated: I am certain that I exist in all places.

original: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i tshul gcig ma grub na yang ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te zhes bya ba ni ldog ba la ma grub na ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i tshul gcig ma grub na yang ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te zhes bya ba ni ldog ba la ma grub na ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, if the mode of non-existence in the discordant side is not established, it is a fallacious reason of uncertainty.

original: des bstan pa'i phyir dper na sgra rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos su bsgrub pa la gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la 'am /
analyzed: des bstan pa'i phyir dper na sgra rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos su bsgrub pa la gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la 'am /
translated: For example, in the proof of the property of the subject, such as the permanence of sound, the property such as being an object of knowledge exists in all concordant and discordant sides,üîΩor in one side.

original: phyogs gcig la yod ba'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la yod ba'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever property is permanent, etc., is permanence, etc.

original: de bzhin du gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whatever property is an object of knowledge, etc., is an object of knowledge, etc.

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rtag go zhes sgrub pa la gzhal bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod do //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rtag go zhes sgrub pa la gzhal bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod do //
translated: In the proof that sound is permanent because of being a perceptible object, perceptible object exists in the homogeneous set and in the heterogeneous set.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir sgra ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa la mi rtag pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod la /üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir sgra ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa la mi rtag pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod la / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod do //
translated: In the proof that sound is not a product of effort because of being impermanent, impermanence exists in one part of the homogeneous set and in the heterogeneous set.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir sgra ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bsgrub ba la mi rtag pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod @26a * //üîΩla ; mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir sgra ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bsgrub ba la mi rtag pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod @26a * // la ; mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod do //
translated: In the proof that sound is a product of effort because of being impermanent, impermanence exists in the entire homogeneous set and in one part of the heterogeneous set.

original: reg ba ma yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rtag go zhes sgrub pa la reg pa ma yin pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka'i phyogs gcig la yod do //
analyzed: reg ba ma yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rtag go zhes sgrub pa la reg pa ma yin pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka'i phyogs gcig la yod do //
translated: In the proof that sound is permanent because of not being a tangible object, not being a tangible object exists in one part of the homogeneous set and in one part of the heterogeneous set.

original: des ni mthun mong gi ma nges pa rnam pa bzhi bstan to //üîΩde bzhin du tshul de nyid la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa kho na ste zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid la /
analyzed: des ni mthun mong gi ma nges pa rnam pa bzhi bstan to // de bzhin du tshul de nyid la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa kho na ste zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid la /
translated: This shows the four kinds of common indecision.üîΩSimilarly, when one is in doubt about the very same method, it is also indecision.

original: gang gi tshe the tshom du gyur pa de'i tsho yang ma nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe the tshom du gyur pa de'i tsho yang ma nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: When one is in doubt about the nonexistence of the counter-position, then at that time it is also indecision.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir dper na brjod par 'dod pa'i mi la la zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir dper na brjod par 'dod pa'i mi la la zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: In order to show the example, he says, for example, it is like the proof that a certain person who is desired to be described is not omniscient,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgrub pa la smra ba la sogs pa'i chos lta bu ste zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i mi la la zhig smra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgrub pa la smra ba la sogs pa'i chos lta bu ste zhes bya ba smos te / gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i mi la la zhig smra ba'i phyir /
translated: or is endowed with attachment, etc., on the basis of the property of the subject, such as speaking.üîΩA certain person who is desired to be described is not omniscient because he speaks.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes smra bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du smra ba kho na'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes smra bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du smra ba kho na'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes smra na /
translated: Similarly, he is endowed with attachment, etc., because he speaks.

original: de'i smra ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni ma nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i smra ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni ma nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: The properties of being a speaker, etc. are not ascertained.

original: ma nges pa de ming ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: ma nges pa de ming ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the name of that which is not ascertained?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa de the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa de the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe reversal from the discordant class is uncertain.‚Äù

original: 'di la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pas 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ba yin te ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pas 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ba yin te ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since there is uncertainty about the reversal from the discordant class in this case, it is said that there is uncertainty about the reversal from the discordant class. This is synonymous with saying that there is uncertainty about the reversal.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la zhig smra bar ma mthong ba la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la zhig smra bar ma mthong ba la /
translated: You have not seen anyone who is omniscient speak in a way that contradicts the Dharma.

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir na ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir na ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since you have not seen such a contradiction, how can you establish a reversal from the omniscient one‚Äôs word?

original: ci ltar na 'di ma nges pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na 'di ma nges pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can you say that this is uncertain?

original: de'i phyir / thams cad mkhyen pa'i smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni yul bltar mi snang ba nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / thams cad mkhyen pa'i smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni yul bltar mi snang ba nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The non-observation of that type is a cause of doubt because the object is not visible.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa smra bar ma mthong du zin kyang mi dmigs pa 'di ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yang the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa smra bar ma mthong du zin kyang mi dmigs pa 'di ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yang the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Even though one does not see the omniscient speaker, this non-observation is a cause of doubt because it has the nature of an invisible object.

original: ldog pa bsgrub bar bzod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa bsgrub bar bzod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable as a reason to prove the opposite.

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa la smra ba la sogs pa ldog pa ni the tshom du 'gyur ba yin te zhes bya ba ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i mi dmigs pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu kho na yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa la smra ba la sogs pa ldog pa ni the tshom du 'gyur ba yin te zhes bya ba ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i mi dmigs pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu kho na yin pa'i phyir
translated: Therefore, the opposite of non-omniscience is said to be a doubt because the non-observation of an invisible object is a cause of doubt alone.

original: / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las smra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi @26b log pa'i the tshom du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las smra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi @26b log pa'i the tshom du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The opposite of omniscience is non-omniscience. The reason, the characteristic of speech, is uncertain, because it is possible that there is omniscience even though there is speech.

original: mi dmigs pa ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ldog pa bsgrub pa ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ldog pa bsgrub pa ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though non-apprehension is not a proof of the negation, because it is the nature of an object that is not seen,

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pas sgrub par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pas sgrub par byed do zhe na /
translated: it is a proof by the apprehension of something contradictory to the nature.

original: de'i phyir smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause there is no contradiction between speech and omniscience.‚Äù

original: smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'gal ba med de /
translated: Speech and omniscience are not contradictory.

original: de bas na ma mthong du zin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de ni smra ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ldog pa ni mi 'grub ste the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na ma mthong du zin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de ni smra ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ldog pa ni mi 'grub ste the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, even though it is not seen, omniscience is not established as the negation, ‚ÄúThat which is omniscience is not speech,‚Äù because there is doubt.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa smra bar mthong du zin kyang smra ba nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i nyid 'gal ba med pas smras pa nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las ldog par mi 'grub ste the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa smra bar mthong du zin kyang smra ba nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i nyid 'gal ba med pas smras pa nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las ldog par mi 'grub ste the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one sees the omniscient one speaking, it is not established that speaking is contradictory to omniscience, because of doubt.

original: de gnyis ci ltar 'gal ba med ce na /
analyzed: de gnyis ci ltar 'gal ba med ce na /
translated: How are those two not contradictory?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'gal ba ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te gang la 'gal ba gang ci snyed pa de thams cad ni rnam pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'gal ba ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te gang la 'gal ba gang ci snyed pa de thams cad ni rnam pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThe contradiction of things is twofold.‚Äù Whatever contradiction there is, all of that is included within these two.

original: gcig ni dngos po las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ni dngos po las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is contradiction in terms of things.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal pa'o //üîΩdngos po las gyur pa'i 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal pa'o // dngos po las gyur pa'i 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal ba ste /
translated: The second is contradiction in terms of characteristics.

original: grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate contradiction in terms of things, it says, ‚ÄúThe arising of a complete cause in the absence of another is contradictory, like the sensation of cold and heat.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe dngos po'i rgyu'i tshig ma nyams par rgyu chags su 'jug pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po'i rgyu'i tshig ma nyams par rgyu chags su 'jug pa na /
translated: When the words of the cause of a thing are not impaired, and the cause is engaged in a continuous series,

original: dngos po gzhan zhig nye bar gyur na ldog par gyur pa de'i tshe 'gal bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan zhig nye bar gyur na ldog par gyur pa de'i tshe 'gal bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: if another thing arises and the first thing ceases, then they are understood to be contradictory.

original: dper na grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa gnyis la grang ba'i rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba na /
analyzed: dper na grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa gnyis la grang ba'i rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba na /
translated: For example, when the cause of cold is present, and the cause of heat is not complete,

original: gang gi tshe tsha ba nye bar gyur ba de'i tshe grang ba ldog par 'gyur ba de lta bu ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tsha ba nye bar gyur ba de'i tshe grang ba ldog par 'gyur ba de lta bu ste /
translated: if heat arises, then cold ceases.

original: de gnyis ni 'jig rtan na 'gal bar rtogs so //üîΩgcig gis gcig spong ba ste gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'jig rtan na 'gal bar rtogs so // gcig gis gcig spong ba ste gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas te /
translated: These two are understood to be contradictory in the world.üîΩThey are mutually exclusive, having the characteristic of being mutually exclusive.üîΩFor example, existence and nonexistence.

original: yod pa dang med pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: Those that have the characteristic of being mutually exclusive are mutually exclusive.

original: de'i dngos po ni gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kho na ste des 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kho na ste des 'gal ba'o //
translated: Its nature is that of mutual exclusion, and that is the contradiction.

original: dper na yod pa dang med pa gnyis la yod pa ni med pa spangs pas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dper na yod pa dang med pa gnyis la yod pa ni med pa spangs pas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: For example, existence and nonexistence are established by the exclusion of nonexistence and existence, respectively.

original: med pa ni yod pa spangs pas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: med pa ni yod pa spangs pas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Nonexistence is established by the exclusion of existence.

original: 'gal ba rnam pa de gnyis @27a * //
analyzed: 'gal ba rnam pa de gnyis @27a * //
translated: These two types of contradictionüîΩare impossible in omniscience and speech.

original: yang smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi srid ces bya ba ni 'gal ba rnams pa de gnyis gang yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / smra ba nyid du ldan pa la mi srid de /
analyzed: yang smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi srid ces bya ba ni 'gal ba rnams pa de gnyis gang yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / smra ba nyid du ldan pa la mi srid de /
translated: Neither of these two types of contradiction is possible in the combination of omniscience and speech.

original: smra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar gyur na ldog pa yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: smra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar gyur na ldog pa yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: When the cause of speech occurs without deficiency, omniscience is imminent, and we do not see any contradiction.

original: smra ba nyid spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: smra ba nyid spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is omniscience established by the exclusion of speech.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid spangs pas smra ba nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid spangs pas smra ba nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not the case that the very fact of his speaking is established by the rejection of omniscience.

original: 'gal ba med du zin kyang 'gal ba med bzhin du smra ba nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis zlog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba med du zin kyang 'gal ba med bzhin du smra ba nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis zlog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if there were no contradiction, the very fact of his speaking would be contradicted by omniscience.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / mi 'gal ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi 'gal ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no contradiction,

original: mi dmigs kyang med pa rtogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs kyang med pa rtogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: non-apprehension does not prove nonexistence.

original: gang du 'gal bar mi brjod par der dngos po gnyis pa mi dmigs pa med par yid ches par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang du 'gal bar mi brjod par der dngos po gnyis pa mi dmigs pa med par yid ches par mi nus so //
translated: Where there is no contradiction, one cannot be certain of the non-apprehension of a second entity.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that he is not omniscient,

original: smra ba nyid kyis ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni re zhig de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: smra ba nyid kyis ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni re zhig de lta bu yin no //
translated: the fact that his speaking is doubted is, for the time being, like that.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par ston pa la yang ldog par the tshom za bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par ston pa la yang ldog par the tshom za bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the fact that he is possessed of attachment, etc. is also doubted,üîΩhe says:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / tshig la sogs pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / tshig la sogs pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because attachment, etc. and speech, etc. are not established as the entities of cause and effect.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni tshig gi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma grub po //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni tshig gi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma grub po //
translated: It is not established that attachment, etc. are the cause of speech, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang tshig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub na de la cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang tshig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub na de la cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If attachment, etc. and speech, etc. are not established as the entities of cause and effect, what follows?

original: don gzhan rgyu ma yin pa ldog pas tshig la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu ma yin pa ldog pas tshig la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe reversal of a different object that is not a cause does not reverse speech, etc.‚Äù

original: don gzhan ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don gzhan ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: A different object is attachment, etc.

original: rgyur ma gyur pa de las log pas ci'i phyir tshig la sogs pa ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyur ma gyur pa de las log pas ci'i phyir tshig la sogs pa ldog par 'gyur /
translated: Since it does not become the cause, why does the reversal of that cause speech, etc.?

original: de ltar na tshig la sogs pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba dang ldan pa'i ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar smra ba nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gal ba ci yang med la /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig la sogs pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba dang ldan pa'i ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar smra ba nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gal ba ci yang med la /
translated: This is because there is no contradiction at all between being a speaker and being omniscient.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang tshig kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang tshig kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: And because attachment and so on are not the cause of words,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa log pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa log pas tshig ldog pa la the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa log pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa log pas tshig ldog pa la the tshom za ba ste /
translated: the reversal of words is doubtful due to the reversal of non-omniscience and the reversal of attachment and so on.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba'i med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba'i med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is called an inconclusive reason due to doubt about the reversal.üîΩThe understanding of the two modes as contradictory is contradictory.

original: tshul gnyis kyi phyin ci log tu @27b rtogs pa ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe tshul gnyis kyi phyin ci log tu grub pa de'i tshe 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul gnyis kyi phyin ci log tu @27b rtogs pa ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe tshul gnyis kyi phyin ci log tu grub pa de'i tshe 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: When the two modes are established as contradictory, then it is a contradictory apparent reason.

original: gnyis po gang dag gi zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshul gnyis po gang dag phyin ci log tu rtogs pa ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po gang dag gi zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshul gnyis po gang dag phyin ci log tu rtogs pa ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of a contradictory reason is the erroneous understanding of the two modes.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
translated: The existence in the similar class and the non-existence in the dissimilar class is what is meant by ‚Äúpositive concomitance‚Äù and ‚Äúnegative concomitance.‚Äù

original: de ni re zhig 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the general definition of a contradictory reason.

original: bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the specific [contradictory reasons], [Dharmakƒ´rti] says:

original: byas pa nyid dang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ni rtag pa nyid sgrub pa la 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgang gis byas pa gang nyid dam /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ni rtag pa nyid sgrub pa la 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba smras te / gang gis byas pa gang nyid dam /
translated: ‚ÄúBeing produced‚Äù and ‚Äúarising immediately upon the exertion‚Äù are contradictory reasons for proving permanence.

original: bsams ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyis rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bsams ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyis rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: By what is produced, or by arising immediately upon the exertion, permanence is proven, then it is a contradictory apparent reason.

original: ji ltar na 'dir phyin ci log tu grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dir phyin ci log tu grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they established as erroneous?

original: 'di gnyis kyis mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas phyin ci log tu grub zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas phyin ci log tu grub zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are called ‚Äúerroneous‚Äù because they do not exist in the similar class and they exist in the dissimilar class.

original: rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa la nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa la nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: In the proof of sound as impermanent, space, etc., are the similar class.

original: de la ni byas pa nyid dang / brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba gnyi ga mi srid do //
analyzed: de la ni byas pa nyid dang / brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba gnyi ga mi srid do //
translated: In that, both being produced and arising from exertion are impossible.

original: mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Impermanent things such as pots, etc., are the dissimilar class.

original: de la ni de gnyi ga yod pa nyid de //
analyzed: de la ni de gnyi ga yod pa nyid de //
translated: In that, both of those do exist.

original: de ltar na de gnyis kyis phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de gnyis kyis phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, those two are established as erroneous.

original: de gnyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i phyin ci log tu grub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dag yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul de gnyis kyis phyin ci log tu grub pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i phyin ci log tu grub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dag yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul de gnyis kyis phyin ci log tu grub pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because those two are established as erroneous in the probandum, they are contradictory.

original: bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa ni bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir yang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa ni bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir yang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: The reason that is contradictory because it proves the opposite of the probandum is also a fallacious reason that is contradictory.

original: 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa 'gal ba gsum pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pas na 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa 'gal ba gsum pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pas na 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: Isn‚Äôt there a third type of contradiction that contradicts desire?

original: 'gal ba gsum pa na bstan bcos mdzad pas bstan to //
analyzed: 'gal ba gsum pa na bstan bcos mdzad pas bstan to //
translated: The third type of contradiction is taught by the author of the treatise.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate that, he says:

original: dper na 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed do //
translated: For example, the eyes and so on are for the benefit of another because they are composites.

original: mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are like the limbs such as the bed and seat.

original: de'i don ni rnam par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i don ni rnam par bshad zin to //
