translated: The meaning of that has already been explained.

original: 'gal ba 'di yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is this contradiction?

original: de ni @28a * //
analyzed: de ni @28a * //
translated: It is

original: 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: the assertion that that which is not a composite is for the benefit of another.

original: phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is contradictory because it is accomplished in a perverse manner.

original: gzhan dag gi don byed pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi don byed pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: The performance of the aims of others is the performance of the aims of others.

original: de'i dngos po ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid do //
translated: The state of that is the very performance of the aims of others.

original: 'dus pa ma yin pa la gzhan gyi don byed pa ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ma yin pa la gzhan gyi don byed pa ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: The performance of the aims of others that is not a collection is the performance of the aims of others that is not a collection.

original: de ni de'i 'dod pa yang yin la 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa yang yin no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'dod pa yang yin la 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa yang yin no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: That is the desire of that, and it is the performance of the aims of others that is not a collection.

original: de phyin ci log pa ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed par de'i 'dod pa dang phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: de phyin ci log pa ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed par de'i 'dod pa dang phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: The perversion of that is the perversion of the desire of the performance of the aims of others that is not a collection.

original: de sgrub pa la ni de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de sgrub pa la ni de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The accomplishment of that is called that.

original: de lta bas na de'i 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa ni 'dod pa ni phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir de 'gal ba nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa ni 'dod pa ni phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir de 'gal ba nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the performance of the aims of others that is not a collection of that is seen to be contradictory because it is accomplished in a perverse manner.

original: ci'i phyir ma smras she na zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pas khas blangs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma smras she na zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pas khas blangs pa yang yin la /
translated: Why is it not stated?

original: 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid dang yang ldan yang zhes bsams pa'o//
analyzed: 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid dang yang ldan yang zhes bsams pa'o//
translated: The treatise author thinks that although it is accepted, it also possesses the characteristic of contradiction.üîΩBecause it is included within just this,

original: 'di nyid kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'di gnyis bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi nang du 'dus pas logs shig tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'di nyid kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'di gnyis bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi nang du 'dus pas logs shig tu ma brjod do //
translated: the two contradictions that are explained are included within just this, so they are not stated separately.

original: nang du 'dus pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nang du 'dus pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is included within just this, he says:

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba log par bsgrub pas 'di gnyis dang tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba log par bsgrub pas 'di gnyis dang tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is the opposite of the probandum, it is not different from these two.

original: byas pa nyid dang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gtan tshigs dag ni rtag pa nyid sgrub pa la bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dag tu bshad la /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gtan tshigs dag ni rtag pa nyid sgrub pa la bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dag tu bshad la /
translated: The reason of being produced and having the characteristic of arising immediately upon being sought are explained as contradictory because they prove permanence by proving the opposite of the probandum.

original: 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pas de gnyis dang 'gal ba nyid du 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pas de gnyis dang 'gal ba nyid du 'dra'o //
translated: This is also similar to the other two, because it proves the opposite of the probandum.

original: snga ma de la ni tshig tu smos pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la phyin ci log tu sgrub la /
analyzed: snga ma de la ni tshig tu smos pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la phyin ci log tu sgrub la /
translated: In the former case, the opposite of the probandum is proved by the words,

original: 'dir ni 'dod pa'i don la phyin ci log tu sgrub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dod pa'i don la phyin ci log tu sgrub pa ma yin nam /
translated: but here, the opposite of the intended meaning is not proved.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar de gnyis dang 'di 'dra zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar de gnyis dang 'di 'dra zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, how are these two similar?

original: 'dod pa dang smras pa gnyis la bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ni bye brag ci yang med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang smras pa gnyis la bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ni bye brag ci yang med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, there is no difference between what is intended and what is stated in terms of being the probandum.

original: 'dod pa gang yin pa dang smras pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni bsgrub par bya ba la bye brag ci yang med do zhes de ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'dod pa gang yin pa dang smras pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni bsgrub par bya ba la bye brag ci yang med do zhes de ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: There is no difference between what is intended and what is stated in terms of being the probandum.

original: tshul gnyis las gcig ni ma grub la cig shos ni the tshom za na yang ma nges pa yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa kho na la gcig ni ma grub la /
analyzed: tshul gnyis las gcig ni ma grub la cig shos ni the tshom za na yang ma nges pa yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa kho na la gcig ni ma grub la /
translated: When one of the two modes is not established and the other is doubted, it is called ‚Äúuncertain.‚Äù

original: cig shos la ni the tshom za na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin @28b no ;
analyzed: cig shos la ni the tshom za na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin @28b no ;
translated: If there is doubt about the other, then the reason is not ascertained.

original: / dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To illustrate this, he says:

original: dper na smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: dper na smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúHe is free from attachment because he speaks,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: or he is omniscient.‚Äù

original: de'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of this has already been explained.üîΩHere, the pervasion is not established, but there is doubt about the forward pervasion.

original: 'di la ldog pa ni ma grub la rjes su 'gro ba la ni the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba 'di la ldog pa ni med par rjes su 'gro ba la ni the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ldog pa ni ma grub la rjes su 'gro ba la ni the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba 'di la ldog pa ni med par rjes su 'gro ba la ni the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: In this syllogism, there is no pervasion, but there is doubt about the forward pervasion.

original: 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa yin na /
translated: Thus, in the proof of omniscience, the discordant class is that which is not omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag las kyang tshig ni log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag las kyang tshig ni log pa ma yin no //
translated: But words are not absent from those who are not omniscient.

original: rjes su 'gro ba las the tshom za ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba las the tshom za ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To illustrate doubt about the forward pervasion, he says:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag ni bskal ba yin pa'i phyir de la tshig la sogs pa yod dam med par the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag ni bskal ba yin pa'i phyir de la tshig la sogs pa yod dam med par the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since omniscience and freedom from attachment are kalpas, one doubts whether they exist or not.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since omniscience and freedom from attachment are not objects of the sense faculties,

original: ci de la tshig yod dam med ces the tshom za ste /
analyzed: ci de la tshig yod dam med ces the tshom za ste /
translated: one doubts whether they exist or not.

original: 'di ltar dpe nyid du bstan pa'i mi gang yin pa de ci thams cad mkhyen pa zhig yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dpe nyid du bstan pa'i mi gang yin pa de ci thams cad mkhyen pa zhig yin te /
translated: One doubts whether the person who is taught as an example is omniscient or not,

original: smra'am / 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin la smra snyam pa ste /
analyzed: smra'am / 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin la smra snyam pa ste /
translated: whether he speaks or not, or whether he is not omniscient but speaks.

original: de la nges pa med do //üîΩtshul de gnyis nyid la the tshom za na ma nges pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de la nges pa med do // tshul de gnyis nyid la the tshom za na ma nges pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba'am /
translated: There is no certainty in this.üîΩIf one doubts both of those modes, it is called indefinite.

original: ldog pa gnyi ga la yang the tshom za bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ldog pa gnyi ga la yang the tshom za bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When one doubts both the forward and reverse pervasions,üîΩthen the reason is indefinite.

original: yang ma nges pa kho na'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //üîΩdpe bstan pa'i phyir dper na srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: yang ma nges pa kho na'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no // dpe bstan pa'i phyir dper na srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Or else, the reason is a fallacious one, because it is not ascertained.üîΩIn order to illustrate this, he says, for example, like the argument:

original: gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The living body is endowed with a self, because it is endowed with life and so on.üîΩWhat are life and so on?

original: srog la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni srog la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni srog la sogs pa ste /
translated: Life and so on are life and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'byed pa dang / 'dzum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'byed pa dang / 'dzum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The term and so on includes opening and shutting the eyes, extending and contracting the limbs, and so on.

original: bdag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Endowed with a self means

original: bdag longs spyod kyi rten nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag longs spyod kyi rten nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: the self exists as the basis of the enjoyment of the body.

original: gson po'i lus zhes bya ba des ni shi ba'i lus bsal to ;
analyzed: gson po'i lus zhes bya ba des ni shi ba'i lus bsal to ;
translated: The words living body exclude a dead body.

original: /'di re re shing ldog pa la the tshom za ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: /'di re re shing ldog pa la the tshom za ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that each of these reasons is doubtful, he says,

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa las gang la srog la sogs pa gnas par 'gyur ba'i gnas phung po gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa las gang la srog la sogs pa gnas par 'gyur ba'i gnas phung po gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: There is no other basis for the life-force, etc. that is either associated with a self or not associated with a self.

original: phung po ni gnyis te /
analyzed: phung po ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of basis:

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa ste /
translated: that which is associated with a self and that which is not associated with a self.

original: de la ma gtogs @29a * //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs @29a * //
translated: Apart from these two,

original: pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: there is no other basis.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni dngos po'i chos yin na /üîΩde bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis las log ste /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni dngos po'i chos yin na / de bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis las log ste /
translated: Since the possession of a life-force, etc. is a quality of an entity,

original: gzhan gang du gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gang du gnas par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be that the life-force, etc. are located in something that is other than that which is associated with a self or not associated with a self?

original: ci'i phyir phung po gsum pa mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po gsum pa mi srid ce na /
translated: Why is a third alternative impossible?

original: bdag gnas pa dang / rnam par gcod pa dag gis thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag gnas pa dang / rnam par gcod pa dag gis thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because all is protected by the two, i.e., by the life-force and by the severance of the life-force.

original: gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa ni gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa dag ste /
analyzed: gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa ni gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa dag ste /
translated: The life-force and the severance of the life-force are the two.

original: gnas pa ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni yod pa'o //
translated: The life-force is existence.

original: rnam par gcod pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ni med pa'o //
translated: The severance of the life-force is non-existence.

original: bdag gi gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa ni bdag nyid gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa dag go //
analyzed: bdag gi gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa ni bdag nyid gnas pa dang rnam par gcod pa dag go //
translated: Abiding in the self and cutting off in the self are abiding in the self and cutting off in the self.

original: de gnyis ni dngos po thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni dngos po thams cad bsdus te /
translated: These two include all things.

original: 'di ltar gang la bdag med gnas pa de ni bdag dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la bdag med gnas pa de ni bdag dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that in which the self abides is endowed with the self.

original: de la ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad ni bdag med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad ni bdag med pa yin no //
translated: All that is not included in that is without the self.

original: de'i phyir phung po gsum pa lta ga la srid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po gsum pa lta ga la srid de /
translated: Therefore, how could a third alternative be possible?

original: de ltar re zhig srog la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dag la ldog par ma grub po //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig srog la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dag la ldog par ma grub po //
translated: Thus, first, it is not established that the self exists in that which is endowed with life, etc., or in that which is without the self.

original: gal te de gnyis las ldog pa ma grub na de la rjes su 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de gnyis las ldog pa ma grub na de la rjes su 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is not established that the self is absent from these two, then it would follow that the self exists in that which is neither of the two.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis las gcig la gnas par yang nges pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩsrog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni bdag dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis las gcig la gnas par yang nges pa med de zhes bya ba smos te / srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni bdag dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no certainty that the self exists in either of the two.

original: bdag med pa la yod do zhes bya ba nges par bya mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag med pa la yod do zhes bya ba nges par bya mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be ascertained that that which is endowed with life, etc., exists in that which is endowed with the self or in that which is without the self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩbdag dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / bdag dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag med par sgrub pa la srog la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩbdag dang bcas pa nyid du nges pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: bdag med par sgrub pa la srog la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / bdag dang bcas pa nyid du nges pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: Because a life-force, etc. are not established in regard to something that is ascertained as having a self orüîΩas being without a self.üîΩA life-force, etc. are not seen in regard to a thing that is ascertained as having a self or

original: bdag med pa nyid du nges pa'i dngos po la srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid du nges pa'i dngos po la srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: as being without a self.

original: de'i phyir gnas par nges ba lta ga la yod //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas par nges ba lta ga la yod //
translated: Therefore, how could there be a determination in regard to something that is abiding?

original: de bas na gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi srog la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug sdud par byed pa na phyogs kyi chos ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi srog la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug sdud par byed pa na phyogs kyi chos ston par byed pa ste /
translated: Hence, when the opponent‚Äôs position is being summarized, the statement ‚Äúa life-force, etc. that are related to a living body‚Äù is being taught as the property of the subject.

original: gson po'i lus dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gson po'i lus dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat are related to a living body‚Äù is to be applied to the term ‚Äúlife-force, etc.‚Äù

original: de gang la yod pa de nyid ni gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can te /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de nyid ni gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can te /
translated: That which has that is ‚Äúrelated to a living body.‚Äù

original: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the term ‚Äúproperty of the subject.‚Äù

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa thams cad las ldog pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir de gnyis dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba 'dis ni mjug bsdus te /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa thams cad las ldog pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir de gnyis dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba 'dis ni mjug bsdus te /
translated: Since the self and all that is not the self are not established asüîΩopposite, they are not free from those two. This concludes the demonstration

original: ldog pa med par ston to //
analyzed: ldog pa med par ston to //
translated: that they are not free from those two.

original: @29b bdag gcig pu la yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @29b bdag gcig pu la yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the self is not established as a single entity,üîΩthere is no co-occurrence. This concludes the demonstration that there is no

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mjug pa sdud nas rjes su 'gro ba med par ston te /
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mjug pa sdud nas rjes su 'gro ba med par ston te /
translated: co-occurrence.

original: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ldog par ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ldog par ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the co-occurrence and the non-occurrence of the two are notüîΩestablished.

original: 'o na de la de gnyis med par nges pa yang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de la de gnyis med par nges pa yang yod do zhe na /
translated: But it is certain that they do not exist there!üîΩTherefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe ascertainment of the non-occurrence and the non-

original: de'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa las de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa las de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: co-occurrence of the self and that which is not the self is not possible.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bdag dang bcas pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis yod par ma nges pa de ltar med par yang ma nges te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dang bcas pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis yod par ma nges pa de ltar med par yang ma nges te /
translated: Just as it is uncertain whether there is concomitance and the absence of concomitance in the case of the existence of the self, it is also uncertain in the case of the nonexistence of the self.

original: de bzhin du bdag med pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be stated in the case of selflessness.

original: yod par ma nges pa med du zin kyang med par nges par go ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yod par ma nges pa med du zin kyang med par nges par go ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even though it is uncertain whether it exists, why is it not understood that it is certain that it does not exist?

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúconcomitance and the absence of concomitance are mutually exclusive in nature.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni gcig la gcig med pa'i ngo bor gnas pa dag yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gang na rjes su 'gro ba med par de na ldog pa yod pa'am /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni gcig la gcig med pa'i ngo bor gnas pa dag yin te / 'di ltar gang na rjes su 'gro ba med par de na ldog pa yod pa'am /
translated: Concomitance and the absence of concomitance are mutually exclusive in nature.üîΩThus, where there is no concomitance, there is the absence of concomitance.

original: gang na ldog pa med na rjes su 'gro ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang na ldog pa med na rjes su 'gro ba yod pa'o //
translated: Or, where there is no absence of concomitance, there is concomitance.

original: de gnyis phan tshun du rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin du chug na /
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun du rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin du chug na /
translated: Even if those two are mutually exclusive in nature,

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what follows from that?

original: gcig med par nges na cig shos yod par gdon mi za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang gi tshe de gnyis gcig la gcig med pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba med par nges pa gang yin pa des /
analyzed: gcig med par nges na cig shos yod par gdon mi za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi tshe de gnyis gcig la gcig med pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba med par nges pa gang yin pa des /
translated: Because if one is ascertained to be absent, the other definitely exists.

original: ldog pa yod par nges par gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: ldog pa yod par nges par gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro//
translated: When those two are present as the nature of mutual absence, then the ascertainment of the absence of concomitance definitely ascertains the presence of the reverse.

original: de bzhin du ldog pa med par nges pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba yod par nges par gdon mi za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ldog pa med par nges pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba yod par nges par gdon mi za bar 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, the ascertainment of the absence of the reverse definitely ascertains the presence of concomitance.

original: 'di ltar gang du srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yod pa med do zhes bya bar nges pa med par nges pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang du srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yod pa med do zhes bya bar nges pa med par nges pa yin la /
translated: Because in whatever place the existence of life and so on is ascertained to be absent, the absence of that is ascertained to be present.

original: gang du med pa med do zhes bya bar nges pa der yang yod par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du med pa med do zhes bya bar nges pa der yang yod par nges pa yin no //
translated: And in whatever place the absence of that is ascertained to be absent, the existence of that is ascertained to be present.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis la gcig med par nges na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis la gcig med par nges na /
translated: Because in that way, if one of the two, concomitance and the reverse, is ascertained to be absent, the other is definitely ascertained to be present.

original: cig shos yod par nges par gdon mi za ba de'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis la srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa med par nges pa yang med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: cig shos yod par nges par gdon mi za ba de'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis la srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa med par nges pa yang med pa kho na yin no //
translated: and the other must exist, there is no doubt. Therefore, it is certain that neither that which has a self nor that which is selfless has life, etc.üîΩFor this very reason, it is uncertain because there is doubt about the two, i.e., concomitance and the reverse.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis la the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rjes 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba nyid kyi phyir de @30a * //üîΩnyid ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis la the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rjes 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba nyid kyi phyir de @30a * // nyid ma nges pa yin no //
translated: This is because there is doubt about both concomitance and the reverse.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za bar zin kyang ma nges par 'gro /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za bar zin kyang ma nges par 'gro /
translated: Even though there is doubt about concomitance and the reverse, it is not uncertain.

original: ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shes la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shes la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause there is no certainty about the probandum and the other.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nges pa med pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nges pa med pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Because there is no certainty that the life-force, etc. are possessed by the discordant side, i.e., that which is being proven, therefore, it is uncertain.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba smras pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba smras pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In this way means in the manner of a statement.

original: tshul gsum po zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshul gsum po zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: The three modes are the property of the subject, the forward pervasion, and the counter pervasion.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Those are the fallacious reasons.üîΩEither one mode orüîΩtwo modes are not established orüîΩare doubted.

original: tshul re re'am /
analyzed: tshul re re'am /
translated: In some cases, one mode is not established orüîΩis doubted.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion is not established orüîΩis doubted.

original: gnyis gnyis la lar ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis gnyis la lar ma grub pa'am /
translated: In some cases, the counter pervasion is not established or

original: the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is doubted.

original: la lar ni tshul gcig ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: la lar ni tshul gcig ma grub pa'am /
translated: In some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are not established or

original: the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: are doubted.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory.

original: la lar par 'gyur ba'i 'khrul pa can gyi phyir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shes gtan tshigs gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: la lar par 'gyur ba'i 'khrul pa can gyi phyir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shes gtan tshigs gzhan ni med do //
translated: In some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory and doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful and contradictory.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory and doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful and contradictory.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory and doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful and contradictory.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory and doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful and contradictory.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory and doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful and contradictory.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory and doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful and contradictory.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are contradictory and doubtful.üîΩIn some cases, the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion are doubtful and contradictory.

original: sbyar ro // gtan tshigs ltar snang ba gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyar ro // gtan tshigs ltar snang ba gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three types of fallacious reason are the unestablished, the contradictory, and the uncertain.

original: ma grub pa dag dang / 'gal ba dag dang / ma nges pa rnams zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩ'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang the tshom gyi rgyur bshad ces bya ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa med pa ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'o ;
analyzed: ma grub pa dag dang / 'gal ba dag dang / ma nges pa rnams zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang the tshom gyi rgyur bshad ces bya ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa med pa ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'o ;
translated: The unestablished, the contradictory, and the uncertain are to be connected with the words ‚Äúare not reasons.‚ÄùüîΩThe contradictory, which is nonerroneous, is also said to be a cause of doubt.

original: / de 'di la yod pas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can no //
analyzed: / de 'di la yod pas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can no //
translated: The contradictory, which is nonerroneous, is the contradictory, which is nonerroneous.

original: yang na 'di 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas 'di ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can te /
analyzed: yang na 'di 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas 'di ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can te /
translated: Or, it is the contradictory, which is nonerroneous, because it has the nature of the contradictory, which is nonerroneous.

original: de ni bstan bcos byed pas ma nges par bshad do //
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos byed pas ma nges par bshad do //
translated: The author of the treatise explains it as uncertain.üîΩIt is not mentioned here.

original: de 'dir ni ma smos so zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir ni ma smos so zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This means that I have not taught it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su 'gal ba'i yul la mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gal ba'i yul la mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is impossible in the domain of the subsequent.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for a consequence that engages through the power of the fact.

original: ji ltar mi srid ce na /üîΩ'bras bu'am / rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar mi srid ce na / 'bras bu'am / rang bzhin nam /
translated: How is it impossible?üîΩIt is impossible for a consequence that engages through the power of the fact to have a reason that is contradictory, unestablished, or inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.

original: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid smos pa la 'gal ba mi srid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid smos pa la 'gal ba mi srid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa nyid ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin /üîΩde tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin /üîΩdmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /

translated: The reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.üîΩThe reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe reason is unestablished if the property of the subject is not established.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive if the reason is not a correct sign.

original: 'gal ba dag ni mtshan nyid smos @30b pa dang ldan pa de dag la mi srid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni mtshan nyid smos @30b pa dang ldan pa de dag la mi srid do //
translated: The reason is contradictory if the reason and the predicate of the probandum are contradictory.üîΩThe

original: 'di ltar shing sha pas shing nye bar bsgrub pa la mi mthun pa gang shing med pa la grub par byed pa ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gnyis pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar shing sha pas shing nye bar bsgrub pa la mi mthun pa gang shing med pa la grub par byed pa ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gnyis pa ni mi srid do //
translated: Thus, in the case of the proof of the tree by the ashen-colored tree, it is impossible for there to be a second that has the characteristics as stated, but which is established in the absence of the tree.

original: gal te mtshan nyid smos pa dang ldan pa gsum car la mi srid du zin na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid smos pa dang ldan pa gsum car la mi srid du zin na /
translated: If it is impossible for all three to have the characteristics as stated,

original: 'o na gzhan la srid par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan la srid par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it is possible for others.

original: de'i phyir mi 'khrul ba can gtan ni med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'khrul ba can gtan ni med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThere is no other that is non-erroneous.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gsum la ma gtags pa gang la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can srid par 'gyur ba'i 'khrul ba can gyi gtan tshigs gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum la ma gtags pa gang la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can srid par 'gyur ba'i 'khrul ba can gyi gtan tshigs gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other reason that is erroneous, but which is possible in the three reasons, where there is no contradiction with the non-erroneous.

original: gang gi phyir gsum po de dag la mi srid pa'i phyir dngos po ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang la 'brel ba'i tshad mas gtan la phab pa med pa de ni dngos po ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis zhugs pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsum po de dag la mi srid pa'i phyir dngos po ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang la 'brel ba'i tshad mas gtan la phab pa med pa de ni dngos po ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis zhugs pa zhes bya'o
translated: Because those three are impossible, it is called ‚Äúoperating by the power of not seeing a thing.‚Äù

original: // lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Relying on inference based on scripture‚Äù means

original: 'di la lung la brten pa'i yod pas 'di ni lung la brten pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la lung la brten pa'i yod pas 'di ni lung la brten pa ste /
translated: that this is based on scripture, because it exists in scripture.

original: gang du lung gi sgo sgo nas chos can dang / phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa gtan la 'bebs pa de ni phung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang du lung gi sgo sgo nas chos can dang / phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa gtan la 'bebs pa de ni phung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Where the subject, property of the subject, and so on are established by means of scripture, that is called ‚Äúinference based on a collection.‚Äù

original: de'i don dpyad pa dag la zhes bya ba ni lung gi don dpyad pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de'i don dpyad pa dag la zhes bya ba ni lung gi don dpyad pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In regard to the analysis of its meaning‚Äù means in regard to the analysis of the meaning of scripture.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can ni bsgrub pa'i skyon du bshad ces bya ba de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can ni bsgrub pa'i skyon du bshad ces bya ba de ni go sla'o //
translated: ‚Äú Nonerroneous contradiction is explained as a fault of the proof‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: gal te 'di rigs pa ma yin na de'i tshe lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la yang de ci'i phyir srid ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'di rigs pa ma yin na de'i tshe lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la yang de ci'i phyir srid ce na /
translated: If this is not a logical possibility, then why is it possible in the case of inference based on scripture?

original: bstan bcos byed pa rnams ni don rnams la 'khrul bas rang bzhin log par ston pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa rnams ni don rnams la 'khrul bas rang bzhin log par ston pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The response is: because it is possible that the authors of the treatises are mistaken about the meaning, and so they may teach the opposite of the essence.

original: bstan bcos byed pa thams cad ni de kho na mthong ba byung ba ma yin pas de rnams ni don kha cig dag la rang bzhin log par smra ba yang 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can gyi skabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa thams cad ni de kho na mthong ba byung ba ma yin pas de rnams ni don kha cig dag la rang bzhin log par smra ba yang 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can gyi skabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Since all authors of treatises are not seers of reality, it is possible that they may speak falsely about some things, and so there is a possibility of contradiction in the case of inference based on scripture.

original: gal te lung dang 'brel ba'i rjes su dpag pa la de yod pa nyid du 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te lung dang 'brel ba'i rjes su dpag pa la de yod pa nyid du 'dod na'o //
translated: If you accept that this is possible in the case of inference based on scripture,

original: 'o na lta dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na lta dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: then why do you not accept that it is possible in the case of inference based on the power of the thing?

original: de'i phyir / dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'dug pa bdag dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa dag la ni de mi srid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'dug pa bdag dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa dag la ni de mi srid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: to be the self, the effect, or nonobservation.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'dug pa dang gang dag yin pa de dag ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'dug pa rnams te /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'dug pa dang gang dag yin pa de dag ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'dug pa rnams te /
translated: Things that exist as they are are things that exist as they are.

original: 'dug pa ni rnam par gnas pa'o //üîΩbdag @31a * //
analyzed: 'dug pa ni rnam par gnas pa'o // bdag @31a * //
translated: To exist is to be present.

original: dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The term ‚Äúself, the effect, or nonobservation‚Äù is a compound.

original: bdag ni rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: Self is synonymous with nature.

original: ji ltar yang dag ba'i don du dngos po rnam par gnas pa de ltar rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs rnams rnam par 'jog pa gang dag yin pa de dag la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can lta gal srid /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag ba'i don du dngos po rnam par gnas pa de ltar rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs rnams rnam par 'jog pa gang dag yin pa de dag la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can lta gal srid /
translated: If things were present in reality just as they are posited to be by the reasonings called the nature, the effect, and nonobservation, then how could there be a contradiction in those reasonings?

original: 'dir dpe ni zhes bya ba ni lung la brten nas tshad ma ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni zhes bya ba ni lung la brten nas tshad ma ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the example is based on scripture, which demonstrates valid cognition.

original: gang zhig yul thams cad na gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can dang / cig car du mngon par 'brel pa de ni thams cad gnas pa zhes bya ba la yul thams cad du gnas pa dag ni yul thams cad ni gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang zhig yul thams cad na gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can dang / cig car du mngon par 'brel pa de ni thams cad gnas pa zhes bya ba la yul thams cad du gnas pa dag ni yul thams cad ni gnas pa rnams so //
translated: That which is present in all places and is related to itself and is simultaneously related to all of them is called present in all places. Those that are present in all places are present in all places.

original: de dag ni rang dang yang yin la 'brel pa can dag dang / dngos po gang zhig yul thams cad na gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can rnams dang / cig car du mngon par 'brel ba de ni thams cad na gnas yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rang dang yang yin la 'brel pa can dag dang / dngos po gang zhig yul thams cad na gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can rnams dang / cig car du mngon par 'brel ba de ni thams cad na gnas yin par mthong ste /
translated: Those are related to themselves and to all of them. That which is present in all places is seen to be related to all of them, such as the sky.

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, like space.

original: nam mkha'i ni yul thams cad na rnam par gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba dag dang mngon par 'brel te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ni yul thams cad na rnam par gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba dag dang mngon par 'brel te /
translated: Space is present in all places, related to itself and to all of them, such as the pot, and is related to them.

original: de ni thams cad na gnas pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni thams cad na gnas pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is held that it exists in all places.

original: tshig des ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshig des ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
translated: This statement shows the pervasion.

original: spyi yang yul thams cad na gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can dag dang cig car du 'brel to zhes bya ba ni spyi dang 'brel pa can gsal ba'i bye brag yul thams cad na yod pa de dag dang spyi ni cig car du 'brel te /
analyzed: spyi yang yul thams cad na gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can dag dang cig car du 'brel to zhes bya ba ni spyi dang 'brel pa can gsal ba'i bye brag yul thams cad na yod pa de dag dang spyi ni cig car du 'brel te /
translated: The universal is related to all its particulars simultaneously.

original: des ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: des ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
translated: This shows the property of the position.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the syllogism that has the characteristic of an inference based on the nature of things,

original: de dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin can tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i dang can de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin can tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i dang can de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe mere nature of being related to that which is related to it, which is restricted to the place where the property to be established exists.

original: de dang 'brel pa can rnams ni de dang 'brel pa can dag go //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can rnams ni de dang 'brel pa can dag go //
translated: ‚Äù That which is related to it is related to that.

original: de dang 'brel pa can rnams kyi rang bzhin tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de ni de dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i dang can no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can rnams kyi rang bzhin tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de ni de dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i dang can no //
translated: That which has the nature of following after the mere nature of those that are related to it is that which has the nature of following after the mere nature of those that are related to it.

original: 'brel pa can de dag gi yul ni de'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'brel pa can de dag gi yul ni de'i yul lo //
translated: The object of those that are related to it is its object.

original: de'i yul na 'dug pa ni de'i yul na 'dug pa'o //üîΩde ni de'i yul na 'dug pa yang yin la rang bzhin yang yin pas de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i yul na 'dug pa ni de'i yul na 'dug pa'o // de ni de'i yul na 'dug pa yang yin la rang bzhin yang yin pas de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That which is situated in its object is situated in its object.üîΩIt is that which is situated in its object and it is a nature, thus it is that which is situated in its object and is a nature.

original: de'i dngos po ni de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: Its state is the state of that which is situated in its object and is a nature.

original: 'brel pa @31b can gyi yul na nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'brel pa @31b can gyi yul na nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the state of being situated in the object of those that are related to it.üîΩIt is pervasion by the mere nature of that which is situated in its object.

original: thams cad du song ba kho nas 'brel pa can rnams khyab par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba kho nas 'brel pa can rnams khyab par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that it is pervasion by the mere nature of that which is situated in its object?

original: gang na gang med pa de ni de'i yul la bdag nyid kyis khyab par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang na gang med pa de ni de'i yul la bdag nyid kyis khyab par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which does not exist in some place does not pervade that place by itself.‚Äù

original: gang na gang med pa des ni de'i yul khyab par bya ba ji ltar nus /
analyzed: gang na gang med pa des ni de'i yul khyab par bya ba ji ltar nus /
translated: How can that which does not exist in some place pervade that place?

original: de'i yul zhes bya ba ni yul de gang gi yin pa de ni de'i yul lo //
analyzed: de'i yul zhes bya ba ni yul de gang gi yin pa de ni de'i yul lo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat place‚Äù is the place where that [quality] does not exist.

original: yul gang na de med na yul de 'brel pa can gang yin pa de khyab par bya ba mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul gang na de med na yul de 'brel pa can gang yin pa de khyab par bya ba mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If that place is connected with something, then it cannot pervade that place. This is the meaning.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba de ni go sla'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is the application of the reason of svabhƒÅva‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: da re zhig de ltar gzegs zan pa kha cig gis spyi ni thams cad kyi thams cad na gnas pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: da re zhig de ltar gzegs zan pa kha cig gis spyi ni thams cad kyi thams cad na gnas pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: Now, in this way, some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas have taught that universals do not exist in all places.

original: gzegs zan pa gzhan dag ni rten tsam la spyi thams cad gnas pa nyid yin pa kho nar 'dod de /
analyzed: gzegs zan pa gzhan dag ni rten tsam la spyi thams cad gnas pa nyid yin pa kho nar 'dod de /
translated: Other SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that universals exist in mere supports.

original: de'i lugs rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i lugs rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate their system, [the root text] states,

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The second syllogism is stated:

original: de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de ni go sla'o //
translated: That is easy to understand.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang zhig gang na mi dmigs pa de ni med de dper na 'ga' zhig na bum pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba de ni dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bsnyad pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang zhig gang na mi dmigs pa de ni med de dper na 'ga' zhig na bum pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba de ni dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bsnyad pa'o //
translated: Whatever is a perceptible object that is not perceived in a certain place does not exist there, for example, a pot is not perceived somewhere.

original: gsal ba'i bar rnams ni yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur spyi mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan rnams dang / gsal ba'i bar rnams ni gsal ba'i bar rnams te /
analyzed: gsal ba'i bar rnams ni yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur spyi mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan rnams dang / gsal ba'i bar rnams ni gsal ba'i bar rnams te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe universal is not perceived in the individual instances‚Äù means that the universal is not perceived in the other individual instances and in the individual instances.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa spyi ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa spyi ni mi dmigs so //
translated: The universal is a perceptible object, but it is not perceived in the individual instances.

original: des ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: des ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
translated: That indicates the property of the subject.

original: rgol ba des kyang rten tsam la thams cad na gnas pa nyid du brten to //
analyzed: rgol ba des kyang rten tsam la thams cad na gnas pa nyid du brten to //
translated: The opponent also infers that the universal exists in all the individual instances.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di dang rang bzhin de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub pa yin pas gcig la the tshom skyed par byed ces bya ba la bshad ma thag pa'i mi dmigs pas ni rten tsam la spyi thams cad na gnas pa nyid du sgrub par byed
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di dang rang bzhin de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub pa yin pas gcig la the tshom skyed par byed ces bya ba la bshad ma thag pa'i mi dmigs pas ni rten tsam la spyi thams cad na gnas pa nyid du sgrub par byed
translated: Since the non-observation and the nature of that object to be refuted are established as mutually exclusive, it is said that doubt is generated in regard to one of them.üîΩThe non-observation just explained establishes that the universal resides in mere substrates.üîΩThe previous reason establishes that it resides in all of them. Since these two establish mutually exclusive objects, they generate doubt in regard to one of them.

original: la / snga ma bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis ni thams cad kyi thams cad na gnas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub pa de gnyis ni gcig sel ba'i bar rnams ni spyi mi dmigs pa'i phyir rang gi rten tsam la thams cad na
analyzed: la / snga ma bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis ni thams cad kyi thams cad na gnas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub pa de gnyis ni gcig sel ba'i bar rnams ni spyi mi dmigs pa'i phyir rang gi rten tsam la thams cad na
translated: Since the non-observation of a universal is the reason, is the universal that resides in mere substrates the same in all or

original: gnas pa nyid gcig yin nam /üîΩ'o na te yul thams cad na rnam par gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa nyid gcig yin nam / 'o na te yul thams cad na rnam par gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: is it different in each?üîΩIf it is the same, then since it resides in all objects, it would follow that it is related to all of them.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad ni gnas pa zhig yin snyam na spyi gcig @32a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad ni gnas pa zhig yin snyam na spyi gcig @32a * //
translated: If it is different, then since it resides in all of them, it would follow that it resides in all of them.

original: la the tshom za bar byed do //
analyzed: la the tshom za bar byed do //
translated: Thus, doubt is generated in regard to one universal.

original: re zhig de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa 'dra ba dang bcas pa bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa 'dra ba dang bcas pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the inference for the sake of others, along with its similarity, has been taught.

original: de ci ste ci'i phyir dpe'i mtshan nyid ma bstan ce na /
analyzed: de ci ste ci'i phyir dpe'i mtshan nyid ma bstan ce na /
translated: Why is the definition of the example not taught?

original: de'i phyir / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum smos pa de tsam gyis rtogs pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum smos pa de tsam gyis rtogs pas /
translated: Because the three characteristics of the reason are stated, and by just that much,

original: dpe zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i lan lag ni logs shig na ci yang med de /
analyzed: dpe zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i lan lag ni logs shig na ci yang med de /
translated: the so-called example, which is a part of the proof, does not exist separately.

original: des na de'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu ma brjod pas bya ba smos so //
analyzed: des na de'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu ma brjod pas bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, since its definition is not stated separately, it is mentioned in the conclusion.

original: sngar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum smos pa gang yin pa'i tshul gsum po de de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum smos pa gang yin pa'i tshul gsum po de de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The three characteristics of the reason that were stated earlier, by just those three modes, the meaning to be proven is established.

original: de lta bas na dpe zhes bya bsgrub pa'i yan lag logs shig na med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na dpe zhes bya bsgrub pa'i yan lag logs shig na med de /
translated: Therefore, the so-called example, which is a part of the proof, does not exist separately.

original: de'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu ma brjod do //
translated: Therefore, its definition is not stated separately.

original: don go ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis dpe'i don yang go bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don go ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis dpe'i don yang go bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in order to understand the meaning means that the meaning of the example is understood through the reason.

original: ji ltar zhes /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes /
translated: How is that?üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.

original: gtan tshigs ni mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las log pa'i tshul du bye brag med par bshad pa zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩre zhig spyir na 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las log pa'i tshul du bye brag med par bshad pa zhes bya ba smos te / re zhig spyir na 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.üîΩThe phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshul dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las log pa zhes bya ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshul dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las log pa zhes bya ba'i tshul lo //
translated: The phrase the reason is explained as being the invariable concomitance with the property of the position and the absence of that from a locus that is contradictory to the property of the position.

original: yang bye brag ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gnyis na skye ba dang / de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan par bshad ces bya ba ni bye brag tu gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni skye ba'i yin par rab tu bstan par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang bye brag ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gnyis na skye ba dang / de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan par bshad ces bya ba ni bye brag tu gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni skye ba'i yin par rab tu bstan par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe arising of the effect is taught‚Äù means that the definition of the effect reason is taught to be the arising of the effect.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bsnyad par bya ba yin no zhes bshad do //üîΩde yang ston par byed pas zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bsnyad par bya ba yin no zhes bshad do // de yang ston par byed pas zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe mere nature is taught to be the pervasion‚Äù means that the definition of the nature reason is taught to be the mere pervasion.üîΩMoreover, the statement ‚Äúit is taught‚Äù means that the general definition or

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston par byed pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston par byed pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the specific definition is taught.

original: gang na du pa yod pa de na me yod la /
analyzed: gang na du pa yod pa de na me yod la /
translated: Where there is smoke, there is fire.

original: me med na du pa gang na yang med de /
analyzed: me med na du pa gang na yang med de /
translated: Where there is no fire, there is no smoke.

original: dper na tshad bang dang gzhan lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na tshad bang dang gzhan lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, it is like a kitchen and unlike elsewhere.

original: re zhig 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rung /
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rung /
translated: The general definition of the effect reason is as follows.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rung /üîΩ'di skad du rab tu bstan par bya'o zhes ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rung / 'di skad du rab tu bstan par bya'o zhes ston par byed pa ste /
translated: It is also the definition of the reason.üîΩIt is taught in this way: ‚ÄúIt is taught that the reason is present in similar instances and absent in dissimilar instances.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'di la mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par rab tu ston par byed pas gdon mi za bar tshang bang lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par rab tu ston par byed pas gdon mi za bar tshang bang lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In this way, it is taught that the reason is present in similar instances, and therefore it is said that it is like a pot.

original: gzhan du na mthun pa'i @32b phyogs la yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan du na mthun pa'i @32b phyogs la yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Otherwise, it could not be taught that the reason is present in similar instances.

original: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par brjod pas kyang gdon mi za bar chu lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par brjod pas kyang gdon mi za bar chu lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it is said that the reason is absent in dissimilar instances, and therefore it is said that it is like water.

original: gzhan du na ldog pa nyid ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ldog pa nyid ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it could not be taught that the reason is absent in dissimilar instances.

original: skye ba yang de bzhin du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba yang de bzhin du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Arising is also taught in the same way.

original: 'di ltar me yod na du ba yod pa ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar me yod na du ba yod pa ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin te /
translated: In this way, the presence of smoke where there is fire is the effect of fire.

original: de nyid rjod par byed pas na gang dang gang na du ba yod pa de dang de na gdon mi za bar me yod de /
analyzed: de nyid rjod par byed pas na gang dang gang na du ba yod pa de dang de na gdon mi za bar me yod de /
translated: Since that is what is being expressed, it is said that wherever there is smoke, there is fire.

original: dper na tshang bang la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na tshang bang la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is like a house, etc.

original: gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid yod la /
analyzed: gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid yod la /
translated: Where there is the state of being produced, there is the state of being impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa yang mi srid de /
translated: If there is no state of being impermanent, then the state of being produced is impossible.üîΩFor example, it is like a pot and space.

original: dper na bum pa dang nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid ji lta bar bstan par bya bar de ltar ston par byed de /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid ji lta bar bstan par bya bar de ltar ston par byed de /
translated: In this way, he teaches the general and specific characteristics of natural reasons just as they are.

original: 'dir yang gal te bum pa lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod par bstan par mi nus so ;
analyzed: 'dir yang gal te bum pa lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod par bstan par mi nus so ;
translated: Here, if one does not say ‚Äúfor example, a pot,‚Äù then at that time one cannot demonstrate that it exists in only a similar class.

original: / gal te nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na /
analyzed: / gal te nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na /
translated: If one does not say ‚Äúfor example, space,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ldog pa yang bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe ldog pa yang bstan par mi nus so //
translated: then at that time one cannot demonstrate the difference.

original: de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yang de bzhin du bstan par nus te /
analyzed: de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yang de bzhin du bstan par nus te /
translated: One can demonstrate the mere concomitance in that way.

original: 'di ltar gal te gang dang gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de dag de na gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa nyid yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gang dang gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de dag de na gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa nyid yod de /
translated: Thus, wherever there is action, there is definitely impermanence.üîΩ

original: dper na bum pa lta bu'o zhes ston par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dper na bum pa lta bu'o zhes ston par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, if you demonstrate that whatever is produced is necessarily impermanent, like a pot,

original: de tsam gyi rjes su 'brel pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rjes su 'brel pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: then at that time you have demonstrated the pervasion.

original: gzhan du na mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang / med par ji skad du smos pa'i rnam pa dag bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ston par byed pas /üîΩgal te tshang bang lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang / med par ji skad du smos pa'i rnam pa dag bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ston par byed pas / gal te tshang bang lta bu'o //
translated: Otherwise, you cannot demonstrate the existence and nonexistence of the property of the subject in the similar and dissimilar classes, respectively.

original: bum pa lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na /
analyzed: bum pa lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na /
translated: If you do not say, ‚ÄúIt is like a pot,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: then at that time you have not demonstrated the existence of the property of the subject in the similar class.

original: gal te yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ston par byed pas chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: gal te yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ston par byed pas chu lta bu'o //
translated: If you do not say, ‚ÄúIt is like water,‚Äù

original: nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes ma brjod na /
translated: or ‚ÄúIt is like space,‚ÄùüîΩthen at that time you have not demonstrated the nonexistence of the property of the subject in the dissimilar class.

original: de'i tshe ldog pa ma bstan pa kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ldog pa ma bstan pa kho na ma yin te /
translated: At that time, it is not just that the opposite is not taught.

original: de ltar re zhig spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus par bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus par bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is explained that the general characteristic cannot be taught.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid mi nus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid mi nus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the impossibility of the particular characteristic,

original: 'bras bu'i rtags ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'am zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'am zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe reason based on effect is the ascertainment of that as its effect.‚Äù

original: de'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: That which is its effect is its effectness.

original: de'i dngos po ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa ste /
translated: The state of that is the ascertainment of that as its effect.

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa @33a * //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa @33a * //
translated: When the cause exists, the effect exists.

original: nyid do zhes bya bar nges pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyid do zhes bya bar nges pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That ascertainment is called the ascertainment of that as its effect.üîΩThe reason based on nature is the pervasion by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyi rtags ni rang bzhin gyis khyab pa zhes bya ba la ngo bo nyid kyis khyab ba ni rang bzhin gyis khyab pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rtags ni rang bzhin gyis khyab pa zhes bya ba la ngo bo nyid kyis khyab ba ni rang bzhin gyis khyab pa ste /
translated: Pervasion by nature is pervasion by essence.

original: de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the mere engagement, that is the meaning.

original: de gnyi ga yang dpe bstan pa med par bstan par mi nus la /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang dpe bstan pa med par bstan par mi nus la /
translated: Both of those cannot be demonstrated without teaching an example.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad smos pa'i rig pa'i chos can 'ga' zhig la gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad smos pa'i rig pa'i chos can 'ga' zhig la gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: When the general definition of a reason is applied to any subject that is an object of knowledge, as has been explained, then the reason is either nonestablished, contradictory, or not included.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan par gyur pa de'i tshe dpe yang bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan par gyur pa de'i tshe dpe yang bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: When the general or specific characteristic of the logical mark is taught with regard to some subject of knowledge as it has been described, then the example is taught as well.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir de'i tshul ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshul ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause the method is just that much.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar de'i tshul ni de kho nar zad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshul ni de kho nar zad de /
translated: In this way, the method is just that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gang du 'ga' zhig ni bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro bar ston par byed pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: gang du 'ga' zhig ni bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro bar ston par byed pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: Where someone shows the pervasion of the logical mark by the probandum, that is the example of agreement.

original: gang na bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par ston par byed pa de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: gang na bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par ston par byed pa de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: Where someone shows the absence of the logical mark when the probandum is absent, that is the example of disagreement.

original: 'dis ni dpe'i nyes pa rnams kyang bsal ba yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'dis ni dpe'i nyes pa rnams kyang bsal ba yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe /
translated: This also eliminates faults of the example.

original: gang du gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: gang du gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: When the general or specific characteristic of the logical mark is taught with regard to some subject of knowledge as it has been described, then the example is taught as well.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston par byed pa de yang dag pa'i dpe yin no zhes brjod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston par byed pa de yang dag pa'i dpe yin no zhes brjod pa de'i tshe /
translated: The correct example is that which teaches the specific characteristic.
