original: gang gi mtshan nyid de gnyis ston par mi nus pa de ni dpe ltar snang ba yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi mtshan nyid de gnyis ston par mi nus pa de ni dpe ltar snang ba yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When this is stated, then that which is unable to teach the two characteristics is explained to be a seemingly correct example.

original: dpe rnams bstan pa dper na sgra ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: dpe rnams bstan pa dper na sgra ni rtag pa ste /
translated: The teaching of examples is as follows: Sound is permanent,

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not corporeal,üîΩlike an action, an atom, and a pot.

original: las dang rdul phra rab dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / gnyi ga med pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las dang rdul phra rab dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / gnyi ga med pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is said to be the probandum, the proving property, and the absence of both.

original: sgra ni rtag pa ste lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rtag pa ste lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is permanent, because it is not corporeal.

original: las gzhan no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa yin no //üîΩrdul phra rab bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos med pa yin no //
analyzed: las gzhan no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa yin no // rdul phra rab bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos med pa yin no //
translated: Like an action is said to be the absence of the probandum.üîΩLike an atom is said to be the absence of the proving property.

original: bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos gnyi ga med pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos gnyi ga med pa yin no //
translated: Like a pot is said to be the absence of both properties.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni / 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Likewise, there is doubt, etc. about the property to be established.üîΩThe sentence is to be analyzed as follows: ‚ÄúThere is doubt, etc. about the property to be established in this case.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos the tshom za ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos the tshom za ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Those which are doubt, etc. about the property to be established are so called.

original: dpe rnams bstan pa /
analyzed: dpe rnams bstan pa /
translated: The examples are shown.

original: dper na smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHe possesses attachment, etc. because he speaks,

original: lam bo @33b che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: lam bo @33b che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba yod pa'o //
translated: like a man on the highway,‚Äù this is doubt about the property to be established.

original: mi 'di ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i phyir 'chi ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: mi 'di ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i phyir 'chi ba'i chos can yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis man is subject to death because he possesses attachment,

original: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub pa'i chos la the tshom za ba mod pa'o //
analyzed: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub pa'i chos la the tshom za ba mod pa'o //
translated: like a man on the highway,‚Äù this is doubt about the property to be established.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
translated: He is not omniscient because he is possessed of attachment and so on,üîΩlike a man in the street.

original: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub pa'i chos la the tshom za ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub pa'i chos la the tshom za ba yod pa'o //
translated: This is a reason that is doubtful with regard to the property to be established.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of concomitance is that which has no concomitance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba rab tu ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang la rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang rab tu ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba rab tu ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang la rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang rab tu ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The nondemonstration of concomitance is that which has concomitance but is not demonstrated.

original: dpe bstan pa dper na gang smra ba de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa dper na gang smra ba de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The demonstration of an example is like the statement, ‚ÄúWhoever speaks is possessed of attachment and so on,üîΩlike a man in the street.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i mi bzhin zhes bya ba ni de la ni rjes su 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mi bzhin zhes bya ba ni de la ni rjes su 'gro ba med de /
translated: In this case there is no concomitance,

original: gang gis de la tshig dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po 'am rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba ni med do ;
analyzed: gang gis de la tshig dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po 'am rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba ni med do ;
translated: because there is no thing that pervades the speaker and attachment and so on, or the thing that is the cause and effect.

original: / sgra ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin zhes bya ba 'di la ni rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang rab tu ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / sgra ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin zhes bya ba 'di la ni rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang rab tu ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement, Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot, is an unestablished example, because although the pervasion is present, it is not stated.

original: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log ni zhes bya ba ni dpe dngos po 'am rgyu 'gro ba phyin ci log yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log ni zhes bya ba ni dpe dngos po 'am rgyu 'gro ba phyin ci log yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the pervasion is reversed means that the example, the entity or cause, has a reversed pervasion, as the words are to be connected.

original: dpe bstan pa gang mi rtag pa de ni byas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa gang mi rtag pa de ni byas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, Whatever is impermanent is produced, like that.

original: 'di la ni gang ni byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di la ni gang ni byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: In this case, it should be said, Whatever is produced is impermanent,

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni byas pa'o zhes log par smras so //üîΩchos mthun pas yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni byas pa'o zhes log par smras so // chos mthun pas yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: but it is wrongly stated as Whatever is impermanent is produced.

original: de dag thams cad ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: It is by similarity means that all of these are similar examples that appear to be correct.

original: chos mi mthun pas kyang zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang ba ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pas kyang zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang ba ston par byed pa'o //
translated: By dissimilarity means that it shows examples that appear to be correct by dissimilarity.

original: rdul phra rab dang las dang nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las mi ldog pa can dag yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang las dang nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las mi ldog pa can dag yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs
translated: Those that do not turn away from the object to be established, etc., are those that do not turn away from the object to be established, etc.

original: pa'o // de dag las mi ldog pa rnams ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las mi ldog pa rnams te /
analyzed: pa'o // de dag las mi ldog pa rnams ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las mi ldog pa rnams te /
translated: Those that do not turn away from those are those that do not turn away from the object to be established, etc.

original: de dag gang dag la yod pa de rnams ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las mi ldog pa can dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag gang dag la yod pa de rnams ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las mi ldog pa can dag yin no //
translated: Those that have those are those that do not turn away from the object to be established, etc.

original: de la rdul phra rab bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las log pa can yin te /
analyzed: de la rdul phra rab bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las log pa can yin te /
translated: Among them, like atoms is an example of one that turns away from the object to be established.

original: rdul phra rab rnams @34a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams @34a * //
translated: Atoms

original: ni rtag pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba las log ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: ni rtag pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba las log ba can ma yin te /
translated: are permanent, so they do not turn away from the object to be established.

original: las bzhin no zhes bya ba bsgrub pa las mi ldog pa can yin te /
analyzed: las bzhin no zhes bya ba bsgrub pa las mi ldog pa can yin te /
translated: Like action is an example of one that does not turn away from the object to be established.

original: las rnams ni lus can ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa las log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las rnams ni lus can ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa las log pa ma yin no //
translated: because actions are not corporeal, they do not revert from the accomplishment.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga las mi ldog pa can yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga las mi ldog pa can yin te /
translated: Like space, is one that does not revert from either,

original: nam mkha' las gnyi ga ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' las gnyi ga ma log pa yin no //
translated: because space does not revert from either.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa la the tshom za ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa la the tshom za ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, with regard to the doubt, etc., about the reversion from the probandum,

original: gang la bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar zhing /
analyzed: gang la bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar zhing /
translated: one should supply the words, ‚Äúwhere there is doubt about the reversion from the probandum. ‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa la the tshom za ba la sogs pa gang dag ;
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa la the tshom za ba la sogs pa gang dag ;
translated: Those that are the doubt, etc., about the reversion from the probandum,

original: yin pa zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: yin pa zhes bsdu'o //
translated: are the examples.

original: dpe rnams bstan pa dper na ser skya la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'am /
analyzed: dpe rnams bstan pa dper na ser skya la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'am /
translated: The examples are shown: For example, Kapila, etc., are not omniscient,

original: yid ches pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: yid ches pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis bkod pa yin no //
translated: or are not trustworthy, is the statement of two theses.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtags su 'gyur ba tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa la med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dag go //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi rtags su gyur pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtags su 'gyur ba tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa la med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dag go // thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi rtags su gyur pa /
translated: The reason for omniscience and freedom from attachment is the absence of the teaching of the perfection of valid cognition.üîΩThose that are absent in the teaching of the perfection of valid cognition are the reason for omniscience and freedom from attachment.

original: tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa la med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi rtags su 'gyur ba tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa la med pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa la med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi rtags su 'gyur ba tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa la med pa rnams so //
translated: The absence of those in the teaching of the perfection of valid cognition is the reason for omniscience and freedom from attachment.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: That very thing is its nature.

original: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi rtags su 'gyur ba tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi rtags su 'gyur ba tshad ma'i phul du phyin pa bstan pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is no teaching of the highest degree of valid cognition that would be a mark of omniscience and freedom from attachment,

original: 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni zhes bya ba ni brdar sprad par sla'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni zhes bya ba ni brdar sprad par sla'o //
translated: Here, the example of the dissimilar class is easy to understand.

original: gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'am /
translated: Whoever is omniscient

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba des ni skar ma shes pa la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba des ni skar ma shes pa la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: or free from attachment would teach astrology, etc.

original: dper na khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pa lta bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pa lta bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, like the bull, the lion, etc.

original: skar ma shes pa ni skar ma'i dpyad zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs te /üîΩbu l'u k'a m'a sha la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skar ma shes pa ni skar ma'i dpyad zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs te / bu l'u k'a m'a sha la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: Astrology is the reasoning called ‚Äúastrology.‚ÄùüîΩIt should be understood as the science of the stars, etc.

original: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dag gis rtags su gyur pa yin pa'i khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dag gis rtags su gyur pa yin pa'i khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the bull, the lion, etc., which are the marks of omniscience and freedom from attachment.

original: de'i phyir de dag thams cad mkhyen @34b pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag thams cad mkhyen @34b pa'am /
translated: Therefore, one can be convinced that he is omniscient

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par yid ches par nus so zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par yid ches par nus so zhe'o //
translated: or free from attachment.

original: chos kyi mi mthun pa'i dpe las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yid ches pa ma yin pa gnyis ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi mi mthun pa'i dpe las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yid ches pa ma yin pa gnyis ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The example of the contrary property is when one doubts the reversal of the probandum, omniscience, and non-convincibility, from the contrary property.

original: 'dir khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pa chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyid du bstan na /
analyzed: 'dir khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pa chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyid du bstan na /
translated: Here, if the supreme being, the son of a barren woman, etc. are taught as examples of contrary properties,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin pa ni de dag las log par nges pa med do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin pa ni de dag las log par nges pa med do //
translated: then omniscience and freedom from attachment are not ascertained as the reversal of those.

original: bsgrub pa las ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni de'i don ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: bsgrub pa las ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni de'i don ni go bar zad do //
translated: The doubt about the reversal of the probandum is self-explanatory.

original: dpe ni dper na gsum rig pa'i bram ze ni mi 'ga' zhig gi brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dpe ni dper na gsum rig pa'i bram ze ni mi 'ga' zhig gi brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: The example is like saying that the words of a Brahmin who knows the three Vedas should not be accepted by some people.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because they are associated with attachment and so on.

original: nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang snyan dngags kyi rig byed dang rig byed gsum po de dag la ni gsum gyi sgra brjod do //
analyzed: nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang snyan dngags kyi rig byed dang rig byed gsum po de dag la ni gsum gyi sgra brjod do //
translated: The three Vedas are the ·πög Veda, the Yajur Veda, and the SƒÅma Veda.

original: gsum rig pas gsum rig pa'o //
analyzed: gsum rig pas gsum rig pa'o //
translated: One who knows the three is a trivarga.

original: 'di la gzung bar bya ba'i tshig yod pas 'di ni gzung bar bya ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di la gzung bar bya ba'i tshig yod pas 'di ni gzung bar bya ba'i tshig ste /
translated: This is a word that is to be grasped, so it is a word that is to be grasped.

original: tshad mar byas pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshad mar byas pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means a word that is to be taken as authoritative.

original: des ni 'di skad du gsum rig pa'i bram ze gang yin pa des ni brjod par 'dod pa'i mi'i tshig rtag tu tshad mar mi bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du gsum rig pa'i bram ze gang yin pa des ni brjod par 'dod pa'i mi'i tshig rtag tu tshad mar mi bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that a brahmin who knows the three should not always take as authoritative the words of a human who wishes to express something.

original: 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni zhes bya ba de'i don ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni zhes bya ba de'i don ni go bar zad do //
translated: Here, the example of the dissimilar class is ‚Äúa word that is not to be grasped.‚Äù The meaning of that is understood.

original: tshig gzung bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: tshig gzung bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan te /
translated: Those words that are to be grasped are not associated with attachment and so on.

original: dper na goo ta ma la sogs pa chos kyi bstan bcos rnams byed pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni goo ta ma dang / drang srong rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gis chos kyi bstan bcos rnams byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dper na goo ta ma la sogs pa chos kyi bstan bcos rnams byed pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni goo ta ma dang / drang srong rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gis chos kyi bstan bcos rnams byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
translated: For example, the treatises on Dharma composed by Gautama and others.

original: gsum rigs pa'i bram ze rnams kyi tshig tshad mar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum rigs pa'i bram ze rnams kyi tshig tshad mar byas pa yin no //
translated: The treatises on Dharma composed by Gautama, Vyasa, and others are accepted as authoritative by the Brahmins who are of the three Vedas.

original: goo ta ma la sogs pa'i las sgrub pa'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: goo ta ma la sogs pa'i las sgrub pa'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Dharma of Gautama and others, which is connected with passion and so on, is doubtful in terms of turning away from action.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni de dag las log par nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni de dag las log par nges pa med do //
translated: One who is connected with passion and so on is not certain to turn away from those.

original: gnyi las ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni zhes bya ba ni gang la gnyi ga las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pa zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: gnyi las ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni zhes bya ba ni gang la gnyi ga las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pa zhes bsdu'o //
translated: Doubtful in terms of turning away from both is connected with both.

original: dpe ni dper na ser skya la sogs pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang / kun du 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe ni dper na ser skya la sogs pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang / kun du 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, Kapila and others, because they are connected with grasping and clinging,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste /üîΩyongs su 'dzin @35a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste / yongs su 'dzin @35a * //
translated: He is not free from attachment.

original: ni rdzas bdag gir byas ba'o //
analyzed: ni rdzas bdag gir byas ba'o //
translated: Grasping is the appropriation of a substance as one‚Äôs own.

original: kun du 'dzin pa ni bdag gir byas pa'i 'og tu zhen pa'o //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa ni bdag gir byas pa'i 'og tu zhen pa'o //
translated: Clinging is the attachment to what has been appropriated as one‚Äôs own.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa dag ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa dag ste /
translated: Grasping and clinging are grasping and clinging.

original: de dag dang ldan pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who possesses these is said to be one who grasps and clings.

original: 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni gang zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba de la ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni gang zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba de la ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa med do //
translated: Here, the example of the dissimilar class is this: One who is free from attachment does not grasp and cling.

original: dper na khyu mchog la sogs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na khyu mchog la sogs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, a bull, etc.

original: khyu mchog la sogs pa ni byin pa na cung zad kyang mi len te /
analyzed: khyu mchog la sogs pa ni byin pa na cung zad kyang mi len te /
translated: A bull, etc., does not take anything when given.

original: de'i phyir de dag la yongs su 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la yongs su 'dzin pa med de /
translated: Therefore, it does not grasp.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis kun du 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis kun du 'dzin pa med de /
translated: Because it does not grasp, it does not cling.

original: de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: It is free from attachment.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin pa la ldan pa dag khyu mchog la sogs pa las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin pa la ldan pa dag khyu mchog la sogs pa las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object to be accomplished, the means of accomplishing, the absence of freedom from attachment, the possession of appropriation and grasping, and the doubt about the reversal of being a bull, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of freedom from attachment is called the possession of attachment.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yang sems kyis bdag gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yang sems kyis bdag gir byed pa'o //
translated: Appropriation is the mental taking of something as one's own.

original: kun du 'dzin pa yang sred pa ste /
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa yang sred pa ste /
translated: Grasping is craving.

original: de dag thams cad ni sems la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni sems la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since all of these exist in the mind,

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: they are not the domain of the sense faculties.

original: de'i phyir khyu mchog la sogs pa las log pa nyid du nges par bya mi nus so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir khyu mchog la sogs pa las log pa nyid du nges par bya mi nus so ;
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to ascertain the reversal of being a bull, etc.

original: / ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la ldog pa med pas na zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: / ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la ldog pa med pas na zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase there is no reversal is to be analyzed as follows: there is no reversal here.

original: dper na smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba de ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: dper na smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba de ni don go bar zad do //
translated: For example, the statement ‚ÄúHe is not free from attachment because he speaks‚Äù is a valid proof.üîΩThe meaning is understood.

original: gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyid med pa de ni smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyid med pa de ni smra ba ma yin te /
translated: One who is not free from attachment does not speak,

original: dper na rdo'i dum bu bzhin zhes bya ba de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na rdo'i dum bu bzhin zhes bya ba de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: like a piece of stone. This is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: gal te rdo'i dum bu las gnyi ga log pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te rdo'i dum bu las gnyi ga log pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although both are absent in a piece of stone,

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nevertheless, it is not established that all who are not free from attachment do not speak.

original: ldog pa med ces bya ba ni gal te rdo'i dum bu la sems med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa med ces bya ba ni gal te rdo'i dum bu la sems med pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere is no pervasion‚Äù means that although a piece of stone does not speak because it is devoid of mind,

original: 'dod chags can la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / smra ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags can la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / smra ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: it is not established that all who are not free from attachment do not speak.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThere is no pervasion‚Äù means that although a piece of stone does not speak because it is devoid of mind,

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar khyab par mi sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar khyab par mi sgrub ste /
translated: it is not established that all who are not free from attachment do not speak.

original: 'dod chags can nyid dang / smra ba gnyis 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags can nyid dang / smra ba gnyis 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no connection between being passionate and speaking.

original: 'dod chags can nyid ldog pa na smra ba nges par zlog par byed pa ni ma yin @35b no ;
analyzed: 'dod chags can nyid ldog pa na smra ba nges par zlog par byed pa ni ma yin @35b no ;
translated: When being passionate is eliminated, speaking is not necessarily eliminated.

original: / de'i phyir dngos su na 'di la ldog pa med do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir dngos su na 'di la ldog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in reality, there is no elimination here.

original: ldog pa rab tu ma bstan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ldog pa rab tu ma bstan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe elimination is not indicated‚Äù means

original: gang la ldog pa yod bzhin du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ldog pa yod bzhin du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: that when elimination exists, it is not indicated.

original: dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa /
translated: The example is indicated:

original: chos mi mthun par dper na sgra ni byed pa'i phyir rtag pa ste /üîΩnam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos mi mthun par dper na sgra ni byed pa'i phyir rtag pa ste / nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, sound is permanent because it is produced, like space.‚ÄùüîΩThat is,

original: gang zhig chos mi mthun pa'i dper sgra ni ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig chos mi mthun pa'i dper sgra ni ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ste /
translated: if someone asserts that sound is permanent because it is unproduced,

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes rjod par byed na /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes rjod par byed na /
translated: like space,

original: des ni ldog pa yod bzhin du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni ldog pa yod bzhin du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: then he does not indicate the elimination, although it exists.üîΩThis is because if he says, ‚ÄúWhatever is permanent is unproduced, like space,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po ma lus par sdud pa gang dag rtag pa de dag ni ma byas pa lo zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po ma lus par sdud pa gang dag rtag pa de dag ni ma byas pa lo zhes brjod na /
translated: then he must also say, ‚ÄúWhatever is permanent is unproduced, like space.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ldog pa bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe ldog pa bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: At that time, the reversal is taught,

original: dpe tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not merely by an example.

original: ldog pa phyin ci log ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ldog pa phyin ci log ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase reversal that is erroneous

original: 'di la ldog pa phyin ci log yod ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la ldog pa phyin ci log yod ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: is to be analyzed as there is an erroneous reversal here.

original: dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa /
translated: The example is taught:

original: dper na gang ma byas pa de ni rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na gang ma byas pa de ni rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For example, what is not produced is permanent.

original: 'di la ni gang rtag pa de ni ma byas pa yin no zhes brjod bar bya ba las ldog par smras so //üîΩdpe ltar snang ba de dag gis ni gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med pa nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di la ni gang rtag pa de ni ma byas pa yin no zhes brjod bar bya ba las ldog par smras so // dpe ltar snang ba de dag gis ni gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med pa nyid dam /
translated: Here, it should be stated that what is permanent is not produced, but the opposite is said.üîΩBy those seemingly similar examples, the general characteristic of a reason cannot be taught as existing only in what is similar and not existing at all in what is dissimilar,

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or the specific characteristic.

original: dpe ltar snang ba de dag gis ni gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: dpe ltar snang ba de dag gis ni gtan tshigs kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Those pseudo-examples cannot demonstrate what the general characteristic of a reason is, nor what the specific characteristics are.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag dpe ltar snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag dpe ltar snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, they are called ‚Äúpseudo-examples.‚Äù

original: dpe dang 'dra bar snang bas na dpe ltar snang ba rnams so //
analyzed: dpe dang 'dra bar snang bas na dpe ltar snang ba rnams so //
translated: They are pseudo-examples because they appear to be like examples.

original: de'i phyir don gyi dbang gis de dag bsal bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi dbang gis de dag bsal bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that they are refuted by the power of fact.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa de dag gnyi gas kyang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ston par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa de dag gnyi gas kyang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ston par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because neither of those two can demonstrate the characteristic of a reason,

original: don gyi dbang gis na de dag bsal bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis na de dag bsal bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: therefore, they should be seen as refuted by the power of fact.

original: de ltar na re zhig yang dag pa'i shes pa 'dra ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig yang dag pa'i shes pa 'dra ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, correct knowledge together with its likeness has been explained.

original: de ni de'i gnyen po bshad par bzhed de /
analyzed: de ni de'i gnyen po bshad par bzhed de /
translated: Now, in order to explain its antidote,

original: ma tshang ba nyid la sogs par smras pa sun 'byin pa dag yin na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma tshang ba nyid la sogs par smras pa sun 'byin pa dag yin na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf the refutations are stated as incomplete, etc.‚Äù

original: ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those which are incomplete, etc., are the incomplete, etc.

original: de dag smras pa ni ma tshang ba nyid la sogs par smras pa ste /
analyzed: de dag smras pa ni ma tshang ba nyid la sogs par smras pa ste /
translated: The statement of those is the statement of the incomplete, etc.

original: de re re la sun 'byin pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: de re re la sun 'byin pa rnams yin no //
translated: Those are the refutations of each of those.

original: sngar bsgrubs pa'i skyon ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa smos pa gang dag yin pa de dag @36a * //
analyzed: sngar bsgrubs pa'i skyon ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa smos pa gang dag yin pa de dag @36a * //
translated: Those which were previously stated as the faults of the proof, the incomplete, etc.,

original: brjod pa ni sun 'byin pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brjod pa ni sun 'byin pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: are the refutations.

original: 'dir sogs pa zhes smos pas ni ma grub ba dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa dang / de'i skyon rnams yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'dir sogs pa zhes smos pas ni ma grub ba dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa dang / de'i skyon rnams yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the unestablished, the contradictory, and the uncertain, and their faults.

original: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ni tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ni tshig ste /
translated: Because it expresses those, the expression is the words.

original: tshig gang gis skyon rnams sgrogs par byed pa de ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gang gis skyon rnams sgrogs par byed pa de ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The words by which the faults are proclaimed are called the refutation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir des pha rol po'i 'dod pa'i don grub pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir des pha rol po'i 'dod pa'i don grub pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it obstructs the establishment of the desired object of the opponent.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir tshig des phyogs snga ma pas sgrub par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa la gegs byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig des phyogs snga ma pas sgrub par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa la gegs byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because that statement obstructs the establishment of the meaning that the opponent wishes to prove,

original: de ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore it is called a refutation.

original: re zhig de dag ni yang dag pa'i sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni yang dag pa'i sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: These are correct refutations.

original: sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba dag ni ltag chod rnams te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba dag ni ltag chod rnams te /
translated: The rejoinders are false refutations.

original: ltag chod rnams ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltag chod rnams ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rejoinders should be understood as false refutations.

original: yang ltag chod de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang ltag chod de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what are those rejoinders?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon rjod pa dag ni ltag chod pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon rjod pa dag ni ltag chod pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te / de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang yin la /
translated: The rejoinders are the expression of false faults.

original: skyon yang yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon rnams so //
analyzed: skyon yang yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon rnams so //
translated: They are not correct and they are faults, thus they are false faults.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'o //
translated: False means untrue.

original: de dag brjod pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon rnams brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag brjod pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon rnams brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression of them is the expression of false faults.

original: tshig gang gis sgrub pa'i skyon med bzhin du brjod pa de dag ni ltag chod pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gang gis sgrub pa'i skyon med bzhin du brjod pa de dag ni ltag chod pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those who, in the face of such refutations, still insist on their position should be regarded as incorrigible.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i skabs yin na /üîΩci'i phyir sun 'byin pa dag de ltar snang ba ston ce na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i skabs yin na / ci'i phyir sun 'byin pa dag de ltar snang ba ston ce na /
translated: Now, since this is the section on right knowledge,üîΩwhy do you present refutations that are so obviously wrong?

original: lan btab pa dag dang / sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba dag bstan na /
analyzed: lan btab pa dag dang / sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba dag bstan na /
translated: Having presented refutations that are so obviously wrong,

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa de dag gnyen po dang bcas par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa de dag gnyen po dang bcas par bstan pa yin te /
translated: you have revealed your right knowledge along with its antidote.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni 'di la sun 'byin pa yin pas de dag yongs su spangs te bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni 'di la sun 'byin pa yin pas de dag yongs su spangs te bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For you have said, ‚ÄúThese are refutations of the opponent‚Äôs position, so they should be practiced by abandoning them.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe 'di dag ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin pas de dag gis mi 'jigs par rig par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin pa de'i tshe yang dag ba'i shes pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du bstan par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di dag ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin pas de dag gis mi 'jigs par rig par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin pa de'i tshe yang dag ba'i shes pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du bstan par 'gyur bas /
translated: And when you say, ‚ÄúThese are obviously wrong refutations, so you should not be afraid of them,‚Äù you have revealed right knowledge in all its aspects.

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the absurd consequence that you attribute to us does not follow.

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa tshig re rnams phye bas //
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa tshig re rnams phye bas //
translated: The drops of reasoning, each word of which is analyzed,

original: dag ba rgya chen de thob gang yin des //
analyzed: dag ba rgya chen de thob gang yin des //
translated: By which one attains that vast purity,

original: 'gro kun rigs pa'i bdud rtsi thob gyur nas //
analyzed: 'gro kun rigs pa'i bdud rtsi thob gyur nas //
translated: May all beings attain the nectar of reasoning

original: srid pa'i rgya mtsho zad par byed par shog / rigs pa ji bzhin rigs pa yi //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgya mtsho zad par byed par shog / rigs pa ji bzhin rigs pa yi //
translated: And thereby exhaust the ocean of existence.

original: rgyal po 'dod nas rigs thogs kyi //
analyzed: rgyal po 'dod nas rigs thogs kyi //
translated: Having desired the reasoning king in accordance with reasoning,üîΩI, ≈öƒÅntarak·π£ita,

original: rgya cher 'grel pa dul ba'i lhas //
analyzed: rgya cher 'grel pa dul ba'i lhas //
translated: Have composed this extensive commentary

original: slob ma la phan bskyed phyir byas //
analyzed: slob ma la phan bskyed phyir byas //
translated: For the benefit of my disciples.

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa rgya cher @36b 'grel pa slob ma la phan pa las le'u gsum pa'o /
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa rgya cher @36b 'grel pa slob ma la phan pa las le'u gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter from the extensive commentary on the Drop of Reasoning, Beneficial to Beginners.

original: // / rgya cher 'grel pa'i gzhung tshad ni /
analyzed: // / rgya cher 'grel pa'i gzhung tshad ni /
translated: The extent of the text of the extensive commentary:

original: shlo ka chig stong dag dang ni //
analyzed: shlo ka chig stong dag dang ni //
translated: One thousand ≈õlokas

original: de bzhin shlo ka sum cur ni //
analyzed: de bzhin shlo ka sum cur ni //
translated: And likewise thirty ≈õlokas

original: yongs su bsdoms te mngon par brjod //
analyzed: yongs su bsdoms te mngon par brjod //
translated: Are fully included and expressed.

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob ma la phan pa zhes bya ba slob dpon dul ba'i lhas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob ma la phan pa zhes bya ba slob dpon dul ba'i lhas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The extensive commentary on the Drop of Reasoning, called Beneficial to Beginners, composed by Master ≈öƒÅntarak·π£ita, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
translated: The Indian abbot Jinamitra and the great editor Yeshe De and others translated and edited it and finalized it.
